loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man with five unemployed children. He has been working in furniture making for the past fifteen years. He makes furniture designs such as salons, bedrooms, etc., and he has also specialized in carving the furniture.

Ali likes his job because in his opinion it's an art and he's thankful for it; it allows him to raise his five children and provide a good life situation for them.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. wood to offer a variety of products and attract business from his clients.

loans.use: To buy additional wood

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

Gladis nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo aumentar su capital para iniciar su negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar una vaca, la cual venderá posteriormente.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y poner una tienda de abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y los temas educativos que imparte la promotora de crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladis has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Calceteras” for three years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Gladis is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She has a fifth grade education and makes her living by buying and selling livestock.

Gladis says that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her capital for starting her business. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy a cow that she will sell afterwards. Her dreams for the future are to improve her business and open a grocery store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the educational seminars provided by her loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. S. was born in 1950 and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She has a partner in her husband who is a disabled person who stays at home to do the housework. This old couple is married and is blessed with a daughter. Their child helps to contribute to the family by working in the garment factory.

To earn a living, S. always relies on using her old bicycle to transport the used-goods that she buys going door-to-door around the commune and which she then resells to gain income. She will take out her loan to improve her used-goods enterprise.

loans.use: To improve her used-goods enterprise

loans.name: Purificación

texts.es:
La  Sra. Purificación es Viuda y tiene 4 hijo de los cuales 2 ya están casados  y 2 aun están en la escuela primaria, viven el barrio Fátima de Ciudad del Este.

Purificación  tiene una despensa bien surtida y de buena ubicación en el barrio. Ya que se encuentra a una cuadra de la universidad nacional. Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. Hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y buenos precios, con una clientela formada.
Mediante su trabajo y la ayuda de sus hijos quienes son muy trabajadores ella puede cubrir todos los gastos del hogar.

En esta ocasión se solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías que le hace falta en su negocio como azúcar, fideos, aceites  y otros.
texts.en:
Purificación is a widow and has four children. Two of them are already married and the other two are still in school. The family lives in the Fatima neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, Paraguay. Purificación owns a small but well-stocked grocery store in her neighborhood. It is in a good location, just a block from a public university. She began her business several years ago with just a few products and has increased her stock of merchandise bit by bit over the years. Today she sells a large variety of products at good prices and has a steady base of customers. Thanks to her hard work and the help provided to her by her children, who are also very hard-working, she is able to provide for her family. Purificación is asking for this loan to buy merchandise that she needs for her store, such as sugar, pasta, cooking oil and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: sugar, rice, pasta, soaps and other products.

loans.name: Aramatou

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 4 enfants Madame Aramatou Kanté est âgée  de 35 ans et vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Darsalam II de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) avec son mari, sa co-épouse et leurs enfants. 
N’ ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école,  Aramatou  n’a pas pris du temps pour embrasser le commerce depuis à bas âge, auprès de sa maman.  Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour l’achat et la vente des tissus  et divers autres articles depuis maintenant 10 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle vend une grande quantité d’articles dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, elle décida de  faire recours à l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Après  6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement, elle est à son 1er prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce  financement  elle  compte acheter, 20 pièces de tissus  à Bamako et à Bobo (Burkina Faso). Elle effectue sa vente dans la ville  de Koutiala  à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes,  au comptant ou à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of four children, Ms. Aramatou Kanté is 35 years old and lives in a polygamous family in the Darsalam II district of Koutiala Prefecture (region of Sikasso) with her husband, her co-wife, and their children.  Not having had the chance to attend school, she wasted no time embracing commerce at an early age at her mother's side.  After having operated in several kinds of businesses unsuccessfully, she finally opted for buying and selling cloth and various other items about ten years ago now.  Her fame is great because she sells a large quantity of goods in a month.  To satisfy her customers properly with regard to quantity and quality, she decided to turn toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago.  After six solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is now on her first individual loan.  With this financing, she intends to buy twenty bolts of cloth in Bamako and in Bobo (Burkina Faso).  She sells, cash or credit accepted, in Koutiala City to a customer base composed of women and men.  Aramatou plans on making a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that she envisions using for repaying the Soro Yiriwaso loan, for taking part in covering the day-to-day expenses of the family, and for investing the rest in her business.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Rael Chesang

texts.en:
Rael Chesang K. is a married woman of 38 and a mother of four beautiful children. She lives in Lemoru in Eldoret where she is a farmer in the same area. She specializes in planting maize for resale. She also has a secondary business in dairy farming where she sells milk to her customers from the same area and neighboring areas.

Rael was introduced to KADET by another existing client. This will be Rael's first loan with KADET, and she plans to buy farm inputs like maize seedlings, fertilizer and also pay for the labor for the people who help in digging the farm. 

Rael's dream is to expand in farming, own a tractor to help with digging the farm, and also educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, maize seedlings

loans.name: Mr. Vai Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Chheu Teal village, in Kandall province, there are fourteen people who are taking out a village bank loan. Mr. Vai S. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. He and his wife, Mrs. Sok Lorn K., are farmers who own a  one-hectare plot of land to grow rice and vegetables to sell to support their family living.

Their problem is that their field is ready for farming, but they did not have enough money. So to improve production, Mr. Vai S. is requesting a loan to do farming. He is a father of seven children: two are farmers, four are attending a local public school, and the last is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Rahesudin Shams Group

texts.en: Rahesudin is a member of 'Rahesudin Shams' group. He lives in district 16, Kabul, Afghanistan in the Qala-e-A. Khan area. He lives in a household of seven members. He has got a tailoring business inside his house. He sews various men's clothes. He needs the loan to purchase a new sewing machine, besides, he would like to progress his business and he hopes to have a shop instead of working out of his house.

loans.use: purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kankalay Group

texts.en:
These are the members of Kankalay Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the small town of Waterloo who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and make better profits. 

Sarah K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. She is 43 years of age, married to a military officer, and they have six children.

Sarah sells rice, sugar, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), etc., and she has been running this business for six years now. With the help of this loan, Sarah will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and palm-oil wholesale

loans.name: Ritza Zulema

texts.es:
la sra. Ritza Zulema O. es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la venta de mangos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Choluteca, Ritza se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para salir a vender sus mangos y en las tardes compra los del dia siguiente.
doña Ritza es madre de 2 hijos, los tiene estudiando en una escuela publica de el barrio en donde vive.
doña Ritza en sus tiempos libres se dedica a visitar la iglesia,  ella y su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus hijos.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mangos al por mayor y asi tener guardados en su casa para no salir a comprar todos los dias, con esto se ahorrara gastos y asi tendra mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ritza Zulema O. is a hard-working woman who sells mangoes in different areas of the city of Choluteca. Ritza gets up at 6am every day to go sell her mangoes, and in the afternoon she buys mangoes for the next day. She is a mother of two children, who are studying in a public school in her neighbourhood. In her free time Ritza goes to church. She and her husband work hard to get their children ahead. She will use this loan to buy more mangoes wholesale to keep in her home so that she does not have to go out to purchase them every day. With this she will save on costs and also have more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of mangoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Señora Julia es cliente antigua anteriormente trabajo en la garantia cruzada UVITAS pero ahora esta trabajando de forma individual, ella lleva siendo cliente de Emprender desde el año 2004, durante todo este tiempo la cliente a demostrado ser una persona responsable y puntual con vision de superacion. La cliente vive en anticretico, comparte vivienda con su hija quien esta estudiando en la Universidad Mayor de San Andres en la carrera de Economia.  El credito estara destinado a la compra de vajilla por mayor para luego ser empaquetada como regalo y poder ser comercializado en las puertas de los salones de fiestas, a la Sra.le va muy bien con esta actividad y esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a long time client who previous worked with the UVITAS solidarity group, but is now working as an individual. She has been a client of Emprender since 2004. During that time, Julia has proven herself to be a responsible and punctual person with the vision to excel. She lives in an “anticrético” property. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) Her daughter lives with her and is studying for a degree in Economics at the Greater University of San Andres.

This loan will be used to buy dishware in bulk that she will package as gifts and then sell at the entrances of banquet halls. Sra. Julia has done very well in this business and is very grateful to Emprender for providing this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishware to sell as gifts

loans.name: Margaret Nancy

texts.en:
Margaret Nancy A. is 39 years old and a happily married woman. She has three children whom she is assisting her husband in taking care of. Previously, she used to operate a fishing boat business but due to its demands in terms of time commitment, she decided to quit and start a new venture with a 14-seat passenger service vehicle in the year 2009. 

Due to the business’ legal requirements, she has applied for a loan worth 30,000 Kenyan shillings to settle the log-book issue of her vehicle so that it can start its operation and generate income. Her future plan is to buy another passenger-service vehicle to broaden her income base and improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To settle log book issues

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en: Ernelyn C. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Ernelyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Ernelyn buys and sells fruits like mangoes and wild red berries in the local community. Ernelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ernelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ernelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice L. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal.  

Joice is 67 years old and is widowed. She has eight children, and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal at her home

loans.name: Tongi

texts.en:
Tongi is a water vendor in Kayaba village, a slum in the Jogoo Road area. He also owns rental houses in the village so as to supplement his income. The slum setting favors his business.  

He has engaged in the business for eight years. Faulu Kenya has taught him how to be tolerant to customers and budget well for his business. He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy water pumps and water pipes.  He sees himself becoming successful in five years.

loans.use: To buy water pumps and water pipes

loans.name: Olin

texts.es: Olin, de 21 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado con Yeny, de 19 años, producto de su gran amor nació Oliver de 3 meses de nacido; los tres viven en su casa alquilada ubicada en la selva peruana (Comunidad Nativa Centro Punpuriani).Todas las mañanas, desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a su terreno de cultivo, donde cuida su cultivo de plátanos y yuca; que hace dos años viene plantando con mucho esmero y cuidado. Muy pronto empezará la cosecha para luego ser vendidos a los comerciantes que vienen constantemente a la comunidad. lo que más le gusta de sembrar es poder ver como su esfuerzo tiene buenos resultados y pesar de tener poco tiempo en la agricultura a Olin le va muy bien, ya tiene 3 cuadras de terreno listos para ser sembrados, ahí sembrara café y muy pronto construirá una casa para su esposa e hijo. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está contento de integrarse a su banco comunal ya que le dio la oportunidad de poder crecer e invertir. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para las 3 cuadras de cultivo que esta sembrando.
texts.en: 21 year old Olin is a good and hardworking man. He is married to 19 year old Yeny, and the result of their great love, Oliver, was born 3 months ago. The three live in a rented house in the Peruvian jungle (Comunidad Nativa Centro Punpuriani). every morning, in the first hours of the day, he goes to work his land, where he grows bananas and yucca. He planted his land two years ago with great care and effort. They will soon start harvesting and then sell the produce to buyers who come to the community all the time. What he likes most about farming is to see that his efforts have good results, and even though he has been in farming for only a short time, Olin is doing very well. He already has 3 more blocks of land ready to be planted, where he will sow coffee and very soon he will build a house for his wife and son. This is his first loan from MFP and he is happy to be part of the community bank as it gives him the opportunity to grow and invest. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the three blocks of land that he is planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.name: Jesusema

texts.en:
Jesusema P. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 56 years old. Jesusema is married and has 11 children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She works hard to provide for her big family. She hopes for her harvest to increase so she can also earn more.

Jesusema joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Fifamè Georgette

texts.fr: V. Fifamè Georgette est née le 25 Avril 1979 à Akpakpa - Dodomey l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Georgette est mariée à AHOUANYA Modeste, un architecte.  Le couple a trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. Georgette assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Georgette a très peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture, activité qu’elle exerce depuis huit ans environs. En plus de la couture, Georgette vend des produits de merceries (boutons,  popelines, élastiques, fermeture, etc.) qu’elle achète à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. C’est pour le renforcement de son activité et la satisfaction de la demande de sa clientèle en produits de mercerie, que Georgette sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier crédit.
texts.en:
V. Fifamè Georgette was born on April 25, 1979 in Akpakpa - Dodome, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she has lived since birth.  She is married to AHOUANYA Modeste, an architect.  The couple have three children, who are all in school. Together with her husband, Georgette ensures that the different family expenses are covered. 

Georgette had very little schooling but learned how to sew.  This is work she has been doing for about eight years. In addition to sewing, she sells sewing supplies (buttons, poplins, elastic items, zippers, etc.) that she purchases at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To bolster her business and to satisfy the demands of her customers for sewing supplies, Georgette is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buying sewing supplies to sell

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.en:
Anacleto O. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 53 years old. Anacleto is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Anacleto owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Anacleto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anacleto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anacleto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Anacleto is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anacleto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Melagresa

texts.en:
Melagresa T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Melagresa is single. To make a living, Melagresa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling lotions, perfumes & deodorants from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Melagresa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melagresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melagresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melagresa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melagresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 30-year-old man, married to a teacher with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children. He is into motorcycle transport and has been in the sector for six years. He is still reaping tangible results and has an ambition to have at least three motorcycles. Andrew needs the credit to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Desde hace 02 años trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, con su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en su negocio confección de ropa deportiva.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en telas, hilos y cierres, la señora vente buzos, camisetas, polos, trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su visión en el negocio es tener más maquinarias, una empresa de confección de buzos.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the May 3rd II Communal Bank in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two dependent children. Rosa completed her higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN and invested in her business of making sportswear.

Rosa’s new loan is in the amount of 1000 PEN and will be invested in fabrics, thread, and fasteners. She sells sweatshirts, T-shirts, and polo shirts. Rosa and her husband work together.

Her vision with her business is to acquire more machines and become a company that manufactures track suits. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loans and the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, and fasteners for making sportswear

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda G. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 30 years old. Glenda is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Glenda is just starting this business.

In 2010, Glenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Glenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn B., 32, is from Villar, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Melvin B. and they are blessed with three children, John Mark (8 years old), John Michael (5 years old) and John Melvin (3 years old).

Genelyn has a hog-fattening business while her husband works as a laborer. They help each other to earn an income in order to address the growing needs of the family. They want to make a small investment while their children are still young because, according to them, when their children get older, their needs will grow bigger.

Genelyn has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she is applying for a new loan of PHP 4,000. This amount will be used to buy feed for her piglets.

She dreams that all of their children will complete their studies through college so that they will get good jobs. She also hopes some day to have a variety store in their village to have more income.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Annah Wairimu

texts.en:
Annah Wairimu N. is 55 years old, and a single mother with three school-going children. For the past twelve years, she has run a hotel on a rental property.

She learned about KADET LTD from KADET staff during their widespread advertising campaign. This will be her second loan which Annah will use to equip the hotel. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house and educate her children.

Annah hopes to create a good environment and better standard of living for her family. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her objectives if supported financially.

loans.use: To equip the hotel, by buying assorted items like rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Yordy Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Yordy,  tiene como actividad la fabricación de peluches  hechos a mano,  como ser ositos, perritos y conejitos,  esta actividad la desarrolla artesanalmente en su hogar, el es una persona joven y emprendedora esta ocasión solicita crédito para comprar dos maquinas de cocer industriales para mejorar su producción y a la ves diversificar su actividad, de esta manera el ayuda a su familia que esta compuesta por el y su pequeña hija, su esposa se encuentra en el interior del país por esta razón el vive junto a su mamá, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora con ganas de superación, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito
texts.en:
Mr. Yordy makes hand-made stuffed animals such as teddy bears, puppies and bunny rabbits.  He produces his crafts in his home.  He is a hard-working, enterprising young man who plans to use the loan to buy two industrial sewing machines so he can improve production and diversify business.  This way he will be able to help his family which is comprised of his young daugther and his wife, who lives further inland, so he lives with his mother.

He is very responsible and earnest about getting ahead.  He is grateful to the institution for the support he has been given in the way of this loan.

loans.use: To buy two industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Grace Wachuka

texts.en:
Grace has practised farming in Ndunyu, Njeru town for the last 4 years.  She is 36 years old, married to John Kerenge, and they have six children.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy another dairy cow.

In future, Grace hopes to grow her dairy farm and become a leading supplier of dairy products in Ndunyu, Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina Ruíz C. quien quedó embarazada a muy temprana edad, debió asumir son rol con gran responsabilidad pues además de terminar sus estudios en el colegio debía trabajar para cubrir los gastos de su bebé y los suyos, fue entonces cuando decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancía. 

En el futuro Diana espera ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, por ello, espera convertir su negocio que actualmente es en su propia casa en un local reconocido. 

Actualmente esta madrea cabeza de hogar necesita de un préstamo para comprar más mercancía y así ofrecer mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Diana Carolina Ruíz C. became pregnant at a very early age and had to show a lot of responsibility as well as finish her studies at high school.  She had to work to cover her baby's expenses, as well as her own.  It was then she decided to work selling merchandise.  In the future, Diana hopes to offer her daughter a better quality of life.  For this reason she hopes to move her business from her home to a known shop.  Currently, this single mother needs a loan to buy more merchandise and be able to offer a greater variety of products and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Lider Hermognes

texts.es:
Lider Hermognes R. M. tiene 33 años, es soltero vive con los padres y un hijo, en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Lider se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca, plátano, soya los productos las compras en Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es educar al hijo y ver que sea un buen profesional.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Lider Hermognes R. M. is 33, single, and he lives with his parents and a son in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The members of the communal bank La Soledad are in  El Tambo which is part of the Chillanes canton.  This branch has 12 members who are farmers and they grow cacao, rice, corn, and yucca as well as raise poultry such as hens and ducks.

Lider farms and plants cacao, rice, corn, yucca, plantains and soy beans which he buys in Chillanes and in El Tambo and sells at the Sunday market in Chillanes.

He is requesting a loan to buy products for cultivation such as fertilizer and manure.  With the financing he will be able to have the help he needs.  He fights problems such as infestations and disease and the variations in the weather.  His dream is to educate his son and see that he becomes a professional.

Lider likes to watch television.

loans.use: To buy products for farming such as fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en: F. Kurbon is married and has four children. He is a hardworking and honest man engaged in a pharmacy business. He works very hard because he is the only breadwinner in his family; his wife is a housewife. He must earn money for feeding his family and for the education of his children. He serves his clients with love and wishes them to be healthy. Kurbon would like to get a loan of 1,300 USD for purchasing medicine to increase his assortment of goods, which will allow him to get a good profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy medicine to increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Rosadelima

texts.en:
R. lives in the village of Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, married and has two grown children. For the last 20 years, she has made a living by selling cosmetics and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from her work. R. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business, and is applying for her second loan, for 6,000 PHP, to buy more products to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income she earns to continue improving her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 23 years old and single.  He does farming to earn a living.  He has been farming for three years and employs two people on his farm.  Apart from farming, he also has a motorbike transport business.  Previously, he operated a kiosk.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Bernard's living standards have improved.  He hopes to have a well-established business in the future.  He has requested a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 33 years old, married and blessed with a five-year-old child who goes to school.   He runs his business in the Githurai area in Nairobi, capital city of Kenya.  He has been in the business of supplying stationery for five years.  

Douglas also works as a freelance researcher to generate extra income.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya because he has grown his business hence improving his financial status.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to expand his business by adding more stationery.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business further and become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stationery.

loans.name: Rosary

texts.en:
Rosary is a married lady and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 30 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Osamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rosary owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of PHP 12,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for two years.

Rosary requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

Rosary has been a good member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Rosary wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 32 años, casado con Noemí de 25 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos siendo la mayor Emily de 7 años y Ander de 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Daniel es un joven con mucha visión de por medio, además le gusta explorar cosas nuevas. Recuerda que su primer trabajo y del que hasta hoy tiene vigente es su establecimiento de bebidas alcohólicas. Con el tiempo logró posicionarse en su localidad y ser el más concurrido. Daniel dice que para tener un negocio exitoso la clave esta en saber tratar al cliente dar lo que ellos buscan, por otro lado cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y eso le facilita más las cosas al momento de atender a los clientes. Este es su primer crédito  con MFP, por el que se compromete hacer puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Daniel es la persona que más aportes da en su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea comprar más bebidas alcohólicas y gasificadas.
texts.en: Daniel is 32 years old and he is married with Noemi, 25 years old. Their two children is the fruit of their relationship. Emily is 7 years old and Ander is 5 years old. They live in their own home located in the community of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. Daniel is a young man with a vision and he also enjoys exploring new things. He remembers his first job that led to the business he has today, a liquor store. With time he was able to establish himself in his neighborhood, the best traveled community. Daniel says that the key to having a successful business is known how to serve the client and to provide them with what they seek. He also enjoys help from his wife and it helps to have everything ready when attending the clients. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) but he is committed to making his loan payments. Daniel is a member that contributes the most in his communal bank. With the 1000 nuevos soles he will purchase more alcoholic and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase alcoholic and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elsy Orely

texts.en: Elsy lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she earns a living by making cheese and tortillas as well as selling freshly made food. She has a loyal customer base within her village and has seen her business grow. Elsy is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras to purchase ingredients for making cheese and cooking food.

loans.use: to purchase corn, tomatoes, peppers, onions, carrots, cucumbers, meat, milk, firewood, lime and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 26 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child. She sells goods such as Irish potatoes and bananas. She has three years of experience in her business and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. Jeanne currently employs one person to help her.

Jeanne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand the inventory of her goods (Irish potatoes and bananas). With the profits, Jeanne will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old, married, and not yet blessed with children. He runs a carpentry service, and has been in this business for the last five years. He earns a monthly income of  KES. 8,500.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He is applying for his third loan of KES.40,000 from KADET, which he plans to use to buy a circular saw, timber, and many other supplies. He will use the extra profit to open a big showroom for furniture at Mlolongo.

loans.use: To buy a circular saw and timber.

loans.name: Handmaa

texts.en: Handmaa is 41 years old and lives with her two children in an apartment in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. She used to work at the blanket factory in South Korea. She started her business by sending blankets to Mongolia from South Korea. She has successfully expanded her business since her arrival. Now she sells home products and goods at the Naran market. She is planning to increase the number and variety of products. This is her first time cooperating with the bank. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy more goods and expand her business activity.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Nonie

texts.en:
Nonie is married with four children.  Nonie is 42 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Philippines.

To earn a living, Nonie has a backyard piggery and has had this type of business for two years. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 every two months. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase medicine and feed for raising pigs.

Nonie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 11 months.  In the future, Nonie hopes to finish her children's education (they are now studying in college) and gain more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and feed for pigs

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en: Fatema is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. She lives in Khanyounis city in Gaza located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Fatema has a project of having chairs to rent to wedding parties, which is another source of income for the family. She wants to increase the number of chairs she has because of the high customer demand for renting chairs for their parties in this season. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Fatema gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase chairs and increase the number of rental chairs. That will increase her income and enable her to share the life expenses and live with her family in better conditions. Fatema is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase extra chairs for rental to wedding parties.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg is a hardworking 53-year-old woman who has two daughters who are 31 and 33 years old. She lives in the capital of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar, in a small traditional house (or ger) that lacks the infrastructure people have if they live closer to the city. Both of her daughters are married and on their own. Since 2000, Altantsetseg has made a living selling children’s clothing at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She started out by renting a small stall but has done a good job of increasing her capital and attracting more customers. Today she has many regular customers who enjoy doing business with her. She is applying for a loan for 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to buy more children’s clothes to sell this autumn and winter. She is one of our trusted repeat clients who is extremely thankful to Kiva lenders for having given her an opportunity to make many positive changes in her business.

loans.use: to buy fall and winter children's clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina is 50 years old and married with two children. She plants and harvests taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Susitina needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase land to expand her farm. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to continue to improve and expand the business.

Susitina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Susitina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase land in order to expand her taro farm.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 33 years old, married to Doreen, and a father of four children. He runs a posho (corn) mill which helps him in sustaining his family. He has been in this business for a period of a year, with a monthly profit of KES 3,000.

He has applied for a loan of KES 40,000, which he used to buy more maize for grinding into maize flour for sale.

The anticipated profit will be used to expand the business.This is his second loan with KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a better businessman.

loans.use: to buy more maize for grinding into maize flour

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra de quesillo, maíz, aceite, para la elaboración de las pupusas, ella se ha decidido por otro préstamo porque considera que necesita realizar periódicamente, nuevas inversiones para mantenerse.
Estas inversiones le han dado a Marta una mejor condición en el negocio, aumentando su capacidad para atender a los clientes, mejorando las ventas y con deseos de ser puntual en este nuevo periodo.
texts.en:
Marta is once again requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cheese, corn and cooking oil to prepare 'pupusas' (a popular Salvadoran dish). She has decided to ask for another loan because she considers it necessary to make new investments periodically to maintain the business.

These investments have placed Marta's business in better condition, augmenting her capacity to attend to customers, improving sales and giving her the desire to work diligently in this new period.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, and cooking oil to make 'pupusas,' local stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 38, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Phalla and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a machine that squeezes sugarcane so she can produce sugar palm juice to sell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane squeezer to produce sugarcane juice to sell.

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
Bibi is 53 years old and married.  She is the mother of an 18 year old son who goes to school.  Bibi’s main activity is selling smoked and salted fish from her business located west of the city of Kinshasa.  Besides that, she also sells peanuts, mushrooms, beans and miscellaneous items.  Currently her business brings in $60 USD weekly.  Bibi has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1982 and is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC.  She has received and repaid eleven previous loans.
Bibi is requesting a loan to increase her stock of goods by buying packages of smoked fish in order to meet the high demand of the customers in her community and to make more profit.  Her ambition is to open a cold room to keep and resell fresh fish in her area.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods by buying packages of smoked fish in order to meet the high demand of the customers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Nancy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and electronic loads for cell phones. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and electronic loads to sell.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and electronic loads for sale.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is a 65-year-old widow. She lives with five sons in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money with the business of making the soles of sandals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Now, Lang would like to take out a loan to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to buy materials such as synthetic rubber to increase her production of sandal soles. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. This will enable her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as synthetic rubber to increase her production of sandal soles.

loans.name: Ageteraine Kitana Group

texts.en: Deo is a married man with 8 children and the leader of the Ageteraine Kitana group. He sells fish and has been in the business for 8 years. He started as a farmer and later saved to start the fish business. He faces a challenge of seasonal variations in price and high taxes. His family goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business to guard against the risks that he is facing in the market. Deo wants a loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Carren Benta

texts.en:
Carren Benta is a 56-year-old poultry farmer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and has been doing this business for the last two years with success. 

This is her third loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks for rearing on her farm. She sells chicken and eggs to her customers. The proceeds from the business will be used in the expansion of her business and for repaying her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Leona has a food shop or carenderia that makes and sells viands like afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for 18 years. 

She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

Leona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Maurino

texts.es: Maurino  tiene  62 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos mayores quienes son personas muy trabajadoras. Vive junto a su esposa en su casa hecha de adobe y madera que el mismo construyó. Maurino tiene un pequeño taller donde elabora muebles y otros artículos de madera.  Aprendió está actividad gracias a un tío suyo que le enseñó el oficio de la carpintería ya con los años optó por abrir su propio taller en donde empezó elaborando sillas y mesas para cumplir sus primeros pedidos. Gracias  a su trabajo logró mantener a sus hijos y  enviarlos a la escuela con la intención de que sean mejores personas que el cuando crezcan. Es conocido por sus vecinos por la puntualidad en que entrega sus trabajos y eso le permite mantener actualmente a sus clientes. Entre los principales muebles que suele fabricar están las mesitas de noche y escritorios para computadora; incluso muebles mayores al gusto de sus clientes. Es el tercer préstamo que solicita a KIVA y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para invertir en su taller. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de madera y renovar algunas de sus herramientas para realizar una mejor calidad en sus trabajos.

loans.use: Compra de madera y herramientas para su taller.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel nació en Sonora, México. Tiene 36 años y ha sido niñera por tres años. Tiene una Licenciatura en Derecho. Además de su trabajo como abogada, quiere iniciar un negocio vendiendo joyería para tener un ingreso extra para cuando se convierta en madre. Está solicitando un préstamo de MXN 12,000 para comprar joyería como anillos, aretes, pulseras para venderlos a sus conocidos y amigos. Es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora que disfruta mucho de su trabajo y de estar con los niños, porque son ellos con quien más se divierte. Le gustaría estudiar un curso en finanzas para tener un mejor manejo de su economía. Con este préstamo ella será capaz de incrementar sus ingresos regulares y está muy comprometida a estar a tiempo en las fechas de pago.
texts.en: Anabel was born in Sonora, Mexico. She is 36 years old and has been babysitting for three years. She has a law degree. Besides her work as a lawyer, she wants to start a business selling jewelry to earn extra income for when she becomes a mother. She is requesting a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy jewelry like rings, earrings, bracelets to sell to her friends and acquaintances. She is a very responsible woman worker who enjoys her work being with kids, because it is they who are having fun. She would like to study a course in finance to better manage her finances. With this loan, she will be able to increase her regular income, and she is very committed to be on time payment dates.

loans.use: to buy jewelry like rings, earrings, bracelets to sell to her friends and acquaintances

loans.name: Alioune

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten members of the Thialene association, who hail from the tiny village of Nder at the edge of the Sahara desert in northern Senegal. Subsistence is always a battle in this arid region, where most people still depend on rain-fed cultivation of their staple crops: millet, yams and peanuts. Investment in irrigation here can improve crop yields dramatically, increasing the surplus that the villagers sell for much-needed cash. The leader of the Thialene group, Alioune S., describes their plan to invest loan funds in an irrigation pump:

“The loan will be used to provide the group members with an irrigation pump with a capacity of 300 cubic meters per hour, which can irrigate 10 hectares of land. The pump will be managed by a maintenance person who will take charge of ensuring its good working condition. The team overseeing this project will make regular visits to all the fields where the pump is being used, and as soon as the first harvests begin we will start to collect the loan repayment without any difficulty.”

Original French:

"Il s’agit de mettre à la disposition des membres du groupement un groupe moto pompe d’une capacité de 300m3/heure pouvant irrigué 10 ha de culture et sera géré par un pompiste qui assurera l’entretien et le fonctionnement. L’équipe de suivi du projet fera des descentes dans tous les projets et dès la fin des premiers récolte commencera à faire le recouvrement des crédits sans difficulté."

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Irrigation pump

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a hairdresser. She owns a salon and has five (5) apprentices. She complained bitterly when visited one afternoon of not having enough hair driers and creams even though a lot of women patronize her salon. She is seriously in need and of help to keep her in business. She is seeking a loan of $900 to help her purchase these items.

loans.use: Purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a refrigerator and more stock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
ENGLISH

Virginia is married, her husband is retired, and they have three sons who are all married. She began her small grocery and seafood store 7 years ago and has been able to employ two people to help her. Her goal when she began her business was to provide for her 3 children, especially for their basic needs and education, which was her primary concern. She has achieved those goals and wants to continue with her business in order to be able to leave her children an inheritance and continue helping them.

Virginia is requesting for a loan of $1,200.00 to remodel her business and to purchase merchandise to her grocery store. She offers to repay the loan in 4 months. She and her husband thank you for your support, which will allow her to continue with her business.

SPANISH

Virginia está casada, su esposos es pensionado y tienen 3 hijos que ya son casados, ella ha podido dar empleo a dos personas en su negocio y ya tiene 7 años que inició con su tienda de abarrotes y mariscos, su objetivo fue sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos cuando decidió iniciar su negocio, en lo que a su manutención y sus estudios se refiere, lo que era su principal preocupación, ella ha logrado lo que se ha propuesto y desea continuar con su negocio para dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio y continuar ayudándolos.

Virginia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,200 para remodelar su local e invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen el apoyo que les das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To remodel and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim H. is 38 years old and a habitant of Huroson district. He has a secondary level education. He is married and has 5 children. Abdurahim grew up in the village so the skills of breeding stock were familiar to him from childhood. All his life he worked on a farm. He grew cotton and worked to breed stock on the farm. He enjoyed his work but times have changed and now he works in own farm breeding stock. He feeds animals to sell their meat.

With the loan amount of $1000, the client is going to buy three bull-calves for feeding and feed-stuff. This loan gives him the opportunity to increase the amount of animals, so village habitants can buy meat cheaper in their local butcher shop. The client is going to pay off the loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy three bull-calves for feeding and selling

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
This is an unmarried, childless woman who has dedicated her entire life to this type of business, owing to her mother’s occupation of raising and butchering pigs.

Currently her mother is old and no longer works and Mrs. A. is her only caregiver. She also supports a nephew, the son of her older brother who lives in Costa Rica due to unemployment, by paying for his education.

She has worked at her current position in the central market in Chinancego for over seven years. Before this she, she sold her wares from her house. She was responsible for buying live animals, butchering them and selling the meat and other parts of the animal. She has worked with CEPRODEL for over 2 years and has a very good credit record with them.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Izmailov, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Esta señora es soltera sin hijos, la cual se ha dedicado toda la vida a este tipo de negocio, debido a que su mamá se dedicaba a la crianza y destace de cerdos.

Actualmente su mamá está ya anciana y no trabaja, doña blanca es su único sostén y es quien mantiene además de su mamá, a un sobrino hijo de un hermano mayor que vive en Costa Rica por la falta de empleo, a quien le está financiando su educación.

El puesto que actualmente ella posee está ubicado en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega desde hace más de siete años, antes de tener su puesto las ventas las realizaba en su casa, ella se hace cargo de comprar el animal en pie, destazarlo y comercializar su carne y otros derivados provenientes del animal. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace más de 2 años con quien tiene muy buen record crediticio.Purp

loans.use: Purchase of goods (pigs, sausages, fat)

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Family and economic problems never consumed Nemecia, a humble mother of one son, Alex. Thanks to her unconditional love, Alex is cruising through his fifth semester of study in medical school at a prestigious university in the city. Nemecia is a hard working mother who diligently travels the streets of her city day by day selling a variety of her colored shawls and sheets. Thanks to her perseverance and ability, this business has brought her much happiness. The desire of this exemplary mother is to have a commercial store, a place where she can distribute her merchandise to the public. In order to fulfill her plans she requests a loan that she will completely invest in this aspiration. She counts on your support so that the work of this brave mother moves forward.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Sus problemas familiares y económicos nunca derrotaron a Nemecia, madre humilD. D. Alex, quien gracias al apoyo incondicional que le brinda viene cursando el V semestre D. estudios en la Facultad D. Medicina D. una prestigiosa universidad D. su ciudad.Ella, es una empeñosa madre, que a diario recorre diligentemente las calles D. su ciudad, ofreciendo sus variadas y coloridas mantas y cobertores, negocio que gracias a su perseverancia y habilidad le viene otorgando muchas alegrías. El deseo D. esta ejemplar madre es contar con un local comercial, lugar desD. donD. anhela distribuir su mercadería al por mayor y para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo, para invertirlos completamente en este anhelo. Contamos con vuestro apoyo para que la labor D. esta valerosa madre siga adelante.

loans.use: To rent a better located store to distribute merchandise

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Kế, 47 years of age, is a fifth year member of the TYM Fund. She invested her first loan of 50USD in a few dozens ducklings, now the flock has grown to hundreds of ducks. She also owns a fish pond and dozen of pigs. She is so confident with her experience of running her business, that confidence has encouraged her to taK. out more loans. The profit of those loans has not only improved the family’s economy, covered her children’s education expenses but also been used as seeds for next cycles of investment. Her current income is 140USD a month. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to purchase feeds for her animal stock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Kế, 47 tuổi là thành viên năm thức 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Từ mức vay đầu tiên là 50USD đủ mua vài chục vịt con đến nay đàn vịt của chị Kế đã lên đến vài trăm. Ngoài ra chị còn có 1 ao cá và vài chục con lợn. Kinh nghiệm tích lũy trong nhiều năm đầu tư vào chăn nuôi đã giúp chị mạnh dạn tăng nguồn vốn vay lên qua mỗi vòng. Nguồn lợi nhuận thu được không những giúp chị cải thiện đời sống gia đình, cho các con ăn học mà còn tạo thêm nguồn vốn đầu tư cho các vòng sau. Với nguồn thu nhập hiện tại là 140USD/tháng chị Kế dự định sẽ xin vay thêm 1200USD mua thức ăn cho đàn vịt, lợn và ao cá.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, ducks, fishes

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.en:
This committee called San Miguel is composed of 16 women and is strong and united. Together they work on improving their independent businesses in the city of San Lorenzo. Although their businesses are all different, many of them work in the area of crafting and dressmaking. Others sell fruits and vegetables as traveling saleswomen or in grocery and convenience stores.

Today they are coming together to ask for a loan to assist them in paying for their various goods. All wish to make their businesses more profitable so that they may be able to provide more for their families.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like fruits, vegetables, coal, clothing, and reels of fabric.

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en:
Bernadeta is a 50 year old married woman with 4 children, ages 28, 25, 20 and 17. In 2004, Bernadeta began a business selling timber. She now works everyday from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Previously, Bernadeta received a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business, and she repaid it in a timely fashion. She now hopes for a loan of $350 to further develop her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Adegnika

texts.fr:
Mr. Adegnika A. was born on March 23, 1970 in Lomé. He is married and is the breadwinner for seven people. He owns a little cafeteria and bar which he has named "Great Place". He manages to support his family with the income from his business. Recently, he has had electrical problems since he draws his elecricity from his neighbor's place. In view of these problems, he would like to deal directly with the electric company and have his own meter installed so that he will be able to cool the drinks he sells and thus better serve his customers.

Mr. Adegnika A. would also like to purchase 10 empty drink cases and twenty plastic chairs which will allow him to seat more customers.

Accomplishing these upgrades to his business venture will make it more profitable and allow him to earn more income which he will be able to use to take full responsibility for educating his children and supplying their needs. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 which will allow him to make his plans a reality.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Adegnika est né le 23 mars 1970 à Lomé. Il est marié et a sept (7) personnes à charge. Il est propriétaire d’une cafétéria et d’un bar qu’il a dénommé « GREAT PLACE ». Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec le revenu de son entreprise. Ces derniers temps il a des problèmes d’électricité car il avait fait le branchement auprès de son voisin. Mais compte tenu des problèmes, il voulait faire le branchement directement à la compagnie électrique et avoir son propre compteur afin de pouvoir mettre au frais les boissons qu’il vend et de mieux servir ses clients.

Monsieur A. Adegnika désire également acquérir dix (10) casiers vides de boissons gazeuses et vingt (20) chaises plastiques pouvant lui permettre d’accueillir assez de clients.

La parfaite réalisation de son projet lui permettra d’améliorer la rentabilité de ses affaires et d’accroître ses revenus en vue de prendre entièrement en charge l’éducation de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins. A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA qui lui serviront à réaliser son projet.

loans.use:
Upgrade his business venue

Aménager son lieu d'activités

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph P. is a photographer. He is divorced and has 2 children. He wants to improve his services to his customers.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more photo materials to improve his services to attract more clients.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more photo materials to improve his services to attract more clients

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is a perfect example of dedication and effort. Her great motherly love enabled her to leave her home village of Crucero in search of a better life. Nowadays she lives in the city of Juliaca with her four children, for whom she is committed to keep going ahead in life. Since her husband left her, she has been both a mother and a father to her children, working tirelessly en her business, where she buys and sells livestock (poultry and pigs). This is a trade she learned from her humble farming parents. Every weekend Guillermina travels to the small neighboring villages to purchase her animals and to market them at the markets. This is an activity which has given her the satisfaction of providing her beloved children a better quality of life. She is very proud of her children.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina, es un ejemplo constante de dedicación y esfuerzo, su inmenso amor de madre la llevaron a salir de su pueblo natal Crucero, en busca de un mejor porvenir; actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca con sus 4 menores retoños, por quienes vela y está dispuesta a persistir en la vida.Desde que su esposo la dejó se ha convertido en padre y madre de sus hijos, trabajando incansablemente en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado (ovino y porcino), oficio que aprendió de sus humildes padres ganaderos, Guillermina todos los fines de semana viaja a los pueblitos aledaños para adquirir su ganado y comercializarlos en las ferias.Esta actividad le está dando la satisfacción de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus amados hijos, quienes la llenan de felicidad y orgullo.

loans.use: To offer a larger quantity of livestock.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mrs. Meng M. sells Khmer noodles in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She used a previous loan to start her business. Since her business activity has improved, Mrs. Meng M. is now requesting a loan to buy more Khmer noodles and ingredients to cook delicious food for her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Khom In, is a driver who uses his motorbike with a cart to carry goods. Mrs. Meng M. is 30 years old and is the mother of five children, three of whom attend school. The others are too young.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer noodles and ingredients

loans.name: Rosmery Jeanet

texts.es:
Rosmery is a young mother who works arduously in agriculture, thus helping her husband with the household expenses so that they can have greater possibilities to improve their quality of life and provide their 6-year-old daughter with the necessities of life. She works at home until very late, packing the herbs that will later be sold. It is very heavy work because she has to further cut the plants, but this does not daunt her desire to keep working. Furthermore, she would like to expand her crop fields, but for in order to do so, she needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles. She hopes that you will be able to help her increase her crops so that she can continue to support her partner with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosmery, es una joven madre que trabaja arduamente en la agricultura, así ayuda a su esposo con los gastos dentro de su hogar, para tener mayores posibilidades de mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle lo necesario a su pequeña hija de tan solo 6 años.Ella trabaja hasta muy tarde en su casa empaquetando las hierbas que después serían vendidas, este trabajo es muy pesado y cortar la hierba aún más, pero eso no amilana sus deseos de seguir trabajando.De igual manera, quiere incrementar sus terrenos de cultivos y para ello solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, espera que usted pueda ayudarla a ampliar sus cultivos y así seguir apoyando a su pareja en los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Capital for crop fields

loans.name: Fishing Association Group

texts.en: This group is called Fishing Association. They are all business people in Magburka town market. This is their 3rd time of getting a loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have helped them and their businesses a great deal. Yet, they still need more loans to help their businesses grow further. They are thus requesting a loan of Le  2,400,000.00. These entrepreneurs are: Yusuf G., Isatu C., and Osman C.. Yusuf is the leader of the group. He is married with 5 children. Yusuf sells used clothes and has been in this business for the past 8 years.

loans.use: Buy more bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en: Bahar S., 34, is married and has three children. Her main activity is selling milk and yoghurt to the local people. Generally her day starts early in the morning and lasts until late at night. This business has been the main source of income for her family for the past six years. Bahar is planning to increase the size of her business by purchasing one more cow. The additional cow will help her to sell more milk and yoghurt each day so she can increase her income. She thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milking

loans.name: Eom

texts.en: Mrs. Eom N. of Bonteay Village in Takeo Province is a 30-year-old rice farmer and the mother of three children, all in attendance at the local school.  Unfortunately, her rice field has become infertile, so she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to restore it. Her husband, Mr. Siv Sokhorn, shown in the picture, owns a small rice mill that generates an income as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field.

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.ru: Каршиев Абдухалим житель города ТУрсун-заде. Проживает там вместе со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Работает прессовщиком на заводе "Талко". Имеет средние условия жизни. Хочет получить кредит для личного использования. Ему в данный момент необходимо сделать ремонт дома. Погашать кредит сможет из получаемой заработной платы в течение 12 месцев.
texts.en:
Abduhalim Q. is a resident of the city of Tursunzade, where he lives together with his family. He is married and has three children. Abduhalim works as a press operator in the Talko factory, and makes an average wage. He wants a loan for personal use, as he currently needs to make home repairs. He will be able to repay the loan out of his salary within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Repairs

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: La Sr. María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada su esposo es conductor, habita en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijas de 23 y 12 años de edad ambas estudian y ayudan a su madre. Sus planes se han realizando poco a poco, ya que desde 22 años tiene su casa, dándole mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia realizando mejoras en su hogar con el financiamiento de micro financieras. Doña María posee un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos y fritanga cuenta con doce años de experiencia laboral. Sus metas es ofertar nuevos productos, captar nuevos clientes, aumentar el volumen  de las ventas y tener mayores utilidades. Agracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra invertir en su negocio con las compra de nuevos productos como: granos básicos, fruta, vegetales y cosméticos.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and her husband is a driver. She lives in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two daughters, ages 23 and 12, who both are studying and help out their mother. Her plans have become a reality little by little, and she has had her house for 22 years which gives her more security and comfort for the family. She has made improvements to the home using micro-finance capital. María has a small business selling staple grains and fried foods, in which she has twelve years of experience. Her goals are to offer new products, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will manage to invest further in her business by buying new merchandise such as: staple grains, fruits, vegetables and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase staple grains and fruits.

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
