Lor H. is 43 years old and resides in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house.  She raises them for their offspring and for slaughter.  She has been running her business for more than five years and is currently earning approximately $2 each day. 

She has four children, all of whom are single and are living in the family home.  Three of her children attend school and one of her sons is employed as a rice harvester.  Her husband is a wood carving seller and he earns an average of $5 a day to help meet with the family's food needs. 

Lor H. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase more piglets to raise, as well as buffalo to raise and sell.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and buffalo to raise

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mr. Seak H. is 56 years old and is the father of five children; three are security workers while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife, Mrs. Penh Kong, pictured with him, is a housewife. Mr. Seak H. lives in Ksom village in the Kandal province and is a teacher in the local school.

Mr. Seak H. is also a farmer and owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. On this plantation, he faces a challenge as the field is infertile. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He will use the remainder of the money to purchase fuel, to water the field so his crop is more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and purchase fuel to water the field so the crop is more productive.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Celia es viuda, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Celia tiene un puesto en un centro comercial ubicado en una avenida concurrida en donD. venD. ropa en especial lencería que es confeccionado por su hijo que tiene un taller en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Celia tiene un bar en un local alquilado.
Celia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tela D. la ciudad D. Lima.
Los sueños D. Celia son que su negocio crezca, su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the communal bank "Capuli". Celia is a widow, she is 50 years old and has 7 children. Celia has a business in the mall were she sells clothing, especially undergarments that one of her sons sews in a workshop that he has in her house. He works every day to make the undergarments. Besides this Celia operates a bar out of a location that she rents. Celia needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be used to buy fabric from the city of Lima. Celia's dream is that her business grows and that her youngest son finishes school.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric in the city of Lima

loans.name: Parveen Siddique Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a 45 year old married lady who has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. Parveen baji married S. M., who is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji is the mother of one son whose name is Riaz M. and he runs a boutique. Parveen baji helps her son in his boutique by preparing embroidered dresses which her son displays in his boutique. Parveen baji did not learn this art from anyone, but believes it was a gift from God. Her son feels proud to be her son. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy materials (clothes, colored thread and sketches) for her son’s boutique. 

Parveen baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Adfarina baji wants a loan to buy cricket products (bat & ball) to sell. Mussarat zareen baji and Alvina baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe making business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for boutique.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M., 50, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers 4 days per week. 

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~180 USD).  SPBD loans are Rosa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy necessary materials for her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods for the shop such as snacks, canned food, sweets and frozen food.

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en: Tauatala H., 50, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience and sells fish to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (approximately 291 USD).  SPBD loans are Tauatala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear such as fishing net

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin M. es un señor de admirarse a pesar de que el es viudo siempre esta al tanto de su hijos y no los abandona. Aunque su esposa al morir les dejo un casa, el esta construyendo una por que a sus niños quiere dejarles un buen patrimonio y lugar donde vivir para cuando el falte; suena triste pero el se ha sentido mal desde la muerte de su esposa. El trabaja como operador en una maquiladora aparte recibe pensión de viudez por su esposa.
texts.en:
Martin M. is a man to admire, even though he is a widow he always keeps up with his children and has never abandoned them. Though his wife upon her passing left them a house, he is building another house because he was leave his children an inheritance and a place to live when he is no longer with them; it sounds sad but he has felt ill since the death of his wife. He works as an operator in a border assembly plan, and also receives a widower’s pension because of his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 49 años de edad, vive en union libre con el Sr. Rafael Soza, durante su relacion no procrearon hijos, adoptaron una niña la cual tiene 12 años y esta cursando el 1er año de secundaria, su compañero de vida tiene un negocio propio en la casa un bar llamado El Recreo, este es administrado por el y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Maritza trabaja como responsable de enfermeria en el Centro de Salud del Coral del MINSA desde hace 10 años con horario de lunes a viernes, el fin de semana ayuda en el negocio. Está solicitando su 5to credito para utilizarlo en la reparacion del techo de su casa, el cual se encuentra en mal estado, y con el invierno no quiere que su familia, ni los clientes se mojen.  Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en el pago de sus creditos, y a pesar de la constante rotacion en su trabajo siempre se ha observado un excelente record crediticio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 49 years old and lives with her partner, Mr. Rafael Soza. During their relationship the have not had any children, and they adopted a girl who is now 12 years old and is in her first year of junior high school. Her life partner has his own business, a bar called El Recreo, that he administers and helps her with the home expenses. Maritza has been working as head of infirmary in MINSA's Coral Health Center for the past 10 years from Monday to Friday, and on weekends she helps him with the business. She is asking for her 5th credit to be used for the repair of her roof, which is in a bad state, and with the upcoming winter she does not want her family or her customers to get wet. She is known to pay her loans responsibly, and despite her constant work rotation she has always had a good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Zizi

texts.en: Zizi is a single lady of 38 years; she lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells gift items and cosmetics. Zizi is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more gift items and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items & cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda M. tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de venta de abarrotes, es la fuente de ingreso para su familia. 
Desea invertir para empezar a vender más verduras y carnes, ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo, y ella no quiere perder sus clientes.  
Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para que su negocio tenga más ingreso y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Herlinda M. has run her grocery store for over a year now; it is the sole source of income for her family. She wants to invest in inventory so that she can sell more vegetables and meats since these are the things her customers are asking for and she wants to keep them satisfied. But, she lacks the necessary capital for this investment and does not want to decapitalize her business, hence the need for this loan so that her business will have increased income with which to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
la sra. IRMA R. tiene una pulperia ubicada en el Benque Jamastran, la pulperia de la Sra. R. opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "IRMA" tiene 10 años de haber iniciado operaciones a cargo de este negocio el cual en este tiempo le ha ido muy bien y ha podido generar mas desarrollo para su vida.
La Sra. Irma R. es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales los mantiene de sus ganancias que ella obtiene de su pulperia.
Doña Irma, ademas de dedicarse a la pulpería tambien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan hornado mismo que
es vendido en una fabrica de tabacos ya que una de sus hijas labora para esta empresa y ella le ayuda a vender
el pan dentro de la fabrica.
Doña Irma, es primera vez que solicita un credito,  asi ella podra mejorar mucho mas su condición de vida y su negocio.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Irma has a small corner shop located in Benque Jamastran, which operates under the name “IRMA.” She started operations 10 years ago and in this time she has been able to create a number of positive developments in her life.

Irma is a single mother with three children who manage the profits she makes from the corner shop.

In addition to running the shop, Irma also makes and sells baked bread at a tobacco factory. One of her daughters works at this factory and she helps her sell the bread.

This is the first time that Irma has requested a loan, so for her it will greatly improve her quality of life and her business.

She requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise to stock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her corner shop

loans.name: Eliaichi

texts.en:
Eliaichi is a member of the Zilipendwa borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 19,14,and 10 years.

Eliaichi started her own business selling sugar,rice,cooking oil etc 1 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 60,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eliaichi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more sugar,rice etc for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Eliaichi hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy moresugar,rice,salts for sale

loans.name: Shifubi Khainza Florence Group

texts.en:
Florence K. , 42, is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with five children, who are all in school. For eight years, she has operated a drug-shop business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to add stock to her drug shop. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hopes are to improve upon her business, to purchase a plot of land and to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase medicine to add stock to her drug-shop business

loans.name: Silvia Ynes

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer dinámica ,vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 42 años, es madre soltera, de cinco hijos de los cuales tres son mayores de edad y dos menores, tiene una tienda en su casa de abarrotes en general. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en verduras, en la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles que invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y condimentos. La meta de Silvia es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes y bebidas.
texts.en:
Silvia is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Coronel Portillo province. She is 42 and the single mother of five children. Three of the children are grown and two are minors. She has a general grocery store in her house. She has been part of the Mujeres Glalácticas 11 Communal Bank for four years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought vegetables. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy groceries and condiments. Silvia’s goal is to have a store that is well stocked with groceries and drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries and condiments

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.en: A. Abubakr is a hardworking man who has dedicated himself to making his business prosper through great effort. Approximately 11 years ago he began his grocery business, which is located in an open market, and over the years he has improved the structure of his business. Abubakr’s sponsor IMON International, in addition to giving him financial support, has also provided a solution to his economic struggles and Abubakr feels happy and satisfied to work together with them. Thanks to this financial assistance, he has been able to expand his business and clientele. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Mae Joy

texts.en: Mae Joy T. is from the village of Upper Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mae Joy owns and operates a food stall, selling fruit to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Mae Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mae Joy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Florence Wahito

texts.en:
Florence N., 41 years old and married with four children, has a small shop in Kibera where she sells sugar, maize flour, and rice to her customers in Kibera's slums. She has been in the business for  about two years and has been able to earn a profit of about  20,000 Kenya Shillings per month. This is enough to sustain both herself and her family.

She was with another microfinance institution, but the group was destabilized by the post-election violence, so she joined KADET. Florence intends to use her loan to add more stocks of sugar, maize flour, and rice to meet the demand of her clients. She hopes to grow the business to a level where she can serve her customers with a stock of about 200,000 Kenya shillings.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To add stock of  sugar, soaps, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a married woman and mother of 8 children. She has been working in clothing sales since 1995 to help her husband in the household. Today, Feryal is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy more clothes to increase her sales and make good income for the family.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov N., 43, is a widow with a 18-year-old child. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her child. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of producing ground rice and Cambodian traditional cake, earning an income of US $2.50 per day in revenue. The family is also assisted by her child who sells fish and vegetable at a local market in the town, earning an income of approximately US $2 per day. These sources of incomes from N. and her child help cover the family expenses. N. is seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike to provide public transportation services and transport fish and vegetables for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en:
Adebola is 41 years old and is married with two children. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

Adebola sells kerosene to make a living. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. This is the high season for business and she hopes to make more profits during this season.

Adebola hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Sokunthy

texts.en:
Mr. Sokunthy M. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is 35 years old and is the father of three children: two are enrolled in the local public school while the other one is too small to go to school or to work. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

Mr. Sokunthy M. and his wife, Mrs. Theavy Sorm, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family living.

This family can earn only a little money from their rice field to support their family living, however hard they try to work. Mr. Sokunthy M. has a plantation to start new business but he does not have enough money to start it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase some supplies such as an ice cream container and ice cream to start a new business.

loans.use: To purchase an ice cream container and ice cream to sell

loans.name: Vanchig

texts.en:
Vanchig makes wooden furniture and sells his pieces at the local bazaar. He lives with his wife and two sons who are students. He has lived in the city’s ger (traditional nomadic housing tent) districts for thirty-two years and considers himself an expert at surviving the cold harsh winter days.

Given his expertise, Vanchig admitted that he was surprised at how long and efficiently the ger (yurt) insulation keeps him and his family warm. He also believes that he saves at least twenty percent of fuel costs.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt (ger) covering

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desD. hace 1 año, vive en el distrito D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román y departamento D. Puno, tiene 47 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto D. secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta D. miel y polladas (comida al paso).

Carmela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, compró miel.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar insumos para las polladas como: pollo, papa, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un negocio fijo y poner una tienda D. abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y la responsabilidad
texts.en:
Carmela has been a member of the “Cristo Blanco” communal bank for 1 year. She lives in the Juliaca district, San Román province in the Puno department. She is 47 years old, is separated and has 1 child. She studied to the fifth year of secondary school. She buys and sells honey and barbequed chicken (fast food). Carmela tells us that with the first loan she asked the Manuela Ramos Movement for, which was for 500 PEN, she bought honey. She is asking for a loan of 600 PEN, with which she will be able to buy ingredients for the barbequed chicken like: chicken, potatoes, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a steady business and to open a grocery store. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings with the members and the responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CHICKEN, POTATOES ETC

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala P. is 35 and married with 6 children (ages 12 - 22).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Kalala has many years of experience in this business.  Kalala needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Kalala joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Kalala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Kalala P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Massan T. works in the Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé, where she sells charcoal. She has been in this business since 1980. The combination of her busy location and the necessity of her products ensures that demand remains high. 

This will be her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal and resupply her stock. This loan will help Mrs. T. take care of her family expenses and help her business grow. 

She is married and has five children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Yaide Street Group

texts.en:
Mabinty K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She has been selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, etc. for six years now. She is a 40-year-old, married with five children. Three of her children are attending secondary school and two are in primary school. 

Like other mothers, she wants to give her children a proper education and a bright future. She depends on her business in order to achieve this. In order to improve her business, she and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group from SMT, a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone. With the help of this loan, Mabinty will buy rice, palm oil, salt and different other types of market-food wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, salt, etc. wholesale to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Mary Njoki

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother, 49 years old. She sells soft drinks in Chomo, her home town in central Kenya. She is blessed with two adult daughters and one adult son. 

Mary was introduced to Kadet through marketing outreach by Kadet staff and she plans to purchase more soft drink stocks for her business. Mary has been selling soft drinks for the past 17 years and also does farming as her other source of income. She intends to open another soft drink shop with the extra profit expected from the business. 

Her future hopes are to buy a piece of land and build a permanent residence. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of soft drinks

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Mrs. Chhom O. is 51 years old and she is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Aon Tous, are farmers who own 2.50 hectares of land to cultivate rice. Aside from being farmers, Mrs. Chhom O. is Khmer noodle seller and her husband is fisherman. With these businesses they can earn a small income to support their family. For the farm, Mrs. Chhom O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to support her farming crop and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding. This couple has two children who all are staff workers in a private company. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: For fertilizer, pesticide, seed, piglets, and pig food

loans.name: Eufrecina

texts.en:
Eufrecina T. is from the village of Luyong Bonbon, Opol,  Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Eufrecina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eufrecina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Eufrecina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eufrecina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufrecina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Eufrecina is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eufrecina from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Eulalia Dora C. de 33 años, es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal 16 de Julio que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani.Eulalia es casada y vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona San Luis hace 4 años aproximadamente, ella se dedica a vender comida cerca a una plaza hace 3 años  y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, papa y fideo con los cuales prepara alimentos con mayor freciencia.
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación se dedican al tejido de prendas de vestir,  confección de mantas y venta de jugos. Todos necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Eulalia Dora C., age 33, is the president of the 16 de Julio Communal Bank. It is part of the Collpani Community Center. Eulalia is married, and she has lived in the city of El Alto in the San Luis region for approximately four years. She has been selling food near a plaza for three years. She needs the loan to buy the supplies that she uses most frequently like rice, potatoes, and noodles. The rest of the members of this communal bank knit clothes, make blankets, and sell juices. They all need the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina S. is from the village of Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Divina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Divina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Divina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Divina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Divina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying credit card debt with Citibank

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children and all her children go school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. A few months ago she changed her business enterprise from selling bananas to chickens and now she sells chicken from the very stall where she was selling bananas. She buys her chickens from areas of Kawempe, Kyebando, Kanyanya and Ntinda. She wants to use this loan to buy more chickens for resale.

Florence works seven days a week. Her business challenges include the transport of chickens, thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and start rearing chickens herself and also to buy a plot of land and build her own rental rooms. Florence decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of the low interest rate charged. She resides in and owns a five-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in Borewala, with her family, which is a small city of Pakistan. She is a 35 year old lady who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She collects orders from them and fulfills them in time to earn an income. She gets 100 PKRs for simple sewing, and her designer sewing is sold for 150 PKRs, which her customers can easily pay her. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities.
  
Her husband runs a grocery shop near the market. He offers different daily use products to his clients. Rani has given birth to a daughter and a son. Both of them are illiterate, and her son is a hairdresser by profession. Her daughter stays at home and manages the household chores and also helps her mother in her sewing work.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will put more groceries in his grocery shop. She hopes that by adding more variety, her husband can make more income by offering more to his clients. Rani is in her second loan cycle, earlier she received a loan for her son who started a barber shop which is going well now.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Apio

texts.en: Apio K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, groundnut paste and fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Apio is 31 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bakole Wakiso Development Grouo - Lugazi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma N. belongs to the Bakole Wakiso Development Group-Lugazi. She is 40 years old and happily married with two kids, both of whom are attending school in Namengo-Lugazi. 

To get a viable and sustainable financial means of subsistence that she and her family could rely on, she began her fish selling business two years ago. To take root in this business, she had to use savings from her bar business, which is still a side business for her. In a week, out of her fish business, she makes profits totaling up to 500,000 shillings.  

Under the auspices of this loan, Fatuma wants to boost her business by buying more fish to resell and some to smoke and keep as reserve just in case client demand goes up. Just like in any other part of Uganda, fish customers in Lugazi normally have preferences, some an inclination for smoked fish and some fancy fresh fish. The upshot of increased sales, Fatuma gleefully says, is going to be an increase in profits for her business. This, she says, will improve the longevity of her business and, most important, enable her to give her kids a better education.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for resale

loans.name: Iris Del Pilar

texts.es:
Iris de 31 años,  tiene una papelería en donde vende artículos para fiestas, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido aumentar el negocio de la papelería ya que la incremento con artículos para fiestas.  Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. Vende papelería, cuadernos, confites, artículos para fiestas etc.  

Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar artículos para fiestas, confites, papelería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Iris is 31 years old and owns a stationery store where she sells party items.  She lives in the outskirts of an area called "Duran", which is known for it's ecology.  Little by little her efforts have increased business for the stationery store since the increase in party supplies. 

She works from 8:00 am until 8 pm.  She sells stationery, folders, candies, party items, etc.  She is requesting a loan to purchase party items, candies, and stationery.  In the future she wants to finish building her house and have a bigger business.

loans.use: Party items and Stationery

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Janet has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 1.500.000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items like books and bread.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Janet hopes to own a bigger shop in town.

loans.use: To buy more items like books and bread

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Marcial de 54 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Carmen es una de las más visitadas en la comunidad de Alianza el Progreso, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 1 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is a quite simple and hardworking 34-year-old woman. She lives in a rented house with her 54-year-old husband Marcial and her four small children, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Carmen's shop is one of the most visited in the Progressive Alliance community. From very early in the morning she opens her store hoping that neighbors will come to buy the things they need.

She is a very cheerful and attentive vendor, always welcoming guests with a smile and willing to help them with their purchases. What she likes about her job is talking with her neighbors. She has been running this business for one year now and believes that the hardest part is having to spend all day in the shop without the possibility of leaving.

Over time, she hopes to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise to offer customers a better variety of products. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is willing to pay all her dues on time, as she does not want to cause problems for the community bank, which is beloved by the other members. 

With the additional 1200 soles requested she will buy more products to improve her store.

loans.use: Buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas is 35 years old.  He lives with his partner and their two children near the town of Reque, which is about 20 minutes south of the city of Chiclayo.  Reque is a small commercial town that serves as an intermediary between coastal areas and the city.  Nicolas lives in a rural area that is primarily populated by individuals who raise animals.

For a number of years, Nicolas has managed his own farming operations.  He has extensive experience in farming and is quite skilled.  Most recently he has planted corn in fields near his home.  He dreams of one day owning his own fields instead of renting.  He is proud to be able to provide for his family through his own labor and initiative.

The requested loan will be invested in additional products to support the proper growth of his crops and maximize their yield.  He hopes to be able to increase his income in the next few seasons in order to purchase his own land.  He hopes to be able to build a small business that his children can take over and run as their own once he is old.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. is forty-six years old and married. His wife is employed by the city council and they have three children aged between eighteen and twelve years old. His business is located at the busy Marikiti market in Nairobi. 

He sells an assortment of goods which include jackets, shoes and other items. He has been in this business for three years now.  He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints.

 He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to rent premises to diversify his business to shoe shining. He hopes to grow his business and become a wholesaler of shoes. He also works hard to always be able to meet his family's needs. He describes himself as intelligent, determined and God-fearing.

loans.use: Rent a shoe-shining shop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Kalubihan, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating a fish vending/fishing business. Her husband, Carlos M., who is 60 years old, helps in his wife's business. They have eight children aged between 16 and 38. Three of them are already married, two are working, while the other three are currently in school.
Rosita joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase new materials for fishing. She wants to continue to save up for the future, sustain their daily needs and provide for the education of her children. Rosita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.
Note: the photo was taken during the center meeting because the fish was sold already.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org. "

loans.use: As additional capital and to purchase fishing gear

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo A. is from the village of Brgy. Paungan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 57 years old, married and has 6 adult children. Rodolfo owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when he sells one of his raised animals.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support his immediate family members. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Verinia; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de una empresa de marketing, ella dicta clases de marketing y también hace capacitaciones, la socia también estudio la carrera profesional de derecho, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su empresa de marketing.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Verinia belongs to the Kantu Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  

Verinia is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with business for a marketing company.  

She presents marketing classes and also does trainings.  She also studied for a career in the law.  She wants to keep improving in her work.

She is requesting the loan to set up her marketing company.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To set up her marketing company

loans.name: Rosecepcion

texts.en:
Rosecepion E. is 41 years old and lives in Guibongan, Hamtic, Antique, Philippines. She has been a good mother to her five children and a loving wife to her husband, Ananias E., who works as a foreman at a construction company.

She has been an active member of the ASHI-Antique Southwest Branch since 2006, which has allowed her to secure the loans she needed for her business, where she sells goods in both wholesale and retail markets. She is committed to make this business a success because she wants to provide for her children, including ensuring that they all get a good education through college. She would also like to earn enough money to renovate her house and save for future needs.

loans.use: To expand a small business selling wholesale and retail goods

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine M. has a bakery where she prepares delicious local pastries and cakes, as well as some dishes. Part of the bakery serves as a shop. Lusine’s freshly baked produce attracts more and more customers.  Four people are employed at the bakery, including Lusine’s husband who delivers the pastries. 

To keep up with the proven basic items, as well as with growing customer demands, it is very important for Lusine to purchase a new oven and some machinery for the bakery.  The profit from the bakery is the main source of income for Lusine’s family, with two children studying at University and Lusine’s husband’s retired parents who share the same household.

loans.use: A new oven and some machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For colored paper and glue.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Shakirah has a business of selling tap water, which she has had for 3 years.

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and pay for the water bills.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and also buy food for home.  In the future, Shakirah hopes to take a course in mass communication.  Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business so that she can pay for her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase and pay for the water.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa tiene 35 años, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa, el cual está ubicado de manera ambulante. Hace más de 2 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo tiene gran competencia, pero ella ha manejado muy bien su negocio, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes y siempre está buscando la amanera de complacerlos con lo que le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de camisas, trajes de baño, shorts, faldas, vestidos, trajes entre otros productos. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Karla Vanesa is 35 years old and has a business as a traveling clothing saleswoman.  She has been working for herself for more than two years.  However, there is a lot of competition, but she has run her business very well.  The majority of her customers are young and she is always looking to satisfy them with the products they request from her.  The loan will be used to buy shirts, swimsuits, shorts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other products.  Her dream has always been to enlarge her business to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: buy shirts, swimsuits, shorts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other products.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Leticia C., tiene un hijo que actual mente esta estudian y que esta bajo la responsabilidad. 
Doña Alma Leticia tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios de belleza, desde hace ya más de un año. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y desea vender aparatos eléctricos y productos para bebes. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión, es por eso que solicita un préstamo el cual pagara con una parte de las ganancias que obtenga de las ventas del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en: La señora Alma Leticia C. has a son who is currently studying and is her responsibility.  Doña Alma Leticia has had a business selling clothing and beauty supplies for over a year now, which needs to diversify its merchandise.  She also wants to sells electric appliances and products for babies, but right now she doesn't have the money to invest.  This is why she is taking out a loan which she will repay with some of her sales earnings, which is her family's source of income.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Tukhtakhon

texts.en:
Tukhtakhon works in a very successful women's clothing business. She operates a sales location where she offers a selection of kid’s clothes that is always in demand. Tukhtakhon's business has a long history. She was able to start this venture 17 years ago and since that time her business has done quite well. Tukhtakhon is quite an entrepreneur and we are happy that she has chosen to apply her talents in a business that helps women be even prettier. 

Tukhtakhon has requested a loan of 10,000 TJS to give her more working capital to use in her business. It will be exciting to see how Tukhtakhon's enterprise will continue to grow in the future as she's off to even greater success. The loan will help Tukhtakhon develop her business and support her family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine N. K. is 67 years old, married, and has seven children.  She has a dairy farm, which she has run for 13 years.  Apart from dairy farming, she grows tea to supplement her income.  Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has witnessed growth in her business.  She is looking forward to adding more cows to her farm.  She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah  lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).    Peninah has a business of tailoring.  She has been in this business for less than a year and she works 6 days out of every week. Peninah sells her products in a shop. 

Peninah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials and thread. She also generates additional income through motorcycle for hire.  The main business challenge(s) for Peninah include seasonality and increasing prices of clothing materials.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school.   Peninah lives in a home that doesn't have access to electricity, but has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread

loans.name: Kiilu

texts.en:
Kiilu is a married man who has five children in school.  To earn a living for his family, he runs a barber shop (kinyozi).   He has five years of experience in the business and has employed five people.  He was able to grow his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  

Kiilu also does farming to generate additional income.  He hopes to open another barber shop so that he can generate more income for his family.   Kiilu has requested 34,980 Kenyan shillings so that he can install electricity in his rural home.

His dream is to see his children excelling in their education.

loans.use: To install electricity in his rural home.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 44 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married woman and mother of four school-age children. Gina has a backyard hog raising business as a secondary source of income. She established this home-based fast-growing business, which generates potential high profits in a relatively short period of time to earn a living. Gina earns PHP 2,000 every month for doing this business. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Gina requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to buy feed and piglets. Gina has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Gina hopes to have a large-scale piggery in her town.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel de 23 años, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Raquel tiene la clave del éxito como es la responsabilidad, puntualidad y valorar mucho al cliente. A pesar de su corta edad Raquel decidió emprender en abrir una pequeña bodega con la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares, ella sabe que es el primer paso para cosechar muchos triunfos durante su travesía, pues para esto ella ya cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes, esto debido al buen servicio que ofrece. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia y por sus dos pequeñas niñas que son el motor para salir adelante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete hacer puntual el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Raquel comprará nuevos productos para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Raquel is 23 years old and a single mother of two children.  She lives in her own home located in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district.  

Raquel has the key to success; she is responsible, punctual, and values her customers.  Despite her young age, Raquel decided to open a small general store to cover her family's expenses.  She knows that this is the first step to harvest many successes along her journey.  She already has a number of customers thanks to the good service that she offers.  

She is self-employed and works for herself and for her two young daughters, who are her motivation to get ahead.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time.  With the 1000 nuevos soles she requested, Raquel will purchase new products to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store.

loans.name: Lelia Luzmila

texts.es:
Lelia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Tiene instrucción superior incompleta.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace nueve años, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de productos de confitería como dulces, maná, fideos, etc.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará siete sacos de  maíz, fideos y azúcar.  Trabaja junto con su esposo y su suegra.  Nos cuenta que sus productos los venden en la ciudad de Puno.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia en cualquier otro lugar de la ciudad.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Lelia is a member of the communal bank "Niño Jesús de Praga," which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo in Puno province.  She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children.  She completed some college level work.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 9 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she used that money to increase her working capital for her business selling sweets, manna (a sweet similar to marzapan), noodles, etc.  

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy seven sacks of corn, noodles and sugar.  She works with her husband and her mother-in-law.  She tells us that she sells her products in the city of Puno.

Her dream is to have her own house in another part of the city.

What she likes about her communal bank is the camaraderie among the members.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of corn, noodles and sugar

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a farmer and a businessman in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya. His business involves selling vegetables at the local market. He has also been a farmer for the last 10 years, producing milk, potatoes, cabbage and maize.

Titus has made a loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He sees inaccessibility to reliable artificial insemination services as a challenge to farmers such as himself.

Titus says he hopes to improve his business and rear pedigree cows with the hopes of increasing his income to uplift the living standards of his family

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maxixe, provincia de Inhambane ao sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais todos são maiores de idade. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de emprego, é negociante a bastante tempo e tem um rendimento de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo no Hluvuku no valor de26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos PAR REVENDA( amendoim, arroz, oleo, farinha, refrescos, e outros ). O primeiro emprestimo foi de : 20.000.00mt, também para o negocio.  
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio oferecendo maior divercidade de produtos, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jose was born in Maxixe, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 4 children, all of whom are minors.  He attended school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to a lack of financial resources.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and does not support anyone else. 

He left Inhambane for Maputo to look for work.  He has had his own business for a long time and earns around 4.000.00mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and savings in his bank account. 

He has never had a loan with other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 26.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase products for sale (peanuts, rice, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, etc.) The first loan was for 20.000.00mt, also for his business.  

He dreams of expanding his business and offering greater product selection.  He intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku to do this.

loans.use: to purchase products for sale (peanuts, rice, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the leader of this group. She is 39 and is married to a farmer.  Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and two sons. The older son studies at university and the other children are attending local school. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price. In this way, they earn about 5000 soms per month. 

With the money received from this loan, Aida wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 3.7.58 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Ms. Cúc works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise to sell in the future.

Cúc is 50 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 3.7.58 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Cúc joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her  business. Cúc has successfully repaid 3 loans from FPW.

Cúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cúc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise to sell in future

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem, age 50, has been working in a farming business for a long time. She has a plot of fertile farmland in Kompong Speu province that she got from her grandparent. Normally she is able to earn some income from her crop-planting business, around $2.50 each day to use for the family’s needs.  Her husband is a policeman in his community. They are blessed with two children who are employed in various places but with the same career as domestic workers.

Mrs. Yem said that she has a plan to purchase some piglets to feed for their offspring and for slaughter, but her savings are insufficient to do that. To deal with this situation, Mrs. Yem would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy some pigs for breeding purposes. Mrs. Yem believes that she can sell her pigs when they are big enough. She can use the revenue to expand this pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for breeding purposes

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Mary is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale,

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida.

Él se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de mariscos, junto con su compañera de vida decidieron emprender este negocio, debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos para subsistir.

Don julio y su compañera de vida compran pescado y camarones en un puerto del país, cada ocho días, ellos preparan sus hieleras con suficiente hielo y depositan ahí 50 libras de camarones y 50 libras de pescado. Ellos compran directamente a los pescadores, por lo que les queda un buen margen de ganancia.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más cantidad de pescado y camarones, ya que los venden a un buen precio y muy rápido, debido a que han buscado mercado en la zona norte del país donde los pescados y camarones son muy escasos. Para ir a vender ellos toman hasta tres autobuses con su mercadería y les lleva un día entero para vender su mercadería.

Don Julio ve en el negocio de mariscos una fuente de ingresos bastante buena, pero que al mismo tiempo requiere  de mucho sacrificio, por lo que piensa ahorrar de los ingresos que obtenga y poder comprarse un carro y de esta forma tener su propio medio de transporte y vender más rápido sus mariscos.
texts.en:
Julio, 48, lives with his life companion.  He’s been selling seafood for the last two years.  He and his life companion decided to go into this business together because of the need to earn income to subsist.  Julio and his life companion buy fish and shrimp in one of the country’s ports every week.  They prepare their coolers with enough ice and place 50 pounds of shrimp and 50 pounds of fish in them.  They buy directly from the fishermen so they earn a good profit margin.

He is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy larger amounts of fish and shrimp because they sell it quickly and at a good price because they’ve staked out a market in the north of the country where fish and shrimp are scarce.  To go sell there they take up to three buses with their merchandise and it takes an entire day to sell their merchandise.

Julio sees the seafood selling business as quite a good source of income but at the same time it requires much sacrifice so he plans to save up some of the income he earns to be able to buy himself a car to have his own means of transportation and sell his seafood faster.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is from the village of Balghojiani in the Kakheti Region. He is married and lives with his wife Ketevan.  Akaki and Ketevan earn a living through a family agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf.  They also grow cabbages and watermelons. The harvested fruit and vegetables as well as the dairy products are sold in the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 550 Laris (approximately 330 USD). 

Akaki requested credit to purchase more calves. He will raise them during winter and spring and sell them in the summer for a higher price. The family will gain profit from the sale, which will be used for house renovation. After the house is renovated, the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Roilith

texts.es:
Roilith tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su casa propia que logró comprar gracias al apoyo de su pareja.
La actividad que realiza, es la venta de pescado y plátano, por lo tanto cuenta con un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal de su distrito. Es así que se levanta desde muy de temprano, tanto ella como su esposo se reparten las actividades, de esa manera se generan más ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que esta siempre al lado de su pareja, pues comparten muchas ilusiones, metas y anhelos, así como el ingreso económico que le genera y así solventar los gastos de su hogar. Su plan es ampliar su negocio y adquirir otro puesto de ventas en dicho mercado. Este seria el primer crédito con la institución MFP, y por ello espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado y plátanos en mayores volúmenes.
texts.en:
Roilith is 37 years old and a joyful and hardworking woman. She lives with her life-partner and their two children who they love very much. Together they live in their own home which she was able to buy thanks to the support of her partner. 

Her business is selling fish and plantains, and she has a stall in her district’s municipal market. She gets up very early, and she and her husband share the work. This way they make more money. What she likes about her business is always being by her husband’s side. They share many dreams, goals, and desires. With the income she makes, she is able to afford the household costs. Her plan is to expand their business and buy another stall in the market. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for your support. With the amount requested, she will invest in the purchase of fish and plantains in large quantity.

loans.use: to buy fish and plantains.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu is 57 years old and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with two children. Her husband is retired.

To earn a living, Hieu has a business selling soft drinks from her door. She has run this activity for fifteen years. Hieu would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr:
Mariétou est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants et 4 petits fils.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick .
Mariétou pratique le commerce dans la vente de fruits et légumes une activité qu'elle maitrise bien pour l 'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau prêt de 250000 elle va acheter 35 paniers d'oranges , 25 paniers de mandarines et 15 sacs d'oignons et des pastèques.
A l'aide de ses bénéfices Madame va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des enfants et acheter du riz du sucre et de l'huile à la fin de chaque mois.
texts.en: Mariétou is a married woman who is 60 years old and has six children and four grandsons. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 1st September 2008 and belongs to the Sope Malick solidarity group. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables, a business which she masters well since she has been doing it for a long time. With her new loan of 250,000 francs she is going to buy 35 baskets of oranges, 25 baskets of mandarins and 15 sacks of onions, as well as some water melons. With her profits Mariétou will help her husband with the cost of their children's education and also buy rice, sugar and oil at the end of each month.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables (oranges, water melons, mandarins and onions, cabbages, etc.)

loans.name: Hoson

texts.en:
Hoson is a 50-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Hoson sells blankets and clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to increase her income by purchasing more clothes and blankets to sell.

Hoson is looking to open a shop for her products instead of selling them from home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 41 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy supports her family with the income that she earns selling nutritional soup. She intends to use her loan to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es: El Banco El Señor es mi Rey, está formado por emprendedores que día a día luchan por salir adelante con sus negocios. Este banco tiene 11 integrantes en el cual sus negocios son diferentes pero con sueños de crecer y invertir en sus negocios. La presidente del grupo que es Vilma de la Cruz los está siempre motivando para que todos juntos salgan adelante, apoyándose unos a otro. Heydi Johana  es parte de este grupo de emprendedores en el cual su actividad económica es la venta de cerdo,  enchiladas y tacos en su comunidad, ya tiene clientes fijos y eventuales que la visita, el financiamiento que está solicitando es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de cerdos y materia prima para la elaboración de las enchiladas y tacos. Al igual que el reto del grupo el financiamiento lo están solicitando para invertir en sus negocios en esta temporada que muy buena.
texts.en:
The ‘El Señor es mi Rey’ bank is made up of entrepreneurs who are struggling on a day-to-day basis to get ahead with their businesses.  The bank has 11 members; each of them has a different type of business, but they have a shared desire to grow and invest in their respective businesses.  The president of the group is Vilma de la Cruz, who is always motivating them to get ahead together and to help each other.  

Heydi Johana is part of this group of entrepreneurs.  Her economic activity is selling pork, enchiladas, and tacos in her community.  She already has regular customers as well as occasional customers that she visits.  She is asking for the loan so she can purchase pork and ingredients for making enchiladas and tacos.
