Sonia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank "Madres Coraje" (Courageous Mothers).  Sonia invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in her family's bakery and also plans to use this loan of 1,700 soles to purchase ingredients for making various types of bread.  

Sonia has always used her loans to help support the bakery that her mother runs as a family business.  Sonia's goal is to eventually purchase an electric oven for baking (at this time Sonia's family bakes all of their breads in a clay oven using firewood as fuel).

Sonia is pictured here next to a machine for kneading dough.

loans.use: Ingredients for baking breads and cakes at a family-run bakery

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina I. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 62 years old. Rosalina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosalina runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 from PMPC. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: La señora Juliana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 08 hijos ya mayores D. edad.Juliana, es una mujer que a su edad, se siente capaz D. seguir a delante y trabajar, se dedica a la venta D. frutas, venD. en el Mercado Central “Pomarrosa” y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar donD. cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama D. casa necesita, para preparar sus jugos u otras cosas, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con una sonrisa.Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, comprará sacos D. naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. Juliana, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.

loans.use: Comprará sacos de frutas.

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Carmenza B. ha iniciado su pequeño negocio de venta de productos ferreteros pero no presa las condiciones necesarias y además requiere surtir el negocio para ofertar tales productos.

Ella muy sabiamente ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos ferreteros y de esta manera ofertarlos y así ir ampliando poco a poco su negocio hasta convertirse en una excelente comerciante.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinandega, Sra. Carmenza B. started her small business selling hardware products. However, she does not have the necessary capital to restock her store so that she can continue offering these items.

She wisely requested a loan so that she could directly invest in the purchase of more hardware products. This will enable her to gradually expand her business so that she can become a good businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware products

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia P. is currently in the business of selling beer and charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Lucia is 22 years old and is Single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market and buy fridges for keeping beer fresh and cold.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Tumur

texts.en:
G. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two older children attend a local secondary school and her youngest child is in kindergarten.

Her husband owns livestock and works as a herder in the countryside outside of their town. G. operates an imported clothing and household goods business out of a stall in a local market. She began her business in 2008 and has been able to increase her family’s earnings greatly in that short amount of time. Her business has stabilized over the past year and she has begun to integrate herself into the business community. She would like to eventually increase her profits enough so that she can afford to build her family a house to live in where they can be more comfortable.

G. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to import a large number of hats, coats, jeans and pants from China, as well as some household items for their ger.

loans.use: To import a large number of hats, coats, jeans and pants from China, as well as some household items for their ger

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Cette femme a ouvert dans sa maison une boutique de vente des produits d’alimentation générale ; son activité est située dans le quartier de Dabarakondji à Lomé, où elle réalise de très bonnes affaires. Elle accueille bien ses clients qui viennent en tout temps effectuer des achats chez elle. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 1994 ; grâce à ce commerce, elle arrive à apporter sa contribution dans la gestion de son foyer. Elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 cartons de petits pois, 10 cartons de tomates en boîtes,05 cartons de lait "PEAK", 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, des savons et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who opened a store in her house to sell grocery items. Her business is located in the Dabarakondji district of Lomé where her commerce is going very nicely. She really accommodates her customers who come to her place at any time to make their purchases. She started this business in 1994. Thanks to this commerce, she manages to do her share in managing the household. She would like to obtain a WAGES loan to buy 5 boxes of peas, 10 boxes of canned tomatoes, 5 boxes of the milk "PEAK", 10 boxes of pasta, soap and other diverse products. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and a variety of foodstuff

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Hassan has owned a bakery for seven years. He has been selling mankoucheh.  Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hassan is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery.  Hassan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 

Hassan is exceptional in his work because he knows how to treat his clients.  His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash, as well as not a lot of passersby.  He decided to open his business because of his experience; he learned these skills when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma G. is from the town of Lawy, Capas Tarlac. She is 47 years old. Alma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling different kinds of vegetables in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used for additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixteenth loan taken out by Alma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is married with 5 children. At the age of 61, she is very hard-working women. She lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Christiana sells palm oil to meet her standard of living. She been in this business for over 12 years and in LAPO Microfinance for over 2 years. Christiana is soliciting for a loan of 80,000 to purchase more products to meet the high demand of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah K. W. is forty-five years old, married, and has four children. His wife sells clothes and their children are still in school.  They hope to give their children quality education. His business is located at Serem-a busy market in Kakamega. He engages in selling meat to the local people, something he loves doing and has engaged in for the last seventeen years. In addition to his butchery business, he also sells maize. Jeremiah has a major challenge of high prices of livestock and that's why he is using his loan to buy more livestock for slaughter. In 5 years, he sees himself opening three butcheries and buying a lorry (truck) to transport maize to his customers. He has a dream to acquire more wealth and improve his living standards. He is very interested in improving himself and is a polite man.

loans.use: Livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of cosmetics, beauty products, and hairpieces

loans.name: Erick José

texts.es: El Sr. Erick M. S. solicita el crédito para compra de materiales como madera, clavos, piedra y cemento para terminar de construir su casa ya que la tiene a media no la había podido terminar de hacer, ha tenido tres créditos con ceprodel y los ha invertido en su casa, casado le tienen 3 hijos dos en edad escolar, los crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido salir adelante con su hogar ahora ya tienen un techo sus hijos donde estar antes no lo tenía con los dos créditos anterior con el primero compro el terreno y con el segundo la empezó a construir y ahora ya la va a terminar.
texts.en:
Erick M. S. is requesting the loan for the purchase of materials such as wood, nails, stone and cement to finish building his house since it is half finished and he has not been able to complete it. He has had three loans with Ceprodel and has invested them in his house. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are school-aged. The loans that he has had with Ceprodel have helped a lot since he has been able to get ahead with his house that now has roof;the place where he lived before didn't have one. With his first loan, he purchased the land, with the second he started to build and now he is going to finish it.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, nails, stone and cement

loans.name: Akob

texts.en:
Akob is a 60-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Akob has been working as a tailor since 1985. He is special in his work because he is known for his good and talented work. He produces and repairs all type of clothes. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for his work and repair his sewing machine. Akob has been a micro-credit client for ten years now and has always repaid on time.

His previous loans allowed him to improve his business, purchasing better thread and having a more sophisticated sewing machine. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Akob decided on doing his business because of his experience in the field. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase thread for his work and repair his sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of "pagnes"

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. is a 36-year-old lady married to Karanja Kariuki. They are blessed with two children aged ten and four years. Stella has been selling charcoal for the last six years in Naivasha town.

This is Stella’s first loan from KADET, and she has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before. She got to know about KADET through her friends in Naivasha town.

Stella will use this loan to restock her fast-growing charcoal business. Apart from selling charcoal, her future aspiration is to set up a boutique in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To restock her fast-growing charcoal business

loans.name: Nicolaza Wilberta

texts.es:
Nicolaza es socia del Banco Comunal Trinidad.
Nicolaza es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Nicolaza tiene un puesto en el mercado de las América en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Nicolaza necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite.
Los sueños de Nicolaza son tener un restaurante donde solo administre y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nicolaza, 38, is a member of the Trinidad (Trinity) communal bank. She is married and has two children. She has a food stall in the De las Américas market; her daughter helps her with her daily tasks. Nicolaza needs a 1500 sol loan to buy rice, sugar, pasta and cooking oil. Nicolaza’s dream is to have a restaurant where she would only be the manager and that her children grow to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola is a trader, she sells and supply bottled and sachet drinking water for various ceremonies, she has been in business for over ten years and with this trade she supports her husband in providing for the needs of the family. Abiola is a faithful LAPO client, she goes to factory once in two weeks to get bottled and sachet water in large quantity at a discount. 

She is requesting for a loan of NGN70, 000 to purchase more drinking water to sell which will enable her meet customers’ demands while increasing her profit. 
Abiola is 44years old and has four children, she says thank you to Kiva lenders and promise to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinking water to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina Y. is a hardworking, married woman who sells orchids to earn a living. She’s been selling orchids to the people in her village for ten years.  Cristina belongs to a group of young entrepreneurs where she saves her money and has secured capital from ASHI. She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her business, hence her better living standards. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy orchid seeds and  more orchids to sell.  She hopes to buy more orchids in the future for better output. She sees herself venturing into the flower shop business in the next five years.  Cristina is hoping that her envisioned business will help her in supporting the financial needs of her two children so that they are able to graduate from college. By then, Cristina thinks their lives will be changed and she will have her dreams achieved.

loans.use: to buy more orchid seeds and orchids to sell

loans.name: Norma Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Norma García tiene 42 años es casada y tiene dos hijas menores de edad. La señora Norma tiene un negocio de venta de leña, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. No es un negocio pequeño, ya que ella lo que hace es comprar los piezas grandes de leña, paga para que los rajen y luego distribuye a las ventas cercanas y también al mercado. Ella ya tiene 15 años de tener este negocio, sin embargo es importante mencionar que antes la señora también tenía un negocio de pulpería, sin embargo lo tuvo que desistir debido a que muchos créditos daban y la gente no le pagaba. La señora está solicitando este crédito ya que desea ampliar su negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido que con su trabajo sus hijas puedan prepararse y llegar a estudiar en la universidad, brindándole una mejor vida con mayores facilidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma García is 42 years old, married, and has two young daughters. Sra. Norma operates a firewood business from her home. This is not a small business since she has to buy large pieces of firewood and is responsible for splitting them into smaller logs before distributing them to nearby stores or selling them at the market. She has 15 years of experience in this business. However, it is important to mention that she also had a grocery store, but she had to close it down because too many customers purchased on credit and never paid her.

Sra. Norma is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business. Her dream has always been to prepare her daughters so that they could study at the university and provide them a better life with all the conveniences.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to expand her business

loans.name: Dios Proveera 4,5,6 Group

texts.en:
Monica is the coordinator of her group Dios Proveera (God will provide), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Monica is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses, pants, sheets, and skirts.

She will use the profits to save toward her goal of owning her own home.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, sheets, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer B. owns and operates a store selling daily use products such as Milo, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in his community. He is 36 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Elmer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Elmer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase products to sell. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his third loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Houndjiho

texts.fr: Née en 1967, A. Houndjiho vit depuis une quinzaine d'année au quartier Dégakon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Houndjiho est mariée à HOUESSOU ABO Jérémie et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Houndjiho vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Dégakon. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Houndjiho n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Houndjiho vend des produits de mer (poissons frais, etc.) au Port de pêche à Cotonou. Houndjiho achète également ses produits au port de pêche. Houndjiho exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans environs et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son activité et de rehausser son stock de produits de mer, Houndjiho sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967, Houndjiho A. has been living for about 15 years in the Dégakon neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Jérémie HOUESSOU ABO and the mother of three school-attending children. The couple has another child to support. Houndjiho lives together with her children and husband in Dégakon. The couple jointly provides for the family. Houndjiho never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells seafood (fresh fish, etc.) at the Cotonou fishing port, where she also purchases her supplies. She's been running this business for about 15 years, and already benefited from five loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were all repaid without problems. In order to bolster her business and increase her stock of seafood, Houndjiho is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood (fish, etc.)

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin R. is from San Jose, Talibon. She is 26 years old. Algin is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Algin owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products. 

Algin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Algin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Algin is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan is Algin's fourth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, CEVI has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but it also has regular cluster group meetings that provide saving, insurance, and training opportunities.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help their Field Partners to post loans in English and to provide quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcus is a businesswoman who makes a living selling cereals in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last three years and employs one person. She also earns additional income from various part-time jobs. Dorcus is 38 years old, married and has three children. She hopes to expand her business so that she can earn enough money to meet all of her family's needs and open up a wholesale business where she sells cereal to other companies. She is applying for a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more cereal to sell to her customess. She describes herself as reliable, hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y un hermano, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ellos residen en la colonia Punta Diamante de Usulután, Ella trabaja junto a su madre administrando el negocio de venta de Ropa al por mayor, ella aprendió el comercio de Ropa por su tía, quien se dedica también a este tipo de comercio, Rosa ya tiene 8 años de poseer su propio negocio.
Hoy ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y así surtir su negocio, invirtiendo este préstamo en la compra de 10 fardos de ropa. Dicha inversión ayudara a que Rosa junto a su madre puedan tener un negocio más estable, que poco a poco crezca dentro del mercado, dándoles los ingresos que necesitan para cubrir sus necesidades, obteniendo mayores ventas y mayores ganancias.
El sueño de Rosa es poseer un negocio grande y fuerte en la venta de ropa mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 24, is a young woman living with her mother and brother. She’s single and has no children. She lives in Usulután’s Punta Diamante neighborhood. She works alongside her mother running a wholesale clothing business. She learned the business from her aunt who is in this line of work also. Rosa has had her own business for 8 years now. Today she needs a loan to buy stock items for her business. She will use the loan to buy 10 bundles of clothing. This investment will help Rosa and her mother have a more stable business that can gradually grow in the marketplace giving them the income they need to meet their needs, obtaining higher sales and greater profits. Rosa’s dream is to have a large store and, strong in clothing sales, be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina se dedica al negocio de panadería, la cual vende en de forma ambulante. Tiene 67 años y tiene 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 20 años, este negocio inicio por su Madre y con el paso del tiempo fue que ahorro lo suficiente para establecer su propio negocio. Ya que sus ventas son en su mayoría al crédito, a recuperarse en 15 días, lo mas 30 días. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de pan para suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Ella sueña con dejarles algún día a sus hijos el negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is dedicated to making baked goods, which she sells itinerantly.  She is 67 years old and has two children, both adults.

She has been in this business for 20 years.  It was started by her mother, and after some time she was able to raise enough money to establish her own business.

Because most of her sales are on credit, she collects after 15 days and at most, after 30 days.  Now she asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of bread to meet her client’s demands.

She dreams of one day leaving her children a well established business.

loans.use: Working capital for a bakery.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C. is 40 years old. She has eight children of whom three go to school.  C. is married to a policeman.

She currently has a business brewing local alcohol and selling beans and requests a loan to stock crates of beer and maize flour to sell.  In future, she intends to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: A. Antoinette est née le 13 Juin 1972. Antoinette est mariée à DOSSA Denis. Antoinette, alphabétisé, est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Agbodjêdo depuis dix (10) ans, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, le capitale économique du Bénin. Toutes les charges familiales sont assurées par le couple. Antoinette vend de nourritures (pâte riz) et aussi des condiments, de l'huile de plame à Cotonou. Antoinette exerce cette activité, il y a dix sept (17) ans environs. Antoinette fait l’achat de ses produits à Zongo, un marché de Cotonou. C’est pour l’évolution et le renforcement de son activité que Antoinette sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les anciens crédits reçus par Antoinette auprès de ALIDé ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
A. Antoinette was born on June 13, 1972.  She is married to DOSSA Denis.  Antoinette, who is illiterate, is the mother of three children, all in school.  The family has been living for ten years in Agbodjêdo, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  All family expenses are covered by the couple

Antoinette sells food (cornmeal mash, rice) and also condiments and palm oil in Cotonou.  She has been in this business for about seventeen years.  She makes her purchases at Zongo, a market in Cotonou.  To improve and strengthen her business, she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé.  The former loans she received from ALIDé have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: Buying sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, etc.), palm oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sophak Tit, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 2004 and have no children yet. 

Mrs. Orn S. sells bananas and mangos.  She buys them under contract from fellow villagers and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market.  Her husband is a wooden-house builder. 

Orn applied for a Kiva loan one time before.  She hopes to continue her business so she is requesting another loan of 500 USD to purchase mangos under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangos under contract for resale.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 28 years old and married, with two children who are 5 and 6. Beatha’s husband is a farmer.  Farming is not very fruitful in this region so Beatha decided to help her husband provide the necessities for their family by starting her own business. The family works hard, especially Beatha, who sells different products such as water, juice, cosmetic products, and so on. She has been working in this business for 8 years now.

Beatha has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more products for her shop. This loan will help her obtain more profit from her sales. With the extra profit, Beatha hopes to pay her children's school fees and to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water, juice, cosmetic products, etc.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch R. is a hard working man who makes his living by weaving baskets with his wife at home. This couple has seven children, four of whom are single and the rest are married.  Of all his children, three are work at different jobs to share his responsibility of supporting the entire family’s needs. 

Touch R. and his wife go through the village looking for bamboo and take it home and soak it in water for almost a week.  The bamboo is then dried in the sun for three days. Touch and his wife then split the bamboo into smaller pieces and weave them into baskets.  Touch R. is taking a loan to invest in his handicraft business, to buy some baskets for sale.

loans.use: To buy some baskets for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 57 years old, is widowed and lives in a place called Lower Kabete, which is off the capital city, Nairobi. She is a farmer and does crop farming. She has been farming for 10 years now and has been successful. This is her primary business, and now she wants to buy some seedlings, fertilizers and manure for the next planting season.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing member and this is her third loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET.

Lucy hopes that with this loan her trade will expand and she will be able to supply farm produce to the neighboring area of Wangige and the capital city of Nairobi.

She also desires to open a green house in future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, and manure for the planting season

loans.name: Nuevos Esfuerzos Group

texts.es: adfasd

loans.use: Compra de medicamentos

loans.name: Teresa Jepchumba

texts.en:
Teresa Jepchumba K. is a single woman of 41 years. She has three children who are still young. They live in Tuiyo in the outskirts of Eldoret. She runs a horticulture business where she plants vegetables for resale after harvest. She has been in this business for one year now and gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Teresa's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to diversify her business and start poultry keeping for eggs production. She will use the money to construct a poultry house and use the balance to buy chicks to raise and sell later. 

With the income she will get, she will use the income to save and buy a piece of land and start maize farming. In the future, she wants to continue with horticulture business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To construct a poultry house for poultry keeping

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new minibus

loans.name: Deysi Patricia

texts.es:
Deysi vive en Ciudad de del Este, tiene 19 años y deseos de iniciar en la univerdad en la carrera de contabilidad.
Ella tiene 2 hermanos más que aún son menores.
Su padre trabaja en una concesionaria y su madre es ama de casa.
Deysi actualmente trabaja en el microcentro como vendedora en un negocio, donde está adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Deysi tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera para poder trabajar ejerciendo su profesión.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
Deysi agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Deysi lives in Ciudad de Este. She is 19 years old and wants to study accounting in university.
She has two younger brothers. 
Her father works at a dealership and her mother is a housewife.
At the moment, Deysi works downtown as a salesperson in a business. She is gaining experience and at the same time, she is earning income to use for her studies.
Deysi wants to finish her degree, so she can start practicing her profession. 
She is requesting this loan to pay the monthly payment for her studies and to buy the books needed for studying.
Deysi is grateful for this loan that will help her with her studies and at the same time, she can establish credit references which will be very important for future projects.

loans.use: to pay for university enrollment and other study materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita F. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Jovita is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coco and wood charcoal in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional charcoal to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jovita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn M. is from the city of Cebedo Extension, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Evelyn is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Evelyn operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor-transport services. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase motor accessories and to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories and to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El Comité ha culminado el séptimo ciclo del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras”, cuenta con 19 integrantes, todas del barrio 8 de diciembre de la ciudad de Villa Elisa; el comité demuestra muy buena organización, realizan actividades regularmente en pos del fortalecimiento del grupo, además buscan constantemente aumentar sus ingresos personales y grupales.
Están interesadas en seguir formando parte de nuestro programa, por lo cual mantienen su moral de pago, demuestran también la solidaridad con aquellas que cuando tienen algún inconveniente de salud no pueden pagar su cuota, festejan los cumpleaños y otros eventos especiales.
Ellas ya conocen el método de trabajo de Kiva y por eso desean solicitar otro préstamo para poder seguir creciendo como profesionales.
La sra. Marta C. es cocinera desde hace mucho tiempo, ella empezó desde muy joven a cocinar en las casas de distintas personas como un empleada doméstica, luego se dio cuenta que podía ganar más ingresos si se perfeccionaba, fue así que compró libros de cocina y recetas para ser autodidacta, ya que no podía pagar un curso para saber el arte culinario.
Hoy día ella se destaca por sus ricas comidas preparadas con mucho cuidado y esmero.
Marta como sus demás colegas del comité desea poder superarse más y desea acceder al crédito para comprar más comestibles como carnes, fideos, verduras y condimentos, entre otras cosas, para poder cocinar en mayor cantidad y con productos de más calidad.
texts.en:
This committee has completed its seventh loan cycle within the "Committee of Women Entrepreneurs" program.  The group has 19 members who are all from the 8 de Diciembre neighborhood, in the city of Villa Elisa.  The committee has shown itself to be very well organized.  The members regularly carry out activities aimed at strengthening their group.  They are also constantly seeking to increase their personal incomes and group income.

The members of this group are keen to continue being part of our program and maintain their will to make their repayments.  They demonstrate great mutual support and help out whenever anybody might have a health problem that means they can't meet their repayment.  They celebrate birthdays together and other special events.  They are already aware of the way Kiva works and would like to request another loan so that they can continue growing as professionals.

Marta C. has been a cook for a long time.  She started cooking in other people's homes as a maid when she was very young.  She then realized that she could make more income if she perfected her skill.  She bought cookbooks and recipes and taught herself the art of cooking since she couldn't afford to pay for a course.  Marta is now well known for her rich food which is made with great care and attention.

Marta, in common with her fellow committee members, would like to be able to improve herself still further and would like to receive a loan so that she can buy more food products, including meat, noodles, vegetables and condiments, so that she can cook in larger quantities and make better-quality food.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, noodles, meat, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat S., 22, is the leader of this group. Despite her young age, it was Gulzat, who researched the loan opportunity provided by Kiva lenders and who initiated gathering a group of entrepreneurs, who are in need of financial assistance, however are equally ambitious. 

Gulzat is single and lives with her brother, who actively takes part in the promotion of a new business. Gulzat’s care and ability to see high potential in every child has brought her to a kindergarten. She enjoys her job at a daycare and wants to continue. The story of her business started only a year ago, when she spent her full monthly salary on the purchase of one head of livestock. Gulzat’s brother takes responsibility for taking care of it while his sister’s at work. So far the reselling of  cattle generates approximately 1 500 soms a month. 

Saving a small amount allowed Gulzat purchase a long-awaited refrigerator for her kitchen. She’s proud of seeing the actual results that cattle reselling helps her achieve. Every member of the group has his or her own purposes for the loan. For Gulzat it’s the purchase of 2 head of livestock, so that she expands the business.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 31 years old, married and has a five year-old child. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. Additionally, he works as a marketer. He believes that with financial support from Faulu Kenya, he will grow his business and open other branches. He has requested for 20,000 Kes to relocate to a bigger business premise.

loans.use: To relocate to a bigger business premise for his retail shop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, aged 31, is married to Josephat who operates a commercial vehicle. They are blessed with two children, aged seven and four.  Gladys has been running a general retail shop for the last two years, selling items such as cereals, snacks, sweets, etc. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 25,050.  

This is Gladys' first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy cereals such as rice, peas, lentils and other types of cereals to resell. She intends to use the anticipated profits to open an M-pesa outlet and hopes to own a supermarket in future.

loans.use: buy cereal grains to resell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. For the past five years, Vergie has run a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and bread. 

Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime es originario de la localidad de Melchor Ocampo, el esta casado con la señora Maria de la Luz, ellos tienen 3 hijos un joven de 17 años estudiante de primaria, una jovencita de 13 años estudiante de secundaria y una niña de 9 años estudiante de primaria. Don Jaime tiene un puesto de tacos en su localidad cerca del centro de su población, el vende tacos de bistec y tacos de cabeza al vapor, también vende consomés y refrescos, el tiene 20 años con su negocio y surte la carne y las verduras en la población de Angangueo ya que ahí le dan mas barata la carne. Jaime comenta que el esta muy contento por el préstamo que le están haciendo ya que así podrá comprar un poco mas de carne para la elaboración de tacos. La meta que tiene el señor Jaime es mas adelante poner un puesto de venta de pollos al carbón en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime is originally from the Melchor Ocampo neighborhood.  He is married to María de la Luz and they have 3 young children who are primary school students.  They have a 17 year-old in school, one young 13 year-old girl in secondary school and a 9-year-old girl in primary school. 

Jaime has a taco stand in his neighborhood near the center of the town.  He sells steak tacos, tacos de cabeza al vapor (traditional steamed tacos), consomés (clear soup) and sodas.  He has been in this business for 20 years and he gets his meat and vegetables from Angangueo since there they sell cheaper meat.

Jaime says that he is very happy to receive the loan because he will be able to buy a little more meat to make his tacos.  

Jaime's goal is to move forward and put a post for the sale of grilled chicken in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy meat for his taco stand.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 42 años de edad, ella tiene 03 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, trabajadores y aportan para su hogar ellos residen en la ciudad de Guadalupe en la provincia de Pacasmayo, la vida por su domicilio es buena,  ya que su domicilio esta ubicado en la misma  ciudad de Guadalupe, en el departamento de La Libertad.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 7 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Victoria desea ampliar su negocio con la compra comprando 2 andamios y adquiriendo más mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles.

Victoria trabajara y se esfuerza continuamente para que sus ingresos y de esta manera mejore su calidad de vida para su familia ya que una de sus perspectivas es ser unas de las mejores bodega de la zona por donde radica
texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old.  She has 3 children who are already independent, and who work hard to contribute to the household.  They live in the city of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo province.  Their home life is good, since their home is located in the same city of Guadalupe in the department of La Libertad.

Victoria has a store set up in her house.  There, she offers her neighbors a variety of basic consumer goods and groceries for sale. She has had this business for 7 years, and she now has a loyal customer base.  Thanks to this activity, she has been able to support her family and get ahead over time.  

Victoria wants to expand her store buy purchasing 2 units of scaffolding and by purchasing more merchandise to satisfy the demand of her customers.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,500 Peruvian soles.

Victoria works and struggles constantly to get  income so that she can improve her family's quality of life; one of her plans is to have one of the best stores in her area.

loans.use: to buy scaffolding and merchandise for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has been farming for the past 7 years producing pineapple, tea and milk in her hometown of Litein, South Rift Kenya.

Joyce has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says she hopes the dairy cow will improve her income and enable her to construct a modern dairy unit as well as educating and feeding her children. She also wants to buy more land to grow nappier grass for her dairy cows.

Joyce says the challenge in dairy farming remains cattle feed which is very scarce and expensive.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking ingredients, and cocoa drink for resale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. For the past 6 years, Myrna has operated a computer shop that provides encoding and photocopying. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for her shop. Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shop

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the leader of this group. She is 49 and, unfortunately, is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Her older son is a truck driver, her second son studies in the Police Academy, and her daughter is a student. Anara works as a bookkeeper for the Department of Agriculture. She applied for this loan because while she has saved some money from her salary, she needs additional funds to purchase a refrigerator. In the future she wants to see her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 50-years-old, is a food seller who earns $10 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns $10 per day. This couple has four children: two are studying, one is a tailor who earns $2.5 per day and the other one is at home. Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $10 electricity, $30 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 for her daughter to get blood tests and other services for her to work in Korea. She plans to buy a new car for her husband's taxi service because his car is old.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter to get blood tests to go to work in Korea

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a hardworking business man, aged 35. He is married and blessed with one child who is still in school. For the last two years, he has been managing a cafeteria to make a living. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a piece of land. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, such as cooking fat and wheat flour

loans.name: Los H. Group

texts.es:
El grupo los H. lo conforman tres personas trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es Darling del Socorro quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usa y nueva desde hace 5 años. Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería pantalones, blusas y ropa de niño.
Las otros integrantes son Leonardo quien vende pan y Mayra Ernestina quien vende ropa usada desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The “H” group es composed of three hardworking, enterprising people.  One of them is Darling del Socorro who has been selling new and used clothes for five years.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses and children’s clothes.
The other group members are Leonardo who sells bread and Mayra Ernestina who has sold used clothes for three years.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo es un hombre trabajador de 43 años. Él convive desde hace 20 años con Antonia, ambos tienen 5 hijos y todos viven en una casita humilde pero propia. Mateo, desde niño se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que le ha dado en todo este tiempo, el sustento necesario para mantener a su familia. Sus hijos ya tienen las fuerzas necesA. para ayudarlo en las labores del campo, por ello, la familia entera incluyendo a Antonia, trabaja arduamente en el campo. Siembra principalmente arvejas, siendo el producto que más ingresos le genera, además de papa, habas y maíz.  La principal dificultad que éste incansable padre de familia encuentra en todo este tiempo de vida, es la falta de capital para ampliar sus sembríos y hacerlos producir en mayor cantidad, situación que ha venido manejando gracias a la labor coordinada de su banco comunal. Mas adelante, él quisiera ver a sus hijos estudiar carreras técnicas o universitA. en la ciudad, por lo que continúa labrando la tierra para ahorrar y lograr sus metas. Con ésta serán 8 veces que Mateo trabaja con MFP y su Banco Comunal, de los que siente gran cariño por estar siempre pendientes de sus necesidades, por esa razón, él necesita de su ayuda para proseguir su camino rumbo a la autosuperación. Con el dinero, el podrá contratar personal para que apoyen en la siembra y cosecha de sus papas, que haciendo cálculos no pasarán de 5 peones en 5 días. Así el gastará 28 soles diarios por cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Mateo, 43, is a hardworking man.  He’s lived with Antonia for the last 20 years and they have five children.  They all live in a little house that’s humble but theirs.  Since childhood Mateo has been farming, an activity that has provided sustenance to support his family all this time.  His children are strong enough now to help him with the field work so the entire family, including Antonia, works hard in the fields.  

His main crop is peas since that’s what earns the most income but he also grows potatoes, lima beans and corn.  The main difficulty this tireless father faces throughout his life is the lack of capital to expand his crops and produce in larger quantities, a situation he’s been managing thanks to the coordinated work with his communal bank.  Later on he’d like to see his children study technical or university careers in the city so he continues working the land to save up and reach his goals.

This will be the 8th time Mateo works with MFP and his communal bank for which he feels much affection because they are always concerned for his needs.  Because of this, he needs their help to continue along his road to self-improvement.  With the money, he’ll be able to hire personnel to help him with potato planting and harvesting which he calculates will not be more than five day workers for five days which will mean a daily expense of 28 soles per worker.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a widow with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in Baybay Triunfo, Ozamiz City.
Loreta sells snacks (siopao) to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase five sacks of flour.
Loreta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Loreta hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of flour

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The is 57 and lives with her two children and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard. She earns a living by running a general store from her house. She began this business seven years ago.

The would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, will help her to improve her family's living conditions, and will enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.ru: Фазлиддин женат и ответственный отец пятерых детей. Он хочет содержать свою семью в хороших жизненных условиях. Он знает что работа на земле всегда приносит доход , поэтому он занимается выращиванием сельхозкултур. Более двух лет Фазлиддин выращивает лук и зерно. Фазлиддин запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, ядохимикатов и оплаты труда работников.
texts.en: Fazliddin is married and a responsible father of five children. He wants to maintain his family in good living conditions. He knows that the work on the land always brings profit so he is engaged in cultivation of crops. Fazliddin has been growing onions and corn for more than two years. Fazliddin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay his employees for work.

loans.use: to purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Mombasa, Kenya and owns a retail shop. He is married and a father of one child. His business was started 6 years ago. 

Daniel was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 35,000 KES to purchase shoes and ladies’ handbags. His main challenges are the high cost of imported goods and transport. 

Daniel looks forward to owning a large store and opening other shops too in the future. He will use the extra income obtained to invest for future family needs, open a business for the wife, and meet other house needs.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and ladies’ handbags.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 42 years old, married and has one child.  She has been running her general store for four years and earns about P8,000 a month. Myrna is aiming to increase her profits due to expensive basic commodities and high electric bill. So for that reason, she is asking for financial support in the amount of P9,000 to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, and biscuits for her store. She believes that she can improve her store through the loan she requested.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, and biscuits for her store

loans.name: Bordadoras De Tete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las bordadoras de tete  sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así porque todas  se dedican con su localidad y sus artesanías, ellas se dedican  bordar y elaborar servilletas, manteles y huipiles.
Una de las  integrantes del grupo es la señora Estela quien se  dedica a la venta y elaboración de servilletas, manteles y huipiles.
Doña Estela nos cuenta que ya lleva diez años dedicándose a la elaboración de manteles  y servilletas.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tejer, y didugarle las flores  a su manta para  sus manteles se vean más luminosas y llamen la atención de sus clientes.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Fidencio quien está orgulloso de ella ya que es una mujer artesana y trabajadora que se gana el pan de cada día con su creatividad  y esfuerzo.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos  Edgar de ocho años de edad, Jennifer de cinco años de edad y Herminio de tres años de edad quien ayuda a su mama cortándole los hilos y pasándole los palos de madera para apretar la manta.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más hilos de colores y manta blanca y de colores.
Las integrantes del grupo son:
María- quien se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
Socorro- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.
Lucia- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas de manteles y servilletas.
Estela- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.
Justina- quien se dedica a la venta de manteles y servilletas y huipiles.
Eladia- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles y huipiles.
Felicitas- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas, manteles y huipiles.
Margarita- quien  se dedica a la venta de manteles y huipiles.
Catalina- quien se dedica a la venta de manteles y servilletas.
Adelina- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a las personas que elaboran su propia mercancía  con su creatividad y artículos mexicanos.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth to make table cloths and huipiles [traditional indigenous blouses].

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, 27 years old, is married and has a nine-year-old daughter. He describes himself as a courageous man. He has been selling items such as tea leaves, sugar, salt, doughnuts, lamps etc for the last three years. His business challenge is insufficient funds to expand the business. 

He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more doughnuts, sugar, tea leaves, lamps, etc. In the next five years, Josphat hopes to run more such general stores.

loans.use: To buy more doughnuts, sugar, tea leaves, lamps, etc.

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut wants to increase her business by raising local pigs for pig roll [roast suckling pig]. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and feed. Pigs for pig roll are usually only kept for two to three months and then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her feed the pigs and clean the barn. Ni Ketut will save her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen. 

Ni Ketut is on the left in the front row holding a green book.

loans.use: to purchase three local piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine est né vers 1944 à IFOLA, il est marié à deux femmes, est père de 13 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame chez son père à IFOLA dans le cercle de Sikasso.
Il mène cette activité de commercialisation stockage de céréales depuis plus de six  ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit  beaucoup de commandes de céréales, notamment du pois sucré. 
Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il  décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis cinq ans, il est à son sixième cycle maintenant et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des sacs du pois sucré, d’arachides et de maïs. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants IFOLA. Une fois acheminé à IFOLA, les produits sont stockés dans son magasin. Les produits seront revendus à Sikasso au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Pour acheter de céréales

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El Señor Lucio de 28 años de edad casado con la señora Sabina más de 4 años, ambos saben leer y escribir, con 2 hijas dependientes que están estudiando en nivel primaria, la familia vive en la comunidad de 2do Aguirre hacia el sud de Colomi.
Marido y mujer son personas trabajadores que se dedican a la actividad agrícola con ingreso económico dentro del año estacional por la venta de papa, oca y haba en vaina verde, cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 1 lechera más 1 ternero. El Señor Lucio solicita un préstamo para comprar techo (teja) para su construcción de vivienda que está en proceso de terminación la obra gruesa 2da planta. Don Lucio, una vez que haga terminar la construcción de su casa vivirán más cómodos y siempre así trabajara para poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lucio is twenty-eights years old and has been married to Sabina for more than four years.  Both know how to read and write, and they have two dependent daughters who are studying in primary school.  The family lives in the community called Segundo Aguirre, which is in the southern part of Colomi.  

Both man and wife are hard-working people who make a living in agriculture and with an economic income during the seasonal year coming from the sale of potatoes, oca and green beans.  They have one dairy cow and one calf.  

Lucio is requesting a loan to buy roofing tiles for the construction of his home; he is in the process of completing the hard work of adding a second level.  With the completion of the construction of his home, Lucio and his family will live more comfortably.   He will always work in order to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy tile for his home.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
My name si Nora and I sell blouses, shirts, socks and plastic containters. I store my merchandise in my house and I travel to neighbors and offices in the afternoon to sell. My profits help my support my family with food and education. It is the Christmas season and I need to provide inventory and increase my sales.

Loan Use: Purchase clothing for men and women, bedding and plastic articles

Me llamo Nora y me dedico a vender al por menor blusas, camisas, calcetines, recipientes de plasticos y otros de forma ambulante. Mi mercaderia la tengo en mi casa de habitacion y por las tardes salgo a vender a vecinos u oficinas donde me conocen. Los ingresos que tengo de mis ventas me ayudan a sostener a mi familia en alimentacion y estudios. Por temporada navideña necesito invertir para poder surtir mi inventario y mejorar mis ventas.

loans.use: Compra de ropa de caballero, dama, cobertores de cama y articulos plasticos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mukana would like to buy beadwork materials

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Ms Luisa is 50 years old, and she was born in the Estacion14 in the state of San Luis Potosi. She has resided for more than 40 years in Monterrey, to where her parents moved when she was a child. She has dedicated 5 years to making seasonal handicrafts for Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, Graduation, etc., and selling arrangements for special events. She started this business with the aim of helping her husband Rogelio, an albino, with a small additional income.

At this moment, she seeks a loan of 325 dollars to purchase the required material for the production of floral arrangements and to be able to have them with anticipation for upcoming Mother’s Day—when sales increase. She intends to pay back the loan within 4-8 months. Luisa and her family greatly appreciate your generosity and support toward the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luisa tiene 50 años de edad y nació en la localidad de Estación 14 en el estado de San Luis Potosí, tiene más de 40 años viviendo en Monterrey, ya que sus padres se mudaron desde que era niña. Tiene 5 años dedicándose a hacer manualidades en temporadas, como el 14 de febrero, día de las madres, fines de cursos escolares, vendiendo arreglos para eventos especiales. Comenzó a vender con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo Rogelio, que es albañil, con un pequeño ingreso adicional.

En estos momentos requiere de un crédito por $ 325 dólares para poder comprar el material que requiere para la elaboración de los arreglos florales y poder tenerlos con anticipación, porque se acerca el día de las madres, y es cuando las ventas de sus productos se incrementan, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Luisa y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu cariño y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Lath

texts.en:
Lath is married since 1992 and has one son and two daughters. He is in business of driving remork (motor taxi with a carriage at the back). He started this business 12 years ago. His wife works in a garment factory. His two children study in primary school in the village.  

He is requesting a loan of $500 from MAXIMA in order to purchase lattice and zinc to repair his house. With his remork he can generate enough income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Buying lattice and  zinc to repair the house.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Cesar is from San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon. Four years ago, he began his own business as a hairstylist. He began with very few clients, but he has used ads to spread the word and the results have been good. He has always liked this profession, and he has taken various courses in cosmetology and styling, which have helped him grow his business and offer excellent service.

To expand the offerings in his salon, he is asking for a $500 loan which he is committed to repaying in 6 months. He will use the loan to buy the materials he needs to continue offering great service to his clients. You can be an important part in the development of this business. Decide to join -- Cesar thanks you sincerely.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

César es originario de la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, desde hace 4 años inició su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista, inició con muy pocos clientes pero ha utilizado la publicidad para darse a conocer y ha obteniendo buenos resultados. A él siempre le ha gustado este oficio y es por eso que ha estudiado varios cursos de belleza y estilismo, lo que le ha permitido crecer mucho en su negocio, ofreciendo un excelente servicio.

Para incrementar los servicios que ofrece en su estética y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora César está solicitando un préstamo de $ 500 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses y empleará en la compra de materiales que necesita para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a apoyarlo, César te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy materials.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa is 53 years old and despite her advancing age she still counts on her energy and strength to continue doing business making delicious cheeses, which she produces in her small home. She transports her cheeses, along with other products (such as meats and vegetables) from her town, to the country's capital every two weeks and sells them in markets where many families go to shop and can enjoy her products. Her cheese business has enabled her to improve her childrens' quality of life, and now she's helping her grandchildren too, who have become her greatest joy and who live in her home. One of the ways she's looking to improve her situation is to sell more cheese and products and make enough money to expand the size of her house. She promises to continue to work hard in order to grow her business and improve their quality of life. With your help we pray that these loving grandparents can continue with their hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 53 años a pesar D. su avanza edad aún siguen contando con suficiente vitalidad y fuerza para seguir comercializando, los deliciosos quesos que preparan en su modesta casita.Estos quesos son ofertados quincenalmente en la ciudad capital D. su país, los cuales son llevados desD. su modesta localidad, conjuntamente con otros productos como carnes y verduras, para poder ofrecerlos en los mercados para deleite D. las familias limeñas. Con esta labor a lo largo del tiempo han podido otorgarle bienestar y alimento a cada uno D. sus hijos. Y ahora también se lo brindan a sus pequeños nietos, quienes se han convertido en su mayor alegría, ya que viven con ellos en la casa que se ha convertido en recinto D. una numerosa familia.Para seguir contribuyendo con su bienestar desean incrementar el capital D. su negocio y prometen trabajar arduamente con el fin D. generar mejores ingresos económicos para su familia. Con su contribución lograremos que estos abuelitos cariñosos sigan con las mismas ganas D. trabajar.

loans.use: Incremental capital to be used to grow her small business of making and selling cheese.

loans.name: Abdulahai

texts.ru:
Abdulahai A., 40, established his farm 20 years ago, when he inherited his cattle from his father. At that time, steep inflation made life very difficult: Abdulahai and his father would sell their cattle within a few months, but they would have to use the money to sustain themselves for entire year. Then, MicroInvest helped Abdulahai and his father to improve the situation. Today, in addition to having a farm, Abdulahai works as a construction worker in the city.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абидов Абдулахай 40 лет организовал своё хозяйство 20 лет назад, когда его отец только начинал и передал свой скот Абдулахаю. Большие проблемы создавала непомерно высокая инфляция. Они с отцом свой скот продавали в течение нескольких месяцев, а жить на эти деньги предстояло целый год. Для этого, им помог улучшить положение Микроинвест. В настоящий момент Абдулахай также работает строителем жилых домов в городе.

loans.use: To raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Luisa  Liliam

texts.es:
Luisa has dedicated herself to selling fruit for the past 13 years. Her parents taught her how to run a fruit stand. She began the business with a loan from her father.

In the hopes of bettering her children’s quality of life, she has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase her own work space, to increase her inventory, and to realize her dreams of improving all aspects of her life.

She believes that the financial assistance that she has received from CEPRODEL has been a determining factor in the development of her business. Currently she has a small space in the market with a plastic roof and no walls. She hopes that with CEPRODEL’s assistance her business will improve quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luisa se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas desde hace 13 años a quien sus padres enseñaron a administrarla. Inicia su negocio con un préstamo que le concede su señor padre.

Con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hijos decide solicitar prestamos para tener un local propio, incrementar su inventario en fin el de realizar sus sueños que son mejorar en todos los aspectos de su vida.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un pequeño piso en el mercado con techo de plástico no tiene paredes pero tiene la esperanza de que por medio de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL mejorará pronto.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
14 years ago in the city of Leon Mrs. Juana R. was working as a maid ironing, washing and making the tasks at different people's homes. Since this business did not generate enough income for her, she decided to invest $1000 Córdobas for the purchase of a sewing machine because she has great skills in this area

She started her business and did advertising in the area where she was located. People started to get to know her business little by little and realized that she had great skills in this field.
