Currently she has the necessity to invest in the maintenance of the sewing machine and the acquisition of materials like threads, scissors, coils, fabrics, etc. She has made credits in Ceprodel to continue maintaining her tailor business and to improve the standard of life for her and her family. She has received a total of 20 credits

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 14 años en la ciudad de León la dama Juana R. se dedicaba al trabajo de empleada domestica planchando, lavando y realizando los quehaceres del hogar en diferentes lugares. Por la necesidad de subsistir ya que este negocio no le generaba ganancias decide de manera personal invertir la cantidad de Un mil córdobas netos para la compra de una maquina de coser ya que desde muy pequeña ha tenido destrezas en este ramo.

Comienza su negocio y para acaparar clientes realiza publicidad en el sector donde ella vive sin embargo, por ser el inicio no contaba con clientes en su negocio. Poco a poco al darse cuenta las personas de la existencia de un taller de costura fueron llegando los clientes hasta que se fueron convenciendo de que la señora Juana R. presentaba destrezas en este campo. Hoy en día, ella tiene la necesidad de invertir en el mantenimiento de maquinas y adquisición de materiales como hilos, tijeras, bobinas, telas, etc. Par esto ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para seguir manteniendo su taller y a la vez mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y su familia. Anteriormente ha realizado un total de 20 créditos

loans.use: Compra de los materiales utilizados en la costura

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en: Mrs. Thuch S., 53, is a widow with four children and works selling grocery products, making on average around $1.50 per day of profit. One of her daughters is married and lives away from home, and the three others work in Siem Reap province as waiters, earning a salary of approximately $80 each per month. To earn more profit she needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina is the mother of 2 children. She widowed 6 years ago and after losing the protection and financial sustenance that her husband offered, she had to face her circumstances and look for employment to cover her children’s expenses. She faced the dilemma of having to work but not wanting to spend less time with her children, and that is how she started selling prepared meals from her home. Currently, her 22-year-old daughter helps her with the business.

Agustina requires a loan for US $350 that she can repay in 4 months. This will help her immensely being that she needs to purchase a tortilla-making machine to facilitate her work since she currently makes them by hand. With your contribution, Agustina will be able to increase her business’ productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Agustina es madre de familia de 2 hijos, hace 6 años enviudo y al quedarse sin la protección y sustento económico que le brindaba su esposo ella tuvo que enfrentarse con la situación de conseguir un empleo para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, se encontraba ante la disyuntiva de tener que trabajar pero no quería descuidar sus hijos y fue así que empezó a vender comidas en su casa. Actualmente su hija de 22 años la ayuda en el negocio.

Ella requiere un crédito por US $350 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 4 meses, este le ayudara mucho ya que requiere comprar una maquina para hacer tortillas y así facilitar su labor ya que actualmente las realiza manualmente. Con tu contribución Agustina podrá incrementar la productividad de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a tortilla-making machine to help her in the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is a young man who, from a very young age, supported his father in raising livestock and buying and selling red meat. Now that he has decided to join his father in pursuing his passion he hopes to turn the business into the most prosperous of its kind in his native Santa Rosa. This 25-year-old father buys lambs and alpacas on market days in his small village. He then feeds and fattens them before killing them to sell their fresh, nutritious meat. This business, which he runs along with his wife, allows him to improve his day-to-day quality of life and that of his beloved children. At this time, after evaluating the demand for his business, Fernando turns to your generous heart to help him increase his investment and, through his hard work and your support, improve his economic situation.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Fernando, es un muchacho que desde muy pequeño apoyó a su padre en su actividad de producción de ganado y compra y venta de carnes rojas. Ahora que ha decidido unirse a su gran amor anhela convertir su negocio en el más próspero de su tierra natal Santa Rosa.Este joven padre de 25 años de edad compra corderos y alpacas los días de feria en su pueblito, luego de alimentarlas y engordarlas debidamente procede a degollarlas para vender su fresca y nutritiva carne, este negocio en el que se desempeña junto a su esposa le permite mejorar día a día su condición de vida y la de sus queridos hijos.En estos momentos, evaluando la demanda que existe en su negocio recurre a tu generoso corazón para que le permitas aumentar el monto de su inversión y así con su esfuerzo y tu apoyo mejorar su situación económica.

loans.use: Increase wokring capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca started her business because her husband was unemployed at that time and she needed to obtain an income in order to pay the household expenses. She began selling cosmetics more than 2 years ago to family and neighbors. She has 2 sons; Osvaldo and Pedro, ages 17 and 12 years.

She requests a loan of $250 with will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca inició el negocio ya que su esposo en ese tiempo estaba desempleado y necesitaba obtener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de la casa.Comenzó hace mas de 2 años vendiendo cosmeticos con familiares y vecinos. Ella tiene 2 hijos Osvaldo y Pedro de 17 y 12 años.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: JamA. A. C. is 60 years old and lives in Beirut. She is married and has one child. JamA. makes a living selling clothes out of her home to friends and neighbors. She needs a loan for $1,000  to buy more products from wholesalers and to expand her business by diversifying the inventory of items she has for sale. JamA. has been a client of A. Majmoua for the past four years, and always repays her loans on time.

loans.use: To buy more products from wholesalers

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia is 42 years old and has 3 children. Her children are her motivation to go on and prosper in everything. She sells goods and consumables and staple goods. She is also the owner of a motocar, which is driven and administered by her husband, Wilson. In the future she wants to expand her store. For that reason, she wants to buy more merchandise and fix some of the structures for the expansion. That's why through this media she asks for your support for a loan which she will pay promptly on the alloted time.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Rogelia tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, los mismos que son su razón para seguir adelante y prosperar en todo. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, también es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que es manejado y administrado por su esposo Wilson. En el futuro quiere ver su bodega más grande, por ello, quiere comprar más mercadería y arreglar algunas estructuras para la ampliación. Es así, que por este medio, solicita su apoyo con un préstamo de dinero, el cual pagará puntualmente en el plazo indicado.

loans.use: To extend her pantry/grocery store and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos T. de 43 años de edad es casado con la señora Maria Barboza de 41 años de edad con seis hijos de las cuales dos de ellos ya son mayores y trabajan y 4 van al colegio publico de dicho barrio que esta ubicada a 5 minutos de la ciudad viven en casa propia con todas las comodidades necesaria.

El Señor Carlos Tronbetta de profesión herrero hace mas de 12 años trabajo mucho tiempo como empleado de una empresa muy conocida en Encarnación, pero como no quería depender mas de su salario decidió abrir para su propio taller, y actualmente es propietario de una herrería que funciona hace mas de 2 años y esta ubicado en su propio domicilio particular y cada día que pasa le gente le conoce mas por su calidad de trabajo que realiza y tiene mucho pedidos. Y su señora Maria Barboza es pasera hace mucho años y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y el estudio de los hijos.

El señor ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de hierro por que tiene pedido de un portón y rejas para la casa de un cliente y tiene que fabricar y el margen de ganancia que le va a dejar es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos T. is 43 years old and married to 41 year old Mrs.Maria Barboza. They have 6 children, 2 of whom are now grown and working and 4 go to the public high school in their neighborhood located 5 minutes from the city. They live in their own home with all the necessary comforts. Mr. Carlos T. has worked as a blacksmith for more than 12 years as an employee of a well-known business in Encarnación, but as he didn’t want to depend any longer on his salary he decided to open his own shop, and today he is owner of a forge that has been in business for more than 2 years, and the business is located in his home. Every day that passes he becomes better known for his quality of work that he does and he has many orders. His wife, Maria Barboza, has worked as a pasera (transporting goods across the border to buy and sell) for many years and helps her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children. Carols has asked for a loan to buy iron because he has an order for a gate and bars for a customer’s house and he has to make the items, the profit margin will be very good.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron

loans.name: Mrs. Nut Sarem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people in Pou Roung Village in Takeo Province are asking for a loan that they will each use differently. Mrs. Nut S. is a livestock breeder who raises two cows and two pigs. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. Mrs. Nut S. is a 46-year-old widow with three children. Two are employed in a garment factoR. and the other is attending the local school. All eleven are members of AMK, a local bank. AMK members have a reliable record on repaying loans. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has never defaulted on a KIVA loan.

loans.use: buying pigs

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Samoeurn H. is 41 years old and is married with two children. And Her husband, Mr. Chhoun Saoroeun, is 27 years old and works as a farmer, earning about $3 per day. She sells palm wine with food and can earn about $4 per day. They live in Svay At Commune, Pursat Province. For another source of income, Samoeurn needs a loan of $500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi. She will use the remainder of the loan to increase the amount of palm wine and food she sells. (Her husband is pictured becuase Samoeurn was not available)

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorcycle for her husband to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Maria R. me dedico a la venta de productos para uso personal, como ser cremas, lociones, perfumes, tratamientos para la cara, desodorantes etc. tengo 8 años de tener este negocio, soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos los cuales dependen totalmente de mi, soy una persona muy responsable y siempre estoy muy contenta por todo lo que Dios me ha dado, tengo muchos deseos de superarme, en estos momentos necesito el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia porque viene la epoca navideña y en estos dias las ventas son muy buenas. asi podre mejorar mi negocio y mi calidad de vida y mantener mi familia que es lo mas importante que tengo en mi vida.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Maria R.. I sell products for personal use, such as cremes, lotions, perfumes, facial treatments, deodorants, etc. I've been in this business for eight years. I am a single mother with two children who rely totally on me. I am a very responsible person and am always very happy with everything God has given me. I really want to get ahead in life. Currently I need a loan so I can purchase additional merchandise, seeing the Christmas season is coming and during this time sales are really good. In this way, I'll be able to improve my business and quality of life and support my family, which is the important thing in my life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos. Estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Sánchez Cerro Nº 125, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró galletas, gaseosas, gelatinas, etc., para su tiendita escolar. Antes  de comenzar con esta actividad económica se dedicaba a trabajar como Cosmetóloga en una Peluquería.

Actualmente continua vendiendo golosinas en un colegio secundario, en el cual atiende con mucha amabilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más mercadería como galletas, gaseosas, jugos, queques y otros.
 
Quisiera tener una tienda mayorista de venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Estela is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two sons. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school, and lives on Sánchez Cerro Street in the Puno province. She is one of the founding members of the “Diana de Gales” cooperative bank. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she increased her working capital and purchased cookies, sodas, jellos, etc. for her school store. Prior to starting with this activity, she worked as a cosmetologist at a beauty salon. Currently, she continues selling snacks at a secondary school and she tends carefully to her store. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will purchase merchandise such as cookies, sodas, juices, cakes, and other items. She would like to one day have a wholesale store for the sale of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cookies, sodas, juices, cakes, and other items.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Diakité est une femme mariée de 40 ans et mère de deux enfants qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari,ses enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la préfecture de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Très tôt elle commença les activités génératrices revenues notamment le commerce des articles de la  lingerie(tissus, draps de lits) de la parfumerie  et biens d’autres articles divers(en plastiques..) Avec une expérience de 10 ans Madame Assitan Diakité maîtrise son activité qu’elle a appris auprès  de sa tante jadis grande commreçante. 
Afin d’étoffer son  fonds de commerce elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième  prêt individuel. Le  prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elle veut  acheter avec ce prêt,  20 piéces de tissus, 35 draps de lit et  3 cartons de parfums de différentes sortes.
Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes du grand marché. Elle effectue ses ventes d’une façon ambulante dans les quartiers de la ville et de façon fixe au marché   de Bougouni. Madame Assitan a essentiellement comme clientèle les femmes à qui elle commerce au comptant, en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement ou hebdomadairement.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 F CFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Diakité, 40, is married and the mother of two children. They live in a polygamous family with her husband, his children, and her co-spouse in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood of the prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Very early on, she began to earn her living selling goods, notably linens (fabric, sheets), perfume, and diverse articles (made of plastic). With an experience of 10 years, Mrs.Assitan Diakité is well-versed in her business which she learned from her aunt, who used to be a very fine merchant.

So as to bolster her working capital, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her second individual loan. The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

With this loan, she would like to buy 20 lengths of cloth, 35 sheets, and 3 cases of various sorts of perfume. She does her buying in Burkina Faso and in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) from the wholesalers who sell in the big open-air market. She sells door-to-door in the neighborhoods of the town and out of a stall in the market of Bougouni. Mrs. Assitan's clientele consists essentially of women to whom she sells for cash, retail, and on credit payable weekly or monthly.

With the loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 55,000 F CFA which she plans to use to expand her business so as to become a wholesaler herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics, sheets, and perfumes for re-sale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo Y. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and typically makes $1 each day. Meanwhile, her husband, pictured here, runs a business as cow dealer, earning up to $2 a day. Mrs Keo Y. will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seed for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice for her rice farm

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inició el negocio por deseos de superarse y salir adelante con su hijo ya que no recibo ningún apoyo económico del papa por lo que tuvo que buscar la forma de percibir un ingreso ya que quiere brindarle una mejor forma de vida a mi hijo.
Comenzó el negocio  en Marzo de 2007, el negocio es una tradición familiar, primero comenzo ayudándole a su mamá  en su puesto. Como se dío cuenta que le iba muy bien, platico con ella para que le ayudara a independizarse y poner su propio negocio. Inicio con una pequeña inversión y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien ha  progresado porque ya tiene un mejor surtido que cuando comenzò además de que incluio la venta de alimentos enlatados y verdura básica para la preparación del marisco.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas,  con este crédito va a comprar mercancía para tener un buen surtido ya que se acerca una buena época en donde se vende mucho el marisco y por consecuencia también sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria started a business out of a desire to better herself and get ahead in life with her child since she does not receive any economic support from the father. She had to search for a source of income since she wanted to provide a better life for her child. She began the business in March 2007, which is part of a family tradition. She first started by helping her mother at her stand. When she realized that she was doing well, she spoke with her mother about helping her to become independent and begin her own business. She started with a small investment and thanks to God, the business has been progressing very well. She is already better stocked than when she started and has included canned food and basic vegetables for the preparation of shellfish. She needs a loan of $12,000 MXN that she will repay in 12 installments. With this credit, she is going to purchase merchandise to be well-stocked since a good time of year is approaching when a lot of shellfish is sold and consequently she sells a lot of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Wendelina

texts.en:
Wendelina T. is a resident of Zone 1, Kabakungan Claveria Misamis Oriental (Southern Philippines). She is married to Eduardo T. and is blessed with 9 children, of which 4 are married and 5 are her dependents.

Her husband is a farmer, so to be able to sustain and pay for their daily expenses she has to help through her fish vending business. Her primary customers are her neighbors and people from nearby villages. She plans to venture into another business like food vending in the near future, as she likes to cook food. For her second loan cycle, she wants to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000.00 for additional fish vending capital.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: A. Khursheda first applied to MicroInvest in 2005 and thanks to the previous loans, she could normalize the existing business in terms of market competition. Khursheda is engaged in commercial service and trade. She has a trade outlet in the local crowded bazaar where she trades towels that she brings from China and Iran. Khursheda has been in the towel trading business for five years. Khursheda has her last loan repayment in April and she is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of 4100 STJ for two months to import new wares.

loans.use: To import new wares

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana Francisca H., vive en Cojutepeque ubicado en el Oriente del país, ella vive junto a su esposo y  tres hijos, Ana en búsqueda de una superación personal y económica aprendió cosmetología, mismo oficio que hoy la hace dueña de su propio salón de belleza, Ana no solo ofrece sus servicios de corte de cabello  y tintes, también ofrece productos a sus clientes como shampoo, cremas para cabello entre otros, Ana aprovecha sus conocimientos en el oficio y le recomienda a sus clientes sus mejores productos, ahora Ana solicita un crédito por que quiere surtir mas su negocio con variedad de marcas y productos.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca H. lives in Cojutepeque, located in the eastern part of the country. She lives with her husband and 3 children. In her quest to better herself and her economic situation, Ana learned cosmetology, which has allowed her to own her own beauty salon today. She not only offers services of haircut and hair coloring, but she also offers products like shampoo, hair lotions, and others to her clients, as well as useing her knowledge to recommend better products to them. Ana now needs a loan to supply her store with a wider variety of products and brands.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos para su negocio

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hải Thị Hoàng was born in 1969, and today makes a living selling fruit in a local market. Her husband is an assístant worker in a construction business. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She has a small monthly income, and is applying for a $250 loan to buy more fruit to sell.  We see her to the right in this photo.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana A. is forty-four years of age. She is married and has given birth to five children, one daughter and four sons. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Asana is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells in the community market. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and also treks to other towns to sell. Asana has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin so she can help her husband provide for their family.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa, y vive en la Villa San Borja.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 8 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de ropa. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio, con la compra de ropa por docenas, la misma que será  vendida en el mercado de Yunguyo y en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse un carro.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Señor de Los Milagros ("Our Father of Miracles") Village Bank, located in the community of Imicati, Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old and is the single mother of three children. She completed her high school education, and currently lives in Villa San Borja. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost eight years. She used her very first loan of 300 soles to increase working capital for her business buying and selling clothes. She is now requesting a loan of 1,300 soles to invest in her business by buying clothing by the dozen. She will sell these clothes at the Yunguyo market and at local markets. Her greatest dream in life is to buy a car. Her favorite parts of village bank membership are her savings account and the group meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing by the dozen

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.en:
Rosa Luz is a member of the Virgen del Carmen Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Patria. She is 39 and  the single mother of three children, who range in age from 9 to 22. Her oldest child works and is almost entirely independent. 

Rosa Luz has a small neighborhood grocery store in Patria. She has had the store for many years, and works there seven days a week, from 5 am to 9 or 10 pm, depending on the day. 

Rosa Luz is requesting 2000 soles to restock her store. She doesn’t know exactly what she will buy yet, but says that she’s always missing something. She travels to the city of Cusco two to four times per month to buy merchandise she needs for her store. 

Rosa Luz’s goal for the future is to expand and improve her store and to build a house for her family on a plot of land she owns in Patria. She’s also thinking about opening a bar in her home once it is finished.

loans.use: GROCERIES

loans.name: Serozha

texts.en:
Serozha is married with three children. He owns a shoe business where he repairs and makes shoes. He began his business just repairing shoes. Later he began to take orders to make individual shoes as well. Making shoes has become quite a profitable part of his business.

Serozha has been in this business for seventeen years and his monthly net profit is 4,000 UAH. He is a hardworking and responsible person and has a good reputation among his clients. He has many repeat clients that use his services. 

Serozha would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Sonia Chanela

texts.es:
La señora Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Siglo XXI”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (Técnico en enfermería), vive en Barrio Santa Cruz.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó como capital para su negocio de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de bayetas (telas) y lanas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de sus bordados, los cuales los vende a los turistas en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes  y ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “Mujeres del Siglo XXI” (Women of the 21st Century) Community Bank in the district of Juli, province of Chucuito, department of Puno, Peru. She is 28 years old, has a common-law husband, and is a mother of two children. She has a nursing degree and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Cruz. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past four years and started out with a loan of 300 soles, which she used for her crafts business. Currently she is requesting a loan of 500 soles (approximately $175), which she plans to use to purchase cloths and wools of different colors to make her embroideries that she sells to tourists at the regional markets. Her dream is to set up a grocery store and to practice her profession. Sonia enjoys the savings and meetings she gets as part of her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloths and acrylic wools

loans.name: Jasurbek

texts.en: T. Jasurbek is 21 years old. For more than two years he has been engaged in the business of selling coal. Jasurbek buys coal from Kyrgyzstan and resells it to his customers in the market. As a result of his experience in the field, his numerous clients have a lot of trust and confidence in him and the quality of his product. Jasurbek enjoys his business very much. However, he does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially with recent price hikes; therefore, he needs the loan to remain in business and to expand it. With this loan, he wants to purchase a new stock of coal to better serve his customers. He believes the loan will enable him to save more and in the nearest future to have his own family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Cristal Group

texts.es:
“Cristal” es el nombre de la asociación formada por doce socias, pertenece al Centro Focal Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, con mucha dedicación ya tienen una antigüedad de cinco años junto a la organización, Actualmente, diversos son los negocios que tienen este grupo, desde la venta de abarrotes,  comercializando ropa y también se dedican a la venta de lubricantes y refacción de llantas para automóviles.
Toda la asociación precisa incrementar su capital para poder comprar mayor  mercadería, solo de ésta forma podrán obtener la rentabilidad de sus negocios y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
“Cristal” (Crystal) is the name of the association formed by 12 members, who belong to the Centro Focal Exaltación in the city of El Alto. They have already been working together in the organization for five years, with a lot of dedication. Currently, the group has different businesses, from the sale of groceries, selling clothes, and also the sale of lubricants and spare tires for cars.

The entire association needs to increase its capital in order to buy more merchandise. Only in this way can they earn the profitibility of their businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Guinabot. She is 50 years old. Elsie is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a Food business in the retail sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the  local community members. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for Food business

loans.name: Muthoni

texts.en:
Muthoni W. is 51 years old and happily married with three children, two boys and one girl. All are adults and the last born, Edward, is in his third year at the University. 

She has been in the housing business for fifteen years and her area of specialization is rental housing. She buys plots of land and constructs rental units on them. She says she enjoys this work. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client but in another group. She has applied for her first loan from KADET, and she intends to use the money to drill a well for her tenants at a cost of kshs. 60,000, and the rest will be used to paint the rental rooms.

Her dream is to own first class apartments in the coastal city of Mombasa.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Drill a well for her tenants (for running water) and to paint the rental rooms.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
27-year-old Caren B. has three children with her husband Antonio. Her eldest child is only 10 years old.

Caren invested in seaweed farming. She also hopes to have her own pump boat someday. Caren is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., an MFI in the Philippines and a Kiva partner. She has requested a loan of Php20,000, which she will use to fund her business.

loans.use: Seaweed farming

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive D. V. is a hog raiser in the Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to sustain the needs of her hogs, which include feed and medicine. She hopes to expand her business through purchasing more hogs in the future. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to grow her business.

Olive is married and has five children, most of whom are studying. She is glad that they own a farm which is being managed by her husband. It helps them a lot in providing the daily needs of her children and also sustains their educational needs. She hopes that KIVA lenders will give her a chance to further improve her business and earn more income from it someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for her piggery

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en:
Julieth is a strong, single business woman who resides within the Nairobi Area.

Julieth was introduced to KADET through existing members and is servicing her first loan which she will use to add more clothes for sale. She has been in the clothing business for two years. Her area of operation is within a residential area and she has many customers. With the extra profits she anticipates on getting, Julieth will open a stall in an identified market area.

Julieth hopes are to have a variety of clothes to sell and she believes she is hardworking.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To add stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min S. is 37 years old and lives with three of her children and her husband in Phnom Penh. Since 2007, she has been selling wine to earn a living and is able to make about US $1.00 of profit every day. Her husband is a mechanic who fixes motorbikes. On average, he is able to make around US $10.00 in revenue each day. Min S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 to buy her tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's motorbike repair business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a focused, hardworking woman and is dedicated to her business. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Gladys is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Gladys sells foodstuffs in market and she has been in this business for over twelve years and in LAPO micro-finance for over two years. She is soliciting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Twekambe Naburime Byabasaija Group

texts.en: N. Byabasaija is the representative for her group. She is forty years old and married, with six children all in schooling. She also has two dependents in schooling too. She is carrying out a motorcycle transportation business. She has experienced two years in this type of business. She is using this loan to top up for the purchase of another motorcycle for her transport business. This will raise her income and her standard of living. She is an innovative businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To top up for the purchase of another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudio hasta sexto de primaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanías como llijllas.

Sofía nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar sus ventas y capacitarse mejor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las capacitaciones que da la promotora.
texts.en:
Sofia, 53, has been a member of the "San Juan de Dios" communal bank for three years; it is in the Lampa district and province, Puno department. She is married and has three children. She finished 6th grade and she is a crafts merchant, especially llijllas (a type of poncho). Sofia tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will ask for a 500 new sol loan to buy wool, flannel, etc. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales and to become better trained. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members and the training sessions they get from their advisor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, flannel, etc.

loans.name: Saliyu

texts.en:
Saliyu is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She designs both Nigerian and Western designs for her customers who are usually friends and residents. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Saliyu is 40 years old. She is happily married with three children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Kanyanya and sells dried fish from a rented stall in Mulago Market. With the Ush 500,000 loan, she hopes to purchase more dried fish from Lake Victoria to sell. She also sells cold drinks as she has a fridge in the market. She has been in this business for 13 years. Her greatest challenge is that the police confiscate her fish if it is too small to prevent illegal fishing. She owns a house with two rooms, which she shares with three people. They have electricity but no piped water. She takes care of two of her sisters. Her greatest expenses are school fees and food. She works seven days per week. Margaret hopes to build her own house someday.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish

loans.name: Bakuseka Maggya Group Of  Kampala

texts.en:
37-year-old, N. Hadijah has been selling produce for the last twenty years in Owino market in Kampala. With her kind of business, good customer care skills are vital. With these in tow, she has been able to establish herself a strong niche in her operating area.

Hadijah reveals that, in a month, she makes profits amounting to 100,000 shillings, and it’s with this that she has been able to educate her six children.

Hadijah has faced problems in her business such as the high costs involved in transporting produce to her workplace. On the basis of this, she wants to be empowered by this loan to be able to expand into a wholesale business. A wholesale produce business, she says, involves less transportation costs as, for the most part, farmers bring in deliveries fewer times in a given period.

With the loan, Hadijah  plans the construction of a much bigger food stall for herself and she also wants to foot the costs of increased fruits and vegetable supplies to her workplace.

loans.use: To construct a much bigger food stall and to pay for increased fruits and vegetable supplies

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe H. y su esposa la señora Martha Rangel son padres de familia.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar los gastos médicos que  necesita su hijo ya que sufrió un accidente, lo atropello un carro y la persona no se quiere hacer responsable. 
Y necesitan hacerle varios estudios y operaciones, ellos no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder realizar los estudios médicos que necesita su hijo. Solo desean que su hijo ya este bien de salud. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de reparación de llantas, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como auxiliar cantable.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Guadalupe H. and his wife, Sr. Martha Rangel, are parents. They are applying for a loan to pay for medical care for their son who was injured when he was struck by a car. The person responsible for the accident has refused to accept responsibility and the couple have to pay for various tests and operations. They don't have the money they need to pay for the medical tests that their son needs. Their only desire is that their son recover. Sr. Jose plans to repay the loan with earnings from his tire repair business since his wife will cover their household expenses with the income she receives as a part-time bookkeeper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Son's medical expenses

loans.name: Haron Kipkulei

texts.en:
Haron Kipkulei T. is 57 years old and married to Selly Sortich who is 37 years old. They live in Kaptimbor and have seven children.

Haron is a shoemaker and has been in this business for twelve years. His shoemaking shop is in Kabarnet, where local and nearby residents are his clients. The venture generates a monthly profit of Kshs 3,000 and from other sources he gets Kshs 1,000 monthly.

Haron has borrowed Kshs 5,000 from KADET. From this loan, Kshs 2,000 will be used to purchase shoe soles, Kshs 1,000 to purchase insoles, and Kshs 2,000 to purchase nails, thread and glue.

Haron previously borrowed from K.I.E (Kenya Industrial Estates). Existing clients introduced him to KADET.

If this loan boosts his business, Haron will use the extra profit to plant maize and beans and venture into dairy farming. His hope and dream is to be a dairy farmer. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase shoe soles and others materials for mending and making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ajoa

texts.en:
Ajoa E. fries doughnuts for her customers who buy them and move around to sell them in Takoradi. She has not received any form of education and she is a widow taking care of four children. She is responsible for the general welfare of her family.

Ajoa’s loan is going to serve as additional capital which she is going to use to buy bags of flour and other ingredients to prepare her doughnuts for her demanding customers. She plans to use the new income from her business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients for preparing her doughnuts

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 47 años de edad, comparte su vida en compañía de sus hijos Wilson de 23 años y Carmen de 20 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedicó desde muy joven al trabajo de la confección de prendas de vestir, en un principio en talleres donde le pegaban un sueldo fijo, ganando gran experiencia en esta labor, para posteriormente poner su propio taller en su casa donde hasta la actualidad se dedica a esta labor y con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos. Ella confecciona a pedido, pantalones Jean y de otros materiales, así mismo elabora blusas, hoy solo confecciona prendas en material polar por la temporada de invierno, en donde son enviados al interior del  país. Por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene pendiente, muchas veces su hija Carmen la ayuda en la elaboración de dichas prendas, ya que Teresa le enseñó a su hija esta labor, pero lo que más desea es que su hija estudie una profesión. En un futuro desea ampliar su taller, comprando máquinas y contratando personal, de esa manera consolidarse como una microempresaria. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará material para terminar de cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old, and she shares her life in the company of her two children, Wilson, 23 years old, and Carmen, 20 years old. They live together in their own home. Since she was very young, Teresa has worked as a clothing-maker. At first she worked in workshops where she received a fixed salary. This work gave her excellent experience in this field, eventually enabling her to start her own clothes-making workshop in her home, where she continues to work today. Working from home enabled her to make dresses while also watching over her children. Teresa makes her clothing to order, making things like jeans and pants from other materials, as well as blouses. Lately she is only making clothes in warm fleece fabric on account of the cold winter weather. These clothes are often sent to the interior of the country. Depending on the amount of clothing orders she has waiting to be completed, her daughter Carmen will occasionally help her to make the clothes; although Teresa has passed her clothes-making knowledge on to her daughter, what Teresa wants most is for her to go to school to learn a profession. In the future Teresa hopes to expand her workshop, purchasing machines and hiring staff, and herself assuming the role of a businesswoman running her own small company. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she has always shown herself to be very responsible with her payments. With the loan that she requests, she will purchase material to complete the clothing orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar material para continuar confeccionando prendas que tiene pendiente.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie M. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a business providing motor transport services to local community members. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Vergie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Pacajes Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “PACAJES” está conformada por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varón, este es su ciclo Nº2. La asociación es parte del centro focal de Cascada, la presidenta es la señora Lizarda Ramirez.  

La señora Lizarda, socia de 37 años de edad, es madre de cuatro niños, actualmente tiene como negocio la elaboración de bordados para la policía, de acuerdo a pedido. 

Ingresó a Pro Mujer por invitación de una amiga.   El crédito le servirá para aumentar el capital de trabajo. Compra los insumos de una tienda en la “Ceja” que se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto.

Conversando con la presidenta comenta que lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer son los servicios de salud y capacitación.

En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio, como ser, punto de servicio de teléfono público, venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, Taxista, Venta de comida y artesanía, servicio de Internet y fotocopiadora, venta en kiosco refresco – chicles – punto de servicio de teléfono público.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Pacajes” consists of eight individuals, seven women and one man. They are in their second loan cycle. This group is part of the Cascada Community Center. The group president is Sra. Lizarda Ramirez.

Sra. Lizarda is 37 years old and the mother of four children. She currently has a business making embroideries for the police upon request. Lizarda joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend. The loans have allowed her to increase her operating capital. She buys her supplies from a shop located on the outskirts of the city of El Alto.

Speaking in her role as President, Lizarda says what she likes most about Pro Mujer are the health services and the training classes.

The members of this Communal Association engage in different service and retail businesses offering public phone services, meat, clothing, fruit, taxi services, food, handicrafts, Internet service, photocopying services, soft drinks, and chewing gum.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics in different colors

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Horm S. is 70 years old and sells Khmer noodles by moving through residential areas, earning about $1.80 each day. She is married to Phum Phan, a bricklayer who moves from construction site to construction site and earns about $2.50 each day. Together they have six children, only one of whom is married. The other five children contribute to the family's income by working as restaurant waiters, souvenir salespeople and peddlers of used goods. To increase her family's income, Horm S. plans to invest in a new business by building a small store next to her house where she can sell food. As she does not have capital, Horm S. decided to request a Kiva loan to make this action possible.

loans.use: To build a small store next to her house to sell food

loans.name: Aldo Gustavo

texts.es:
Aldo Duré de 23 años de edad, trabaja y estudia, el mismo vive en casa de su madre en  Capiata -ruta II km 18 del barrio Santo Rey.
Este joven se vio obligado a abandonar sus estudios regulares hace aproximadamente 3 años ya que no podía su madre sustentar sus estudiosy debía por tanto el generar ingresos adicionales para continuar sus estudios.
Aldo comenzó a trabajar dejando el colegio, actualmente se halla cursando clases aceleradas en el Colegio San Nicolás, como además de pagarse sus estudios debe ayudar en la casa se halla atrasado en el pago a sus cuotas motivo por el cual no está pudiendo dar exámenes y solicita asistencia crediticia para regularizar su situación y poder rendir.
texts.en:
Aldo Duré is 23 and he works and is in school. He lives in his mother’s home in Capiata-route II, kilometer 18, in the Santo Rey neighborhood. 3 years ago this young man had to abandon his regular schooling since his mother could no longer support him and he needed to generate additional income to continue his studies. Aldo began to work and he left his studies but currently he is taking accelerated classes in the San Nicolás school. Besides paying for his classes he must help with expenses at home and he is now behind with his payments and he can’t take the exams. He is requesting a loan to straighten out the situation and to be able to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make monthly payments

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en: Zinabu A. buys fresh fish and fries it for sale in Elmina. Zinabu has no formal education. She is divorced and lives with her four children. She responsibly makes sure that the children are well taken care of. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enter into another kind of business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S. is from the town of Aurora. She is 36 years old. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Letecia works hard to provide for her family and pay for her obligations.

Letecia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Lee Suzette

texts.en:
Lee Suzette Y. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old and married with two infant children. To make a living, Lee Suzette owns and operates a retail business running a sari-sari (variety) shop. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Lee Suzette has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Lee Suzette joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lee Suzette is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lee Suzette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Katia Elena

texts.en:
Katia is a member of the Communal Bank "The Little Stars of Gold II", located in the district of Puno, province and department of the same name. She is 18 years old, single, and has no children. She completed her secondary school education. 

She has dedicated her attention to telephone booths. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. The first loan she got was for 500 PEN, money that was invested in her call center business. 

She is now asking for a loan of 700 PEN, money that will allow her to expand her call center business. Her dream is to continue with the same business but to expand it. 

Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the money she earns on her savings.

loans.use: Expand her phone call center

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a rental shop.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Mariam hopes to own a retail shop.    

Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself and have good hygiene.

loans.use: a rental shop

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa R. es una señora de 46 años  y  tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos aun en edad escolar. Ninfa esta casada y su marido quien se dedica a trabajar en un taxi de su propiedad, con lo que se complementa la economía de la familia.

La Sra. posee una despensa desde hace unos diez años. Así también, paralelamente a las ventas realizadas en la despensa pone a disposición de sus clientes comidas rápidas, ensaladas de fruta, actividades con las que complementa su despensa. 

El crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya piensa invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías, de manera a tener un stock de productos mas variados como carne, verduras, bebidas, etc. El futuro proyecto de Ninfa es incluir venta de helados a su despensa. 

Ninfa Agradece el crédito obtenido, pues le permite crecer en su emprendimiento y acercarse de manera mas rápida a los objetivos que se propone.
texts.en:
Ninfa R. is 46 years old and has 3 children, one of them still of school age. Ninfa is married, and her husband works as a taxi driver using his own vehicle, which contributes to the family's economic support. 

Ninfa has run a small store for the past ten years. At the same time, besides the sales she makes in her store, she also offers her customers fast foods and fruit salads. She does this work in addition to her work in the store. 
 
She has invested the loan she obtained from the Paraguaya Foundation in buying merchandise, so that she can have a more varied inventory of products, such as meat, vegetables, beverages, etc. Ninfa's plan for the future is to add ice cream sales to her store. 

Ninfa appreciates the loan she has received, because it is allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and reach her goals more quickly.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her store, such as noodles, rice, sugar, vegetables, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna C. (in the photo) is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Try Porm is 45 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1995 and have five children--three sons and two daughters. Try climbs palm trees to collect palm juice. Vanna is a weaver and produces palm sugar. She is asking for a loan of $200 to use for producing palm sugar. 

She will use the loan to purchase new materials: a bamboo container for sugar palm juice and a frying pan in which palm juice is boiled.

loans.use: To produce palm sugar

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou V. is from the village of Santa Isabel Sur. She is 40 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Marilou joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Transito

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal Caritas Alegres, vive en la comunidad de Tutupali Chico que se encuentra en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura.

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 10 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados e independientes, sus hijos solteros son de 18, 17, 14 gemelas, 12, 10 y 7 años de edad, su cuarto y quinto hijo trabajan para sus gastos, sus hijas gemelas y su hija de 12 años pasan en la casa, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo ha sufrido un accidente en el trabajo por lo que por el momento se encuentra en casa, tiene una casita que es pequeña de adobe.

Doña María se dedica al negocio de granos, frutas y verduras, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años, tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el negocio. Su meta es  tener animales para la cría y también arreglar su casa.
texts.en: Señora María P. is a member of the communal bank, Caritas Alegres ("Happy Faces").  She lives in the Tutupali Chico community, which is located outside of the city of Cuenca.  This area is characterized for its natural beauty and the people there work in agriculture.  Señora María is 48 years old, married, and has 10 children.  3 of them are married and independent.  Her other single children are ages 18, 17, 14 year-old twins, 12, 10, and 7.  Her fourth and fifth child work to contribute towards their household costs.  Her twin girls and her 12 year-old daughter spend time at home.  Her two youngest children study at a school in the city.  Her husband suffered an accident at his work which means that he is currently at home., in their tiny adobe house.  Señora María works in the grains, fruit, and vegetable business.  She has been working in this sector for the past 15 years.  She has her own stall at a market in the city and works every day of the week.  This is her third credit with the communal bank and enjoys it because she has made many good friends.  She plans to invest the money from this credit in her business.  Her goal is to own and raise livestock and also to fix her house.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, and grains.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda I. is from the town of Banga. She is 56 years old. To make a living, Nilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nilda is working hard because she is planning to build a new house for her family. 

Nilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Tp purchase seeds, fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es:
Patricia es una comerciante de Hot Dog y papas fritas, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad, reside con su familia en Berlín departamento de Usulután, el negocio lo inicio hace 5 años, lo tiene ubicado frente al parque de la ciudad, su horario de venta es de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos alimenticios para preparar la venta, ya que en ocasiones la demanda es fuerte y debe estar preparada con suficientes productos como papas, Jamón, repollo, aderezos, entre otros. Al mantener todos estos ingredientes ella estará lista para atender la cantidad de clientes que sea necesario, y aprovechar a vender mayor cantidad.
Las aspiraciones de Patricia son: tener un negocio competente, brindar un buen servicio a los clientes, con su familia pues estar al pendiente de sus hijos y las necesidades de estos.
texts.en:
Patricia sells hot dogs and French fries. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their 7 and 12 years old children. They live in Berlin, Department of Usulutan. She started her business five years ago and it is located in front of the city park. Her schedule is from 6:00am to 5:00pm.

She requests a loan to buy ingredients for her business because at times the demand is high and  wants to be prepared. She would like to buy enough ingredients like potatoes, ham, cabbage and spices among others. Having enough ingredients would allow her to serve all costumers.

Patricia’s aspirations are to have a competitive business, provide good service to her costumers and attend to her children and their needs.

loans.use: To buy ingredients: potatoes, ham, cabbage, spices

loans.name: Banco Amigas Group

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del Banco comunal “Banco Amigas” conformado por 22 emprendedoras, que se desempeñan en los rubros de amasandería, artesanía, podología, ventas de ropa usada y cosméticos por catalogo, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Ana, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, al medio, viste de polera estampada con el cuello de la polera de color negro, además usa anteojos y tiene el cabello tomado. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosmetología por catalogo desde hace 8 años. Además  prepara empanadas, pan amasado y pie de limón, los cuales vende puerta a puerta. 
Ana es jefa de hogar y tiene a su cuidado a tres sobrinos, ya que lamentablemente su hermana falleció el año pasado. Es por esto su motivación de seguir en el rubro del comercio de cosméticos y haciendo masas, ya que con éste aumenta sus ingresos.
Con éste préstamo comprará un local con 2 socias más y arreglará su bicicleta, ya que es su medio de transporte para trasladar sus productos.
El sueño de ana es que sus sobrinos tengan una vida grata y confortable. Dos de ellos estudian en la Universidad y su otra sobrina estudia aún en la enseñanza media. Respecto a su negocio le gustaría tener un local a futuro de su propiedad. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, ya que con las socias comparten juntas, se han conocido y han generado lazos de amistad.
En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con este ha podido invertir más y aumentar sus ingresos. Además le han enseñado a distribuir sus ganancias.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the "Banco Amigas" communal bank which is comprised of 22 entrepreneurs who work in lace-making, crafts, podology, used clothing sales, and catalogue cosmetics sales.  They all live in the city of Chillán.

In the photo Ana is shown in the last row, toward the middle, wearing a printed top with a black collar.  She wears glasses and has her hair pulled back.  For eight years she has been selling beauty products and cosmetics by catalogue.  She also makes meat pies, bread, and lemon pie which she sells door-to-door.  Ana is the head of household in her home and she takes care of her niece and nephews since she lost her sister tragically last year.  This is why she wants to keep up with her cosmetics and baked goods businesses in order to increase her income.  She plans to use the loan to buy a place for shop with two partners and also fix her bicycle which she uses to transport her merchandise.

Ana's dream is to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her niece and nephews. The boys are in college and the niece is still in middleschool.  She would like to have her own store in the future.

She is grateful to the Esperanza Fund and enjoys participating in the meetings with the other members with whom she now has a good friendship.  The financial support received from the Esperanza Fund has been very helpful for her business since she has been able to invest more and increase her income.  She also has learned how to distribute her earnings.

Chillán is a municipality in the central part of southern Chile.  It's name means "seat of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of the mapuche indians.  Chillán is known as the "Country Birthplace" or "Land of Artists" because many historical Chilean figures were born in this city, such as Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To buy a store and for personal use

loans.name: Kutesa United Group-Mukono

texts.en: Fifty-year-old S. Ahamada has been operating a business farming and selling coffee for the past decade in Buyiri-Katete in Mukono. The happily married father of four says he was inspired by one of his closest friends to try a hand at this business, which can be lucrative if one works at it with determination. Coffee is a high value cash crop in Uganda, despite the seasonal changing prices. Ahamada experiences both great and poor sales seasons. He is also a qualified teacher who still finds time to teach. His business generates 75,000 UGX as weekly profits. Ahamada is requesting this loan to purchase more bags of coffee to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coffee to resell

loans.name: Chandra Shova

texts.en:
Chandra Shova B. is thirty years old, married and has two children aged nine and two. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy material for her business.

Chandra Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material or sewing machines which will increase production and profitability.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Baatar is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional housing tent, in someone's backyard. His two older children attend the local secondary school, while his wife stays home taking care of their infant.

He manages a meat trading business between Baruun-Urt sum and Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2009, partnering with his brother. In 2010, he began conducting his business by himself, and is planning to expand his business in the future. He is an experienced businessman who says, "I want to buy a plot of land in order to build a house for my family." 

Baatar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more sheep and goats in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and goats

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Isata S.. She is married, and has six children aged four, six, nine, 12, 15, and 18 years. In 2009, Isata established her restaurant business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to help her buy some drinks and foodstuffs for her restaurant. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL. In the future, Isata plans to educate her children and help her husband buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Nswanjere Farmers United Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Faridah N. has been operating her pharmacy business for the past 4 years in Mpigi Town. On the face of it, this happily married mother of 3 seems a courteous and down-to-earth person. From the accounts of many of her clients, Faridah is indeed a kind and approachable person. This has at length significantly impacted her business, principally from the angle of striking a chord with many clients. Over time, Faridah has established her own niche in the market. Subsequently, her pharmacy sales revenue has been increasing. 

Faridah is a trained nurse and before she ventured into the pharmacy business, she was operating a retail shop and a restaurant. Faridah also does some small-scale farming. Weekly, she says her gross business profits are about 80,000 shillings. She says with this loan, she is going to purchase more medicine to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more medicine to resell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells cassava, plantain and sacks of maize at Elmina. She has two children. She has been in this trade for 8 years now. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy sacks of maize to distribute to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a store room for the maize.
Efua is squatting near some sacks of maize.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Manuel Agustin
