texts.es: Manuel   vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 7 a 14 años  en Malambo, municipio ubicado en el área metropolitana de Barranquilla; allí  tiene el negocio de ofrecer lavadoras en condiciones de alquiler y también vende fritos diariamente. Su experiencia  data  desde cuando vivía en Ciénaga un municipio del departamento del Magdalena, donde tenía el servicio de lavadoras  y estaba administrado por su esposa,  pues él trabajaba en una empresa. Cuando trasladó la experiencia de servicios de lavandería a Malambo, observó el entorno e inició otro negocio: el de vender jugos fritos y pasteles aprovechando las habilidades culinarias de su cónyuge y su ubicación estratégica frente al lugar donde finaliza el recorrido de los buses municipales.  Con los dos negocios le ha ido muy bien,  porque ha logrado comprar más máquinas  de lavar y electrodomésticos,  perfeccionando su infraestructura. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital de trabajo con que cuenta y esta es la razón por la cual acude al credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 1 lavadora, un calentador 1 licuadora y 1 bicicleta para el transporte de sus máquinas. Su sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia e incriminar sus posibilidades en el mercado,  ofreciendo servicios cada vez más oportunos, mientras esto ocurre continúa esforzándose por mantener su rentabilidad no menor de 56%, para lograr permanentemente ser efectivo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his spouse and their four children, ranging in age from 7 to 14.  They live in Malambo, a municipality in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla.  He has a business there offering washing machines for rent.  He also sells fried food daily.

His experience dates back to when he lived in Ciénaga, a municipality in the Magdalena department.  He had a washing machine service there, and his wife ran the business because he worked in a company.  When he moved the experience of washing machine service to Malambo, he observed the surroundings and started another business.  He started selling fried food, juice, and cakes by taking advantage of his wife’s culinary abilities and his strategic location.  The location is in front of the place where the municipal bus routes end.  

Both businesses have gone very well for him .  This is because he has managed to buy more washing machines and domestic appliances, which improved his infrastructure.  His greatest challenge is having little working capital.  That is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, which is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy one washing machine, a heater, one blender, and a bicycle to transport his machines.

His dream is to get his own house and to increase his possibilities in the market by offering timely services, more each time.  While this is happening he will continue putting forth his effort to keep his profitability at no less that 56% in order to always be effective in the market.

loans.use: to buy one washing machine, a heater, one blender, and a bicycle to transport his machines.

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Олим женатый мужчина. Ему 52 года. Он проживает в Яванском районе. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Олим создал все условия для расширения своей деятельности. Он берет кредит для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Olim is a married man.  He is 52 years old.  He lives in Yavan.  He has five children.  His wife is a housewife.  He makes a living breeding cattle.  He breeds cattle at home.  Olim has done everything possible to expand his business.  He is taking out a loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
This is Nimfa, 49, a resident of Tanza,Cavite City, Philippines. Being single, she manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nimfa operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these items to junk shops like Nimfa’s for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories, and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund, used to buy trash from collectors and for the maintenance of her motorcycle cart. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nimfa dreams to have a much bigger place for her business. She also hopes to have her motorcycle paid soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials that she buys for her business.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, nuestra socia vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, pero su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, son amables y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones ancestrales, se dedican a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio.

Doña María tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestra socia tiene una tienda de comestibles, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años.
 
Se encuentra reingresando  al banco comunal y su crédito lo  va a invertir en la compra arroz, azúcar, aceites, huevos, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Nueva Amistad” (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in Cumbe Parish.  This is a cold climate parish but its residents have warm hearts; they are kind and keep their culture and ancestral traditions alive.  They raise livestock, farm and are merchants.

María is 62 years old, widowed and all her children are adults, married and living independently.  The house she lives in is her property.

Our member has a foodstuffs store.  She works from Sunday to Sunday from 7am until 8pm and she’s been in business for 30 years.

She is rejoining the communal bank and will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs, detergent and other basic need items to stock her store.  Her goal is to continue to grow with the store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with five family members.

Atheer has been an owner of an aluminum workshop since 2009. He sells and makes doors, windows and kitchens. He has good experience in this field,  a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan to purchase an aluminum cutter machine and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase an aluminum cutter machine and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells provisions such as toilet paper rolls, tins of milk, milo (malted milk), eggs, toffees, and canned tomatoes in Abura. She is married to a cocoa sprayer. The income she makes from her sales is used to help take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to supply her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to supply her customers.

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro is a 37-year-old married father of three children.  He is a motorcycle transport operator in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for one year. This is his first loan from KADET to finance his business.

With this loan amount, Saro plans to expand his business by purchasing another motorcycle.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Grenik

texts.ru:
Гренику 53 года; он живет в городе Капане со своей женой, дочерью, сыном и невесткой. Почти 30 лет Греник проработал в милиции, а сейчас он на пенсии. Его жена домохозяйка, дочь работает парикмахершей, сын работает в полиции, а невестка работает учительницей в сельской школе.  
С 1990 года Греник занимается сельским хозяйством в деревне Верин Хотанан, откуда родом его родители. На своей ферме он разводит свиней и овец, выращивает овощи и фрукты, а также занимается пчеловодством. Часть полученной сельскохозяйственной продукции Греник оставляет для своей семьи, а оставшуюся продукцию продает своим постоянным покупателям в Капане. 
Греник хочет расширить свою ферму и для этой цели ему необходим кредит на сумму 800,000 драм для покупки шести бычков для своей фермы.
texts.en: Grenik is 53 years old.  He lives in the city of Kapan with his wife, daughter, son and daughter-in-law.  Grenik spent almost 30 years working as a policeman and is now retired.  His wife is a homemaker, daughter works as a hair stylist, son works as a policeman, and daughter-in-law works as a teacher in the village school.  Grenik has been involved in agriculture in the Verin Hotanan village since 1990.  This is where his parents are from.  He breeds pigs and sheep, grows vegetables and fruits and is also involved in beekeeping on his farm.  Grenik leaves some of the agricultural produce for his family and sells the remaining produce to his loyal customers in Kapan.  Grenik wants to expand his farm and needs a loan in the sum of 800,000 dram for the purchase of six calves for this farm.

loans.use: to buy six calves for his farm

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is a 66-year-old widower who operates a butchery. He has been in this business for the past six years.
Herman was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET LTD, by a KADET client. This is his second loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He intends to use his loan to buy 170 pieces of chicken, 20kg of pork and 20 pieces of fish, weighing 10kg, to add to his business stock. In this way, he hopes to diversify his business and deal with the sale of fish and pork.

loans.use: to buy 170 pieces of chicken, 20kg of pork and 20 pieces of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ngono

texts.en:
Ngono is a married woman with three children who are all grown up. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past thirteen years.  Her clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts when she sells to them on credit. She dreams of expanding her business into wholesale.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of beans, bags of maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of beans, bags of maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Arelis Johana

texts.es:
la sra. Arelis tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, Arelis es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, cuenta con el apoyo economico de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar, su esposo es maestro de educacion primaria.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio, ya que lo tiene poco surtido y las exigencias de sus clientes son mayores.
la meta de Arelis es hacer crecer su negocio y estar preparada para la epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se vende.
texts.en:
Sra. Arelis is 25 years old and the mother of one child. She sells groceries and has a store in her home. Arelis is an enterprising woman who has tremendous desire to succeed. She has the financial support of her husband with covering the household expenses. Her husband is an elementary school teacher.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business. She has very little inventory and the demands from her customers are many. Arelis indicates that her goal is to grow her business and prepare herself for the Christmas season when she generates more sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Claudia Nelly

texts.es: Claudia Nelly se encuentra muy contenta porque es la primera vez que realizara un crédito con Fundación, se siente orgullosa de tener un medio de vida como es una pulpería. A pesar de enfrentar problemas ella ha sabido sobrellevarlos el arduo trabajo y dedicación que realiza en su negocio le ha demostrado que día a día vale la pena brindar el mejor servicio. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, crema, refrescos, granos básicos y fósforos.
texts.en: Claudia Nelly is very pleased because this is the first time she will take a loan with the Foundation. She is proud to have a small grocery store as a way of earning her living. Though she has had to confront problems, she has been able to overcome them. The hard work and dedication that she puts into her business has shown her that day to day it is worth it to provide the best service. The loan is for the purchase of sweets, detergents, cream, soft drinks, basic grains, and matches.

loans.use: to buy sweets, detergents, cream, soft drinks, basic grains, and matches

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has studied till 8th standard. She is an embroidery and sewing expert and prepares beautiful looking clothes. Due to her good quality work she receives regular orders every month. Besides her embroidery business, Naseem also performs her duties as a housewife very well. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers.

Naseem has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is 31 years old and runs a betel leaves and cigarettes selling shop. He also contributes to his family financially from his earnings.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy betel leaves and cigarettes of different brands that will help him in improving his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Naseem is hopeful that his business will improve after the loan investment, and that she will be able to save some profits for his marriage in the near future.

loans.use: to buy betel leaves and different brands of cigarettes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a responsible housewife who takes the initiative to help her husband in meeting their children's needs in school, Imelda has found a way that she will help her husband. Imelda is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Imelda’s children are in college and high school level.
Imelda’s husband is a farmer. They plant rice in their village. With the earnings that come from farming, Imelda could send her children to school and could be able to meet the needs of her children in school. Despite the calamity that hits Imelda's crops, she is still continuing her business because she has no other source of income.
Imelda is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy farm inputs needed for farming. She will buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to grow. She hopes to gain higher income and be able to continue sending her children to school where they pursue their degree.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed for farming.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, age 43, has worked as an electrician for 20 years. His extensive experience has brought him the trust of his customers and has provided him with the ability to provide specialized services that are highly requested at any time. Sadly, however, the income from this business is not stable, and since his family requires a consistent income, Mohamad started an extra business: a grocery store. He reports that it has provided much of the stability he had hoped for it to provide for his family. 

To improve both businesses, Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmou, in order to buy necessary tools for his electrician business in addition to adding more products to his grocery store. He expects an increased income in both areas as a result of this loan.

Mohamad is a man with a very good reputation both as an electrician and as a grocer. He is very highly respected by his customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 38 years old and lives in the South Rift Valley with his wife and three children, who range in age from 7 to 13 years old. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling shoes. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy more shoes to sell. His goal is to do a better job of meeting his family's needs by expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras de Maria Auxiliadora es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la zona del chaco, estas mujeres se encuentran en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Estas mujeres tienen el deseo de salir adelante y mediante el trabajo en conjunto poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Norma se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en las ventas puesto que tiene muchas clientas que le solicitan sus productos. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y también cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Una de sus metas es tener un local donde pueda vender sus productos.
ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos de todas las clases, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras de María Auxiliadora is a group made up of 11 women from the El Chaco area.  These women are in the third cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs.  These women want to get ahead and be able to help each other by working together. 

Norma works selling cosmetics.  She tells us that her sales are going very well for her because she has lots of customers who request products from her.  Thanks to this job she can get ahead and help her family and also cover the daily costs that come up in her house.  One of her goals is to have a place where she can sell her products. 

She is requesting the loan to buy all types of cosmetics so she can fill the orders she has.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 31 años convive con Janeth, su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad. Ellos viven bajo un techo propio en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Julio es un esposo y padre ejemplar. Todo su esfuerzo tiene como motor su familia. 
Desde pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, es así que inició con sus propios sembríos en parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. 
De esa manera ha podido surtir y equilibrar su producción. Él cultiva café, yuca y plátano.
“De mi parcela de plátanos obtengo como de 20 a 30 arrobas, cada arroba está  a 4 soles. Si me conviene”, menciona.  Por su parte la siembra de café es aún más rentable, de sus chacras cosecha 40 sacos, cuyas ventas las realiza en abril y junio.
Julio quiere ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Con eso quiere darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa. Ésta sería la primera vez que Julio obtendría un crédito de MFP, por tal razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente emocionado por ser parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”. De recibir el dinero podrá comprar 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos de 110 soles cada uno. Con esto estará fertilizando sus tierras, ya que tiene que hacerlo 2 veces al año para asegurar una buena producción.
texts.en:
Julio, 31, lives with Janeth, his spouse, with whom he has three children who are 6, 4 and 1 year old.  They live beneath their own roof in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in Chanchamayo Province.  Julio is an exemplary husband and father.  All of his efforts are motivated by his family.

Since he was little he learned farming tasks and this is how he started out with his own parcels of land that his community and his parents assigned him.  He has been able to vary and balance his production.  He grows coffee, manioc and bananas.

“From my parcel of bananas I obtain about 20 to 30 arrobas [1 arroba = 11.5 kilos] and each arroba sells for 4 soles.  This is to my advantage,” he mentions.  The coffee is even more profitable.  He harvests 40 sacks from his fields that he sells in April and June.

Julio wants to expand his fields and increase production to provide better conditions for his wife and children.  This will be the first time that Julio gets an MFP loan so he gives his word that he will be punctual with the installment payments.  He feels excited to belong to the “Los Productores Yaneshas” communal bank.

If he were to receive the money, he will be able to buy 10 sacks of organic manure that cost 110 soles each.  With this he will be fertilizing his land because he has to do this twice a year to insure a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. Her husband, Juma, is a businessman who contributes to providing family basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past 2 years; in addition she sells vegetables. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her businesses.
 
With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old.  She is married and has three children, aged 31, 26 and 21. She started farming 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Mary has requested for a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase animal feeds for her cows. The profit she makes will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to expand her business and educate her last born child. This is her second loan.

loans.use: buy animal feed

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Lassine  est âgé de 46 ans et vit avec ses dix enfants et ses époux à Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
Lassine  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son père qui  fut un grand commerçant d’articles divers tels le céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le deuxième prêt il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de Dongorona et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, Ouelessebougou.
Lassine espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 85.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 32-year-old man from Kakamega, and married to Victoria, who is a business lady in the same town. They have one child who is two years old. He operates an M-PESA business, which he has done for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES 16,000.  He is taking a his first loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he intends to use in expanding his business. He will use the profits to plough back into the business and repay the loan.  His dream is to open several of these shops, so as to create employment for other people also.

loans.use: to purchase float and airtime to use sending and withdrawing cash for his clients.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 47 años, está casada con Germán y tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella en su vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Justina se dedica a la agricultura decidió sacar provecho a unos terrenos que su padre le obsequio. Tras 22 años de trabajo junto a su esposo tuvo que afrontar el difícil momento de saber que Germán tras un incidente fortuito  perdiera el sentido de la visión convirtiéndose desde entonces solo en el apoyo logístico e imprescindible de las labores en el campo. Con el apoyo que recibe por parte de los trabajadores del lugar logra sacar adelante la producción de sus terrenos cuyo producto principal es el cacao orgánico por ser rentable de acuerdo a la calidad que posee y que se logra aplicando las condiciones técnicas necesarias consistentes en el deshierbo de maleza, abono orgánico y algunos factores de cuidado como sombra y deschuponado de ramas. Es el tercer préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y agradece por la confianza y oportunidad que le brindan. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de herramientas y usar parte del dinero para el pago de los trabajadores que le ayudarán en la cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de herramientas y pago de los trabajadores.

loans.name: Natividad Guadalupe

texts.en:
Natividad is a young married woman who has 2 sons of which one of them is 1 year old and the other one is 3 years old. She and her husband work everyday to achieve a better future for their sons.

For this reason, Natividad not only takes care of her sons and family but also works selling shoes by catalogue. This activity lets her take advantage of her free time and she feels useful. She also contributes to covering the family expenses through this activity.

Natividad has been selling shoes for the past two years. Initially, she started to sell to her neighbors and, little by little, she has gotten more and more clients. Now she has a good portfolio of clients.

For this reason, Natividad needs capital to invest in her products for the upcoming season when she will offer autumn-winter new shoe models. Natividad is requesting a loan of US$ 250 to purchase merchandise and take advantage of this season where she believes her sales will increase. She offers to pay this loan in three months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Natividad es una mujer joven de 24 años, ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños de 1 y 3 años, ella y su esposo trabajan diariamente por forjar un buen futuro para sus pequeños, es por eso que ella aparte de encargarse del cuidado de su familia se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo, actividad que ha sabido manejar, ya que le permite aprovechar sus tiempos libres en la venta de zapatos sin descuidar a sus hijos, y sobre todo la hace sentirse útil al saber que contribuye al ingreso familiar. Desde hace mas de dos años ofrece zapatos por catálogo, inicio con sus vecinas y poco a poco ha ido ampliando el número de sus clientes, hasta tener una buena cartera , es por eso que necesita capital de trabajo para surtir sus productos para esta nueva temporada y ofrecer los nuevos modelos de la temporada de otoño e invierno. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por $250 USD para pagar en un plazo de 3-6 meses y poder aprovechar el incremento en sus ventas que estacionalmente se da por estas fechas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Magda Concepción

texts.en:
Magda is married and has three children--two boys ages 9 and 13 and a 7-year-old girl. Her husband works for the Mexican Social Security Institute. Magda has been sewing for 14 years and has always enjoyed it. In the beginning, she only sewed for her own family. When her children started school 7 years ago she sewed their uniforms, and in time others began asking her to do some tailoring for them and she became known and made a business out of it, hoping to finance a good education for her children. Magda is asking for a $250 loan to stock up on cloth. So far she has only done sewing but now she would like to expand her business and offer cloth for sale. She plans to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months and thanks you in advance for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Magda esta casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños dos hombres de 13 y 9 años de edad respectivamente y una mujercita de 7 años. Su esposo es trabajador en el IMSS, que es el Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social. Magda siempre a tenido gusto por la costura y se dedica a esto hace 14 años pero solamente cocía para su familia, ya cuando sus hijos empezaron la escuela hace siete años atrás, ella les confeccionaba sus uniformes, con el tiempo algunas personas les solicitaron algunos trabajos de costura y así poco a poco se hizo conocida y continuó con el negocio, con este negocio ella desea pagarle una buena educación a sus hijos.

Magda esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 250 para comprar telas, ya que ella solo confecciona y cose, ahora ella desea también ofrecer las telas a sus clientes y así continuar creciendo, ofrece pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses y cuenta con la ayuda que ustedes le pueden brindar, por ello les agradece por adelantado su colaboración.

loans.use: To buy cloth.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica is the president of the borrower's group Asociación Comunal Chévere. Her group is one of the oldest groups in ProMujer, and it is made up of 18 women with a common affinity, each with the objective to grow their businesses and improve their quality of life.

The Las Chévere group is in its 16th credit cycle within ProMujer. That means that the women of this group have successfully paid back 16 groups loans with 6-month loan terms (as a maximum) for each of them. As a group, they are soliciting a "temporary credit" that will permit them to grow their businesses during this loan cycle. In Angelica's case, she is hoping to use this loan to prepare her restaurant, which is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto. She will use this loan to purchase provisions that will get her ready to receive clients during the August "fiestas patrias," when her business swells as her neighbors come out to honor the patron saint of her community.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica es socia y presidenta de la Asociación Comunal Chévere. Esta es una de las asociaciones más destacadas en Pro Mujer, esta compuesta por 18 mujeres de afinidad común, todas con el objetivo de prosperar en sus negocios y mejorar su calidad de vida. Las Chévere se encuentran en el décimo sexto ciclo de créditos en Pro Mujer, es decir que fueron financiadas en 16 oportunidades con créditos ya cancelados en un lapso de 6 meses cada uno como un plazo máximo. Como asociación, van en busca de un crédito de temporada que les permita abastecer sus negocios, como el caso de Angélica, que desea contar con dinero para preparar su restaurante, ubicado en la zona 16 de Julio y provisionarse de insumos y alimentos para recibir a la clientela que se dará cita de forma masiva en las actividades a desarrollarse en homenaje a las fiestas patrias en el mes de agosto.

loans.use: Angelica wants to buy ingredients and foods for her restaurant, in advance of civic celebrations.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho has received loans from Mekong Plus 3 times already, and she has paid back each loan on time.  Her last loan was funded by Kiva.  Her previous loans were used to expand her grocery store.  The grocery store has really taken off since she's received the loans.  She is able to consistently earn between 10-15,000 VND per day ($0.62-0.94).  Tho also sews clothes at home in order to make a little extra money, but she does not earn money every day from sewing.  Her husband works as a day laborer but his work is very unstable.  He is not able to find work every day, and the job is very difficult.  Tho would like to invest in some pigs in order to earn some extra money.  She is asking for a loan to buy food and supplies for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies to raise pigs

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Sra. Raquel belongs to the El Abiseo community bank. She lives in Juanjui, a city in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of San Martin. She sells poultry in a local market and she's recently started selling other merchandise--clothes, shoes, CDs, DVDs, earrings, etc.--as well. The businesses generate enough income to pay Raquel's household expenses and educate her children. Thanks to her persistence and drive to get ahead, she's managed to get the things that she's dreamed of.

With a recent loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.3,000 (3,000 Peruvian soles or about US$1,000), to be paid over 4 months, Raquel will buy a flock of 200 chickens--along with feed and other supplies--that she will raise and eventually sell. By supplying her poultry-selling business herself, she will no longer have to spend as much to buy from middle men. She will also invest half the money in expanding her other business, thanks to the huge demand for her products.

Sra. Raquel, 38, is married and has 5 children who depend on her and her husband. Her oldest daughter is in college and the rest are in high school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Raquel pertenece al Banco Comunal El Abiseo, vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Nº 01 de la zona y se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas visceradas, actualmente esta incursionando en el negocio de mercería ( venta de ropa, zapatos, CD, DVD, aretes, etc. ) ambos negocios le generan buenos ingresos como para poder solventar los gastos del hogar, educar a los hijos, gracias a la perseverancia y a las ganas de salir adelante ha podido lograr tener las cosas que siempre ha soñado.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1,000.00) pagadero en un plazo de 4 meses comprará un galpón de 200 pollos y gallinas para criar y los insumos necesarios para la alimentación y de ahí poder abastecer su venta de pollos y gallinas visceradas y ya no estar comprando a terceros; además invertirá la mitad del dinero en ampliar el negocio de mercería; todo esto gracias a la gran demanda

La señora Raquel, tiene 38 años esta casada y cuenta con 05 hijos que aún dependen de ella y de su esposo, una de sus hijas, la mayor, está en la universidad y los demás aun están en el colegio.

loans.use: Buy flocks of chicken for poultry business, along with other merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: Marifat is a seller of children's clothes for over 5 years.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her business is located in the Spitamen big clothes market, Tajikistan.  She became a client of Microinvest in 2003 and she used her first loan to expand her assortment of goods. She purchases goods weekly.  Today she has a good turnover of goods and has a constant stream clients.  Her trade place is profitable as it is situated in the first  clothes row at the market.  Now, she is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase winter clothes.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tú, 30 years of age, of Phúc Yên, joined TYM Fund in 2006. She tends a small general store while her husband, Nguyễn Văn Minh, is repairing watches. They have 2 children, both are in school age. Although still a new member, Mrs. Tú is energetic in the Fund’s activities. With the Fund’s new policy, she is now eligible for loan application. Mrs. Tú would like to take out a loan of 575USD to replenish her store. Her current monthly income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Tú, 30 T.ổi, sống tại Phúc Yên, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2006. Công việc chính của chị Tú hiện nay là bán hàng tạp hóa. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Minh là một thợ sửa đồng hồ, hai con chị cũng đang còn trong độ T.ổi đi học. Là một thành viên mới nhưng chị Tú rất năng động, nhiệt tình cho công việc của Quỹ và mạnh dạn vay vốn cho kinh doanh. Với chính sách của Quỹ ngày càng linh hoạt hiện nay chị đã đủ tiêu chuẩn để được vay những mức vốn lớn. Vòng vốn này chị dự định xin vay 575USD để mua thêm hàng hóa cho của hàng của mình. Thu nhập của chị Tú là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
A few years ago Perla found part time work as an assistant to a woman selling used clothing. Through this work, she learned all she needed to dedicate herself to this kind of work. After saving some money, she started a business of her own one year ago. Thanks to this effort, Perla is earning more than she did as an assistant, which was not enough to cover her household costs. As a single mother, she must provide for her young son.

Today she needs more merchandise to sell. Perla is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 6 months, so she can purchase more used clothing and offer a greater variety to her customers. With your help, Perla will be able to provide a better quality of life for her son.

Hace varios años que Perla consiguió un trabajo informal como ayudante de una vendedora de ropa usada. Con la cual aprendió todo lo necesario para dedicarse a este oficio. Fue así como después de ahorrar un poco de dinero, se independizó, hace un año, gracias a este esfuerzo Perla está adquiriendo un poco más de ingresos puesto que con lo que ganaba como ayudante, no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su casa. Puesto que ella es madre soltera del pequeñito con el que sale en la foto.

Actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía. Es por eso que Perla está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Perla podrá comprar una paca de ropa usada para poder tener más variedad en sus productos. Con tu ayuda Perla podrá salir adelante con este negocio y brindarle lo mejor a su hijo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE USED CLOTHING FOR HER BUSINESS AND OFFER HER CUSTOMERS A GREATER VARIETY.  HER BUSINESS PROVIDES THE INCOME SHE NEEDS TO SUPPORT HER YOUNG SON.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
"I am Nasira B. from Lahore, [the] second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of an only son who is four years old. I make ready-made dresses and my husband sells ice. He faces great difficulty in transporting these blocks from the cold store to his shop. Therefore, we have decided to buy a small loading van for this purpose. Hence, we request a loan. I will also pool in my savings with your loan.

"I would like to borrow in a group of [a] few other women. Mahjabeen B. runs a beauty salon. Shabana B. wants this loan to pay-off remaining installments of her rickshaw. Rahat B. needs this loan for her husband’s shoe business. Zareena B. will buy her husband a rickshaw."

loans.use: Buy a small loading van for the business and support the other businesses

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, 48 years old, has realized her dream of having a restaurant. She and her husband have worked hard for 7 years at the restaurant, and both work day after day to improve it. Before she was interested in opening a restaurant, Mercedes worked cleaning different homes. She only did this work for small periods of time because she admits that it is very tiring. Nonetheless, she had to work because her husband had lost his job and she had to maintain her home. When they had saved up some money, she and her husband decided to turn a room in their home into a restaurant that they named “Picantería C..” Little by little it grew, and today they are still ambitious. They would like to buy better furniture and expand the restaurant. On the other hand, they also rent two washing machines to their neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes a sus cuarenta y ocho ha sabido hacer realidad su sueño de poder tener un restaurante. Desde hace siete años que manejan con mucho esfuerzo su esposo y ella el negocio, ambos le dedican el día a día al mejoramiento de este. Antes de animarse a abrir su restaurante Mercedes trabajaba ofreciendo servicio de limpieza a distintos hogares. Este trabajo solo lo hacia por pequeñas temporadas porque nos afirma que es muy cansado; sin embargo, era una obligación, ya que su esposo en ese entonces había perdido su trabajo y tenia que mantener su hogar. Cuando tuvieron algunos ahorros su esposo y ella decidieron ambientar una habitación de su casa para abrir su restaurante “Picantería C.”. Poco a poco han ido creciendo y hoy en día ambicionan aun más, pues quieren implementar su local con mejores muebles agrandarlo. Por otro lado, ellos también alquilan dos máquinas de lavar ropa a sus vecinos.

loans.use: Improve her restaurant space

loans.name: Palave En Accion Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a 36-year old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the community of Palave, a small and impoverished area on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo.

Nancy has a small business selling shoes and clothes to her community. She is requesting a loan so she can have enough capital to buy more merchandise in bulk, and  be able to better meet the needs of her clients.  Without the loan, she is limited in her ability to buy enough merchandise to earn marginal amounts of money that don’t allow her the room to invest in her business, much less accrue savings for her family.

She hopes this loan will help her move her life forward, so that by the end of the year she will be able to have a much bigger business, help proviD. better education and school supplies to her three children, and maybe even save enough money so that she and her husband will be able to buy their own home.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Nancy herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of her shoes and clothing business.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Chek M. is 40 years old and lives as a housewife in the Siem Reap province. Her husband earns income for the family, working as both a farmer and a fisherman. Even with the two jobs, however, he only earns about US$3 a day. Chek M. and her husband have four children who are all still young and live at home. Chek M. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a water buffalo for the family's farm, which will help increase the overall crop yields and the income of the family.

loans.use: Purchase of a water buffalo

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is 30 years old. For six years, she has lived with her partner, Cayetano, who is 32 years old. They are a united couple who have raised a beautiful 5-year-old son who already attends pre-school.

Liliana owns a shop which she has managed for five years. Previously, the shop belonged to her mother, who left it because of health reasons.

Previously, Liliana worked as a maid in the capital city. That work was tough because she had to get up very early and she did not make a lot of money. Her partner works for a well-known company located in Asuncion, the capital city of Paraguay.

Today, things are going well. The income that the small shop generates goes toward buying food and providing an education for their son -- something that Liliana never had since she came from a humble family, and she only got as far as the 5th grade.

At this time, Liliana needs a loan so that she may buy merchandise like flour, sugar, rice, noodles, etc. so she can stock her business better and increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana, tiene 30 años de edad. Vive en pareja hace 6 años con Cayetano que tiene 32 años de edad. Forman una pareja muy unida y han criado a un hermoso niño de 5 años de edad que ya va al pre - escolar de la educación escolar.

Liliana es dueña de una despensa que administra desde hace 5 años ya que anteriormente el negocio pertenecía a su madre, quien se lo dejó por motivos de salud.

Cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica en la ciudad capital, el trabajo era muy sacrificado debido a que debía levantarse muy temprano para acudir al mismo, además la remuneración era muy poca. Su pareja trabaja como empleado de una conocida empresa que funciona en Asunción, ciudad capital del Paraguay. .

Hoy día le va bastante bien, los ingresos que generan su pequeña despensa le dan para comer, además de brindarle una buena educación a su pequeño hijo, cosa que ella no logró debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde y solo hizo hasta el 5to. Grado de la primaria.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc. a fin de surtir mejor su negocio y de esa manera poder aumentar su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice, noodles, drinks, meat, and bread.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 43 years old, is married with Mr. Eugenio Colman, has 4 children, they are still on elementary school.

Blanca has been working as a teacher for 19 years and her husband worked in sells until the last year. Because of the necessity to improve the quality of life for her kids and thanks to the long years of educational work, and the unconditional support of her husband they decided to open a small grocery store that is attended by her husband. Now days, after a year of effort, the small store has increased so much on products as well as clients that now is selling meat, clothes and toys.

She will use the credit to acquire sugar, milk, beverages, flour, rice, pasta, bread, among others in large quantities and get more profit, which will help on the educational growth of her kids.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Eugenio Colmán, tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos estudian aún en la escuela primaria de la ciudad.

Blanca trabaja como docente con una antigüedad de 19 años y su marido trabajaba en ventas varias hasta hace un año atrás. Blanca debido a la necesidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, y gracias al sacrificio de tantos años de labores educativas y con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo decidieron abrir una pequeña despensa la cual es atendida por su esposo.

Hoy en día, y después de un año de mucho esfuerzo, la pequeña despensa ha aumentado tanto en diversidad de mercaderías como también en cantidad de clientes; tanto fue su crecimiento que están vendiendo carnes, artículos de mercería, bazar y juguetería.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para adquirir mercaderías azúcar, lácteos, bebidas en general, harina, arroz, fideo, panificados, entre otros, en gran cantidad y así poder obtener un poco más de ganancias, las cuales les ayudarán en el crecimiento educativo de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy products like sugar, milk, beverages, flour, rice, pasta, bread, among others / Compra de mercaderías como azúcar, lácteos, bebidas en general, harina, arroz, fideo, panificados, entre otros.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 29 years old. She is divorced. She has been a clothes and firewood seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and firewood for her business

loans.name: Movsum

texts.en: Movsum is 32 years old. He is single and lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in a furniture making business for 3 years. Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making furniture

loans.name: Mai Astou

texts.fr: Mai Astou S., 51 ans, mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des produits (effets de toilette) pour charger une cantine et renforcer son petit commerce de vente d' arachide, niébé et mil. Ses revenus lui permettent d’acheter du bétail et de renforcer ses stocks.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mai Astou S., age 51, is married and has one child in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group for six years. She wants to buy goods (toiletries) to stock a booth and to enhance her small-scale business selling peanuts, black-eyed peas, and millet. Her income enables her to buy livestock and to bolster her inventories. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell toiletries and food items

loans.name: Melitón

texts.es:
Con 6 años invertidos en el negocio de los mototaxis (conduce uno), el señor Melitón cuenta con 50 años de edad. El señor ve imperiosa su necesidad económica y la de su hija de 19 años, con quien vive en casa, por lo cual se dedica también a la música en una peña, todo esto en pos de solventar sus necesidades básicas así como la educación superior de su hija. Es más que ardua su labor como mototaxista, partiendo con el amanecer y llegando a casa pasada la medianoche, pero siempre pasando por casa para dejar para el almuerzo y pasajes a la Universidad de su hija, haciendo más que loable su labor. Tanto esfuerzo le causa los réditos necesarios para dichas necesidades pero esconde la escasez de tiempo que tiene para con su hija, lo cual afecta mucho al señor Melitón.

En pro de volver más rentable su trabajo como mototaxista, el señor Melitón requiere de 500 soles de préstamo, lo que le sumaría tiempo para pasar con su hija.
texts.en:
Meliton is 50 years old, and has invested the last 6 years in the mototaxi business (he drives one). Meliton sees his tough financial situation and in addition to driving the mototaxi, he also works as a musician to support his household expenses and his 19-year-old daughter's college education. As a mototaxi driver, Meliton works long hours: he leaves home at dawn, and comes back after midnight, but he always drives by home at lunch time to leave money for his daughter's meals and transportation to the university, which makes his efforts even more commendable. These long work days do produce enough income to cover Meliton's expenses, but he has little time to spend with his daughter, which leaves him with a heavy heart. Meliton is requesting a loan of 500 soles to purchase enough fuel for the motor taxi, and to have a contingency plan for repairs. Having this money available now will make it possible for Meliton to have some free time to spend with his daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing fuel for mototaxi and have spare funds to cover repairs

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
B. Kwasi is twenty-eight years old. He is married with one kid who is currently in school. B. has been a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like televisions, sound systems, speakers, cables, transmitters, screw drivers, electric fans, etc. for six years now. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators, and other logistics to facilitate his business growth.

B. would be so glad for your support.

He belongs to the community group called Vibrant Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He does not sell on group meeting days and his picture was taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic gadgets and parts.

loans.name: Théoneste

texts.en:
Greetings from Théoneste B. in Kicukiro District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Théoneste is 23 years old, married with 3 children.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop in his local area. He sells household materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans, paraffin, biscuits, etc. From all his business activities, he earns about US$ 95 per month.

Théoneste is requesting a loan worth 300 000 Rwf which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: expanding his general store

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo M., 40, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang, Cambodia. She is a good housewife who stays at home looking after three school-aged children. Her husband, pictured here, works as a construction foreman and is able to make $4 every day. Mrs. Bo M. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the public transportation cost.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sa Voeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Voeurn N. is a villager in Koun Tmar village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fish middleman. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seang Hay, helps his wife’s business. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more fish to re-sell to earn more profit.

Mrs. Sa Voeurn N. is a 35-year-old with two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Thúy năm nay  51 tuổi.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do chồng mất sớm, hai con còn nhỏ thu nhập chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mở rộng sản xuất, chăn nuôi và học thêm nghề may. Hiện nay  ngoài chăn nuôi chị và con gái  may găng tay và may quần áo cho các cơ sở may. Thu nhập của gia đình hiện nay  đạt 4.5 triêu đồng/tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua máy khâu và vải về làm may.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi T. is 51 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family's economic situation was very difficult as her husband had died and she had two small children. The main source of income was from farming and livestock raising. To date, after 10 years of participation in the Fund, she proactively borrowed money to expand the farming and livestock raising business and learn to be a tailor. Currently, apart from raising livestock, she and her daughter make gloves and clothes for garment workshops. The family's income is at VND4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy sewing machine and textiles to make clothes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and textiles to make clothes

loans.name: Abdumurat

texts.ru: Абдумурат мужчина 36 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Работает в колхозе трактористом.Жена занимается продажей домашнего коровьего молока.Сам Абдумурат дополнительно занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у него две коровы и десять баранов.Его друзья посоветовали в кредит купить ещё пару коров.Для чего и обратился Абдумурат в Микроинвест.Семейное положение у него среднего проживания.Проживает он в Сомгаре, где очень много озеленённых пастбищ для прогулки скотов.На пастбища выводит скот сын Абдумурата.
texts.en:
Zulmurat is a 36 year old man, he is married and has three children. He works at a collective farm as a tractor driver. His wife sells cows’ milk. Zulmurat also raises and sells livestock. Right now he owns two cows and ten sheep. His friends advised him to purchase a couple more cows on credit. This is why Zulmurat turned to MicroInvest. His family is middle class. He lives in Somgar where there are a lot of green pastures for livestock. Zulmurat’s son takes the livestock out to pasture.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Ambroisine

texts.fr:
A. Ambroisine est née vers les années 1975 à Grand-Popo, une ville touristique du Bénin. Ambroisine est Célibataire sans enfants et couturière de formation. Mais Ambroisine est dans la restauration. Ambroisine vend aussi des chaussures, des sacs de sortie et des tissus. Ambroisine réside au quartier Godomey un banlieue de la Commune d’Abomey-Calavi. Ambroisine sollicite de crédit auprès de AALIDé pour développer son restaurant afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Ambroisine was born around 1975 in Grand-Popo, a tourist town of Bénin. She has no children and is a seamstress by training. But she works in the restaurant business. She also sells shoes, handbags, and cloth. Ambroisine resides in Godomey, a suburb of the town of Abomey-Calavi. She’s requesting a loan from Alidé to develop her restaurant in order to serve her customers better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pub items, pasta, canned milk and sardines, mayonnaise, butter, coffee, and cloth

loans.name: Bubiniso

texts.ru: Курбанова Бубинисо- женщина 39 лет. Замужем мать 5-х детей. У Бубинисо занимается торговлей пряжи и вязанием шерстенных носков. На полученный займ она оптом хочет купить пряжу. Ей помогает старшая дочка. Муж Бубинисо уехал на заработки в Российскую федерацию. Бубинисо закупает пряжу у оптовиков в Адрасмане. Бубинисо очень довольна нашими условиями и она решила попробовать кредитования у нас.
texts.en:
Bubiniso K. is a 39 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. Bubiniso sells yarn and knits woolen socks. She would like to use her loan to purchase a wholesale quantity of yarn. Her eldest daughter helps her. Bubiniso’s husband went to the Russian Federation to earn money. Bubiniso purchases yarn from wholesalers in Adrasman. Bubiniso is very happy with our terms and she decided to try borrowing from us.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn

loans.name: Ferdinand's Group

texts.en: M. Ferdinand is the leader of the Bulera development group. He is a hardworking elderly man and an achiever. Ferdinand is a farmer with sugarcane plantations, pineapples, matooke, beans, maize, and plantains as well as keeping animals like pigs, cows, poultry and sheep; that is why his home is always full of commotion, both from people and animals. He started his businesses in 1970 after he resigned from work in the tea factories. He started very small, and a few years down the road, he did not regret his move. But again, life these days is more favorable, as he is able to get money to employ labor on his farms as well as paying school fees for his children and grand children. He is a married man with 7 children, 3 of whom are still in school. He also pays school fees for 5 grandchildren, since their parents past on. He is grateful that most of his customers come to him for their produce; hence, he does not have to incur more costs on transport, regardless of his old age. In all his businesses, he works hand in hand with his wife and together they have managed to come this far. Ferdinand needs a loan to hire more manpower on his farms for quick and better crop yields, and paying school fees.

loans.use: Hire labor on his farms and pay school fees for his children and grandchildren

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa F. V. reside en Lourdes Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Blanca vive solamente  con su hija Jessica de 17 años de edad  y está cursando 9º grado en la escuela. Blanca cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien está fuera del país por darle a su familia una superación económica. A pesar que Blanca recibe ayuda de su esposo ella es una mujer que trabaja día a día y es así como lleva ya 8 años en su negocio, ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla donde vende sopas de patas, un plato muy difícil de preparar y también bien muy demandado por los salvadoreños. Blanca solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima de los ingredientes para la sopa de patas, así incrementara sus ventas y las necesidades de sus clientes por tan cotizado platillo.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa F. V. lives in Lourdes Colon in La Libertad Department. She lives with her daughter Jessica, who is 17 and currently in ninth grade. Blanca's husband is currently working outside El Salvador in order to help support his family economically. Even though Blanca receives help from her husband, she is a woman who works every day at her business, which she has been doing for the past eight years. She works in the Santa Tecla Market selling pig's feet stew, a dish that is very difficult to prepare and for which there is very high demand in El Salvador. Blanca is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to make her soup, in order to increase her sales and fulfill her customers' demand for this popular dish.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make pig's feet stew

loans.name: Norith

texts.es: La señora Norith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. joyas confeccionadas en metales finos, ubicada en su misma casa donD. poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, ya que los venD. a un precio diferente.En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos, amigos, familiares y transeúntes, que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar donD. ella personalmente les atienD.  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con el préstamo D. S/ 500.00, comprará joyas como aretes, cadenas, dijes, sortijas confeccionados en metales finos, para venderlos al por mayor y menor; así continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Norith, anhela implementar su propia joyería y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo logra.   Agradece el apoyo que viene recibiendo  para emprender su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Norith belongs to the communal bank, "Siempre Unidas" (Always United), which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martín. She is married, is 54, and has 2 children who still depend on her economically and who are in school. Her enterprising character and her love for her family motivated her to start her own business selling jewelry maD. out of fine metals. Her business is located in her home where little by little she expanded it and gained experience in this work. She has maD. herself very well-known and loved among her customers since she sells her jewerly for different prices. Currently she has steady customers, friends, family members, and passersby who come to her house every day to shop, and she personally attends to them with happiness and enthusiasm. With this loan of 500 PEN, she will purchase jewelry like earrings, necklaces, and rings maD. out of fine metals. She sells them both wholesale and retail to offer better service to her customers. Norith hopes to start her own jewelry store, and she says that she is going to make her dream a reality because she is a woman who achieves what she sets out to do. She is thankful for the support that she keeps receiving to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fine metals

loans.name: Bartola Audelia

texts.es: Bartola Audelia F. D. L. resiD. en el municipio D. Tonacatepeque en el  departamento D. San Salvador. Bartola tiene 58 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando actualmente. Bartola se dedica a la venta D. perfumes hace ya cinco años, pero hace unos meses Bartola tuvo la idea D. ampliar sus ganancias poniendo una tienda en su casa donD. también tendría a la venta sus perfumes D. esta manera Bartola y su familia han ido mejorando en la estabilidad económica, pero el destino del crédito que Bartola solicita es porque desea seguir creciendo con su negocio surtiéndolo con variedad D. bebidas, cereales, detergentes  entre otros; todo esto con el fin que obtener mayores ingresos para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Bartola Audelia F. D. L. resides in the town of Tonacatepeque in the region of San Salvador. Bartola is 58 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and three daughters, all of whom are currently in school. Bartola has worked selling perfumes for the past 5 years, but a few months ago, she had the idea to increase her income by putting a small market in her house, from which she could also sell her perfumes. By doing this, Bartola and her family have been improving their economic stability, however, Bartola still needs to request a loan because she wishes to continue expanding her business, supplying her store with a variety of drinks, cereals, detergents, and other goods. She seeks to grow her business in this way in order to meet her goal of obtaining a higher income for her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La microempresaria Yesenia del Carmen Alemán Fernández tiene 24 años de edad, es casada con 2 hijos y tiene desde hace 4 años una pulpería en un barrio periférico de esta ciudad de Bluefields. Actualmente su marido se encuentra desempleado y solamente en ocasiones logra trabajar de manera informal, por lo que depende la familia de este negocio.

Cabe mencionar que el sector donde esta ubicada esta pulpería no cuenta con mucha competencia solamente existen dos pulperías y ambas abastecen al sector con la salvedad que solamente esta vende productos cárnicos (Pollo y carne de res) por lo que mantiene sus clientes permanentemente.

Sin embargo aun no cumple con la demanda del sector y necesita crecer en su inventario por lo que está solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

3 Quintales de Arroz americano a US 45.00 cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a US 30.00 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US 25.00 cada bidón, 50 libras de pollo a US 1.00 cada libra, 2 quintales de frijoles a US 35.00 cada quintal, 50 libras de carne de res a US 1.30 cada libra, 3 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US 10.00 cada caja y 2 cajas de leche a US 20.00 cada caja.
texts.en:
Yesenia del Carmen Alemán Fernández is a 24 year old entrepreneur. She is married and has two children. For four years she has had a mini market in an outlying district of the city of Bluefields. Her husband is currently unemployed. He only occasionally gets some informal work. Her family depends on her business. There is not much competition in the sector where her mini market is. There are only two stores, and they both supply the area with provisions. Only her store sells meat (chicken and beef), and she therefore keeps her customers permanently. Even so, she does not meet the area’s demands. She needs to increase her inventory. That is why she is asking for a loan for the following products: 3 Quintales (a quintal is equal to 100 pounds) of American rice at US 45.00 per quintal, 2 quintales of sugar at US 30.00 per quintal, 2 drums of oil at US 25.00 per drum, 50 pounds of chicken at US 1.00 per pound, 2 quintales of beans at US 35.00 per quintal, 50 pounds of beef at US 1.30 per pound, 3 boxes of three minute soup at US 10.00 per box and 2 boxes of milk at US 20.00 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, chicken, beans, beef, 3 minute soup, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Пополнение ассортимента

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La señora Ofelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Anteriormente Ofelia, se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, hoy en día se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, donde poco a poco fue implementándolo, ahora ya es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada al fondo de su casa, donde sus principales clientes son estudiantes, trabajadores y amigos.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará 10 sacos de cemento, y materiales de construcción, para mejorar la infraestructura de sus habitaciones.Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mi Sueño” (My Dream), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 2 dependent children.

Ofelia previously sold groceries, but now she has rooms for rent. Her business started slowly, but today it is well-known and has a good reception. She continues to manage her business today, which is located behind her house. Her main customers are students, workers, and friends.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy 10 bags of cement and construction materials so that she can improve the infrastructure of each of the rooms.

Ofelia is very happy with the service she has received, so she thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her who want to work and succeed. She hopes to continue working for a long time and help other women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 20 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar en los gastos del hogar y darles una vejez tranquila. Los días de Violeta son muy agitados, ya que ella tiene un restaurante muy concurrido y tiene que estar corriendo de un lado a otro para atender a todos sus clientes. Sus comidas son muy halagadas por los comensales, ya que tiene una muy buena sazón y aunque es muy joven todavía, siente que ha perdido años de trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es cocinar y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender ella sola a todos sus clientes. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en uno de los restaurantes más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Este es el tercer préstamo de Violeta con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas ollas, platos y cubiertos, ya que los que usa actualmente están muy gastados.
texts.en:
Violeta is 20 years old and is a very cheerful and hardworking young woman. She lives in her parents' house, and she wants to help them with household expenses and make it possible for them to take it easy in their old age. Violeta's days are very busy, since she has a popular restaurant and she has to run around waiting on all of her customers. Her meals are highly regarded by the diners, because she's a good cook and, even though she is still young, she feels that she has lost years of work. What she likes most about her business is cooking, which does very gladly. She's been doing this for 2 years and she considers the most difficult part to be having to wait on the customers all by herself. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and become one of the most well-known restaurants in the city of Juliaca. This is Violeta's third loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her payments on time. She is very happy with her communal bank and is always up-to-date with all the agreements among its members. With the 700 nuevos soles requested, she will buy new pots, plates and silverware, since the ones she currently uses are wearing out.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk for her cafe.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
With concern for the future of their five children, Elizabeth and her husband help each other earn a living. They live in the village of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are a poor family but are determined to give their children a better future, by giving them the best education.

Elizabeth's husband cultivates their farm and plants a variety of vegetables and rice. Elizabeth sells fish in their village. She buys fish in the Solano Public Market and sell them through house to house delivery.  According to her, she can able to earn a net income of PHP700 a week.  She uses her income to cover daily needs, to pay school tuition fees and to provide an allowances for their children. 

Since her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of their family, Elizabeth is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP16,000. She plans to purchase more products to improve her small business and to give their children a better future.

loans.use: Buy more products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia T. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Virginia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 19-year-old young man living with his parents and three siblings. Four years ago his father taught him how to work as a construction worker and in 2008 he started working on his own. Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase wood for his new project.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is a focused, hard worker who sells ladies' clothing and underwear. She is a devoted member of Shalom Union in LAPO Microfinance. She is 42 years old, and married with three children. Her husband is a civil servant. She has a store in a nearby market where she sells her products. She needs a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more ladies' underwear to sell in her store. She believes that having an assortment of ladies' underwear and clothing that is both practical and of good quality will increase her sales. She offers a very big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' underwear to sell.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.en:
María has been selling fruits and vegetables for over twelve years in the Mayoreo market in Managua. Her stall is open air with a dirt floor. She sells a wide variety of goods including passion fruit, papaya, melon, yucca, quequisque (taro), and limes. She is planning to use the loan to invest in her business by purchasing additional merchandise such as papaya, yucca and squash to sell. 

María is a widow. Though she has no children living at home, she currently takes care of four of her grandchildren. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about three years now. She credits the loans from CEPRODEL with allowing her to continue maintaining her business and moving forward. She said it also helps her to avoid working with a moneylender.

loans.use: To buy inventory like papayas, yucca, quequisque and squash

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 33-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Simon has been working as a taxi driver since 1993. Simon is an active man who does his best to improve his family’s income. Therefore, he requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and also, with the remaining amount, to do some décor changes in his house, because he plans to get married in a year or so. This is his second loan cycle, and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passersby. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing a school van.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
Julia Beatriz C. C. tiene 51 años, es casado, y  tiene ocho hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Julia trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz y también se dedica a la ganadería.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y  en San Pablo.
