La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, le gusta salir con la familia en las festividades.

Julia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y compra de animales.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Julia Beatriz C. C. is 51 years old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in the San Miguel county of Bolívar province. She is a member of the rural development fund Calzado Solidario. The premises are found 15 minutes outside San Miguel on the way to the coast. Juila's group has 19 members, who work in farming and raising small livestock. Julia works in farming to increase her family's income. Her most profitable crop is maize. She also raises livestock. She sells her products in markets in San Miguel and San Pablo. The biggest cultural event in San Miguel is Carnaval, which is celebrated every year in February. Julia also likes to go out and celebrate with her family during holidays. Julia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for farming and purchasing animals. Her goal is to have a good job to support her family. The challenges she faces are bad weather and illnesses that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farming supplies and animals.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
To earn a living in Oyo State, Victoria sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business so much because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is a hard-working woman. She sells daily from 7 am to 7 pm. She desires to own a supermarket in the future. 

Victoria is 47 years old and married with three children. Her youngest child is 13 years old. Her children are still dependent on her. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders in anticipation for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eduardo M. es propietario del Centro de Estudios Tecnológicos Actualizados, el mismo cuenta con la resolución del Ministerio de Educación y Culto numero 273/07 la cual habilita el instituto de formación profesional, la misma viene operando en nuestra ciudad y cuenta con todas las comodidades, aulas climatizadas, soporte técnico e informático.

    El mismo dirige el centro con su señora esposa la Profesora Maria Gloria Medina y el crédito solicitado a nuestra institución será invertido para compra de sofwart para el instituto. 
Solicitó el crédito para invertir en mejoras para el centro de estudios, en la compra de equipos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eduardo M. is the proprietor of the Centro de Estudios Tecnológicos Actualizados (Center for Modern Technological Studies). The Center is authorized by the Ministry of Education and Culture’s resolution number 273/07, which enables the formation of professional institutes. It is operating in our city and has all necessary facilities, air-conditioned classrooms and technical and information-technology support.

Sr. M. directs the Center with his wife, Professor Maria Gloria Medina. The loan applied for from our institution will be invested in the purchase of software. He is also applying for the loan in order to invest in improving the Center through the purchase of equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of software and equipment such as computers.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 42-year-old married man with five children. His children attend school and this gives him joy as a father. He has a bar where he sells drinks at retail prices. He has been in this business for a long time. Amos, a hard-working man, is seeking a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.  He  thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Eugenia M. S. tiene una pulpería en la cual ella vende de todo un poco, ubicada en el barrio Santa Ana contiguo al puente Walter penki, La señora M. nesecitaba el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su pulpería ya que casi no tenia surtido, su negocio lo abre desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diario, ella es madre soltera no tiene carga pero es una señora que le gusta luchar y no depender de nadie, anteriormente trabajaba en la alcaldía pero se tuvo que renunciar ya que tanto desvelo le estaba afectando demasiado mejor solo se que da viendo su negocio en su casa.
Su negocio empezo desde hace 12 años comenzó vendiendo frutas en la puerta de su casa  para sacar adelante a sus hijos, luego ella surtió su venta hasta la fecha que es  una pulpería, tiene de trabajar con nosotros alrededor de 5 años con 29 créditos en los cuales a ella le han beneficiado bastante por que a podido remodelar su hogar y su negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Martha Eugenia M. S. tiene una pulpería en la cual ella vende de todo un poco, ubicada en el barrio Santa Ana contiguo al puente Walter penki, La señora M. nesecitaba el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su pulpería ya que casi no tenia surtido, su negocio lo abre desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diario, ella es madre soltera no tiene carga pero es una señora que le gusta luchar y no depender de nadie, anteriormente trabajaba en la alcaldía pero se tuvo que renunciar ya que tanto desvelo le estaba afectando demasiado mejor solo se que da viendo su negocio en su casa. Su negocio empezo desde hace 12 años comenzó vendiendo frutas en la puerta de su casa para sacar adelante a sus hijos, luego ella surtió su venta hasta la fecha que es una pulpería, tiene de trabajar con nosotros alrededor de 5 años con 29 créditos en los cuales a ella le han beneficiado bastante por que a podido remodelar su hogar y su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para mi negocio  ej: granos básicos, bisutería  lácteos

loans.name: Seab

texts.en: Mrs. Seab U. is 54 years old and lives in the village of Tuol Svay in Takeo province. She makes a living by growing rice on her two-hectare farm. To increase the size and quality of her crop, she has applied for a loan to buy a pump to water her crops, fertilizer and pesticide. and to hire a laborer to plow her field. Mrs. Seab U. is widow with two children; one is a farmer who helps her, and other sells groceries in the village market.

loans.use: To buy a water pump, fertilizer and pesticide and to hire laborer

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
S. Dilrabo is a young and energetic girl. She runs a business selling women’s shoes at the central market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Her shoe sales business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Dilrabo has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for three years. Dilrabo would like to get a loan of $2000 to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Dilrabo achieve her goals, sustain her success and win as an entrepreneur.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital to continue to develop her business.

loans.name: Ledovina

texts.es: Ledovina, de 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 jóvenes  hijos, en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a atender su negocio de repuestos  para autos, es consciente que se debe a sus clientes, y siempre  trata de atenderlos con mucha amabilidad. Sus ventas han mejorado bastante con respecto a los años anteriores, y reconoce que le falta mucho por mejorar. Normalmente trabaja junto con su esposo; y su negocio está bien posicionado en la localidad; es por eso que  atiende desde las 5  de la mañana hasta las 10  de la noche. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar  un taller que brinde mantenimiento a  todo tipo de autos, y ya pensó que su esposo se encargará  del negocio.Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos, además se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes se apoyan mutuamente. Ledovina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de  cantidad de repuestos para autos que necesita para  atender la constante demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ledovina, age 34, lives with her husband and four young children in their own home. Ledovina's business is auto parts sales; she knows that she owes everything to her clients, and for this reason she always tries to provide them with the best care. Her sales have increased substantially compared with prior years, yet Ledovina recognizes that there is much she can do to improve. Usually, Ledovina works together with her husband; their business is well-positioned in the town, and, because of this, she works from 5 in the morning until 10 at night. In the future, Ledovina is planning to set up an auto-repair shop that will provide maintenance services to all types of cars; she is thinking that her husband will be responsible for the repair shop. This is Ledovina's third loan with MFP, and she is committed to be timely with her repayments. Furthermore, she feels very happy with the work of her communal bank since all the members provide support to each other. Ledovina plans to invest the loan into the purchase of additional auto parts inventory that she needs to satisfy the steady demand from her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts inventory

loans.name: Yngrid Fiorella

texts.es:
Yngrid es una madre de familia de 21 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío La Coruña del distrito de Tambogrande,un distrito cuya actividad predominante es el cultivo de frutas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de prendas de vestir para niños en su domicilio, ella adquiere sus productos en base a pedidos y los distribuye entre sus vecinos y algunos conocidos de la zona. Adicionalmente vende cerveza a sus vecinos. Este negocio le hace sentirse activa y se vale de él para ayudar a su esposo con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Yngrid desea ampliar su negocio de compra y venta de prendas de vestir con la compra de más mercadería para seguir ofreciéndola a sus clientes, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando junto a su esposo y juntos salir adelante. El tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro le han hecho una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona.
texts.en:
Yngrid is a 21 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the village of La Coruña in Tambogrande District. The predominant business activity in this district is fruit production. This community lies in the province and region of Piura and is located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Yngrid has been selling children’s clothing out of her home for the past year. She acquires her products according to the orders she receives and distributes them among her neighbors and a few acquaintances in the area. In addition, she sells beer to her neighbors. This business helps her to feel active and enables her to support her husband in maintaining their household.

Yngrid wants to expand her business of buying and selling clothing, so she plans to acquire more merchandise to offer to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 400 PEN to meet this goal.

She is a dynamic and hardworking woman. Her greatest wish is to continue working with her husband so that they can move forward together. Throughout the entire time she has been in business, Yngrid has become a woman who is well-known and respected by her neighbors in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn S. is from the village of  Wao Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Ronelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. Ronelyn owns & operates a variety store where she sells electronic goods, hair accessories for girls and more. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ronelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ronelyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ronelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Casildo

texts.es:
El Sr. Casildo O. de 29 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Antonia Espínola de 27 años de edad, ellos tiene la dicha de tener 1 hija.
   Don Casildo comenzó con este rubro  aproximadamente en el año 2008; después de haber estado como empleado durante más de 4 años, juntando poco a poco el dinero de su salario y comprando algunas máquinas.
 Decidió habilitar su taller de chapería y pintura, ya que el tenia todas las herramientas y máquinas necesarias para ofrecer sus servicios;  en la actualidad el trabaja con empresas que se dedica a la venta de autos usados.
   El invertirá este crédito en la compra insumos (masillas, pinturas, material para polarizados, etc.) en cantidad, para abaratar los costos de sus servicios y generar más utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Casildo O., 29, is married to Ms. Antonia Espínola, 27. They have one daughter. Casildo started his business in 2008. He worked as an employee for more than four years, slowly saving some money and buying some tools. He decided to open his own auto collision repair shop since he already owned the necessary tools to do the work. Today, he works closely with companies that sell used cars. Alcides will use this loan to buy needed materials (paint, window tinting materials, epoxy, etc.) at wholesale prices in order to save money and increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying needed materials for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa N. lives in the Naguru neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member. She lives in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Kasifa has a business selling yellow bananas in Nakawa Market. She has been in this business for ten years, and works three days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy additional bunches of yellow bananas.

Kasifa’s main business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of bananas. Her goals and aspirations are to increase the size of her business and obtain additional capital.

Kasifa decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital and because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine L. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Jasmine is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jasmine owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Jasmine has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jasmine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair an existing engine. Jasmine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jasmine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: yawa est une femme divorcée qui a une personne à sa charge, l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges est le commerce de produits génériques, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante et l'a commencé en 2007. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. le crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre de s'approvisionner avec 4 cartons de produits génériques.
texts.en:
Yawa is a divorced woman with one dependent. She makes a living by selling basic need goods. She has been working as a street vendor since 2007. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé. The loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase fours boxes of various basic need goods.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing four boxes of basic need goods

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mr. Theary V., and his wife, Mrs. Soklim Nao, live in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2003. Mr. Theary V. has been selling cows for over more than 20 years, buying them from his villagers and the nearby district for resale to a middleman who comes to buy them at his house.

Having already benefited from one Kiva loan, Theary hopes to continue expanding his business and better support his family. He is therefore applying for his second loan of $1,000 to purchase cows for resale.

Mr. Theary V. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Lilian is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maryori Del Rosio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Maryorie, tiene 39 años de edad, ella está casada y  tiene 6 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad aunque cinco de ellos viven con ella. Su marido es ebanista.

Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería donde realizan trabajo a base de madera como muebles, sillas y camas pero en lo que se especializan es en la elaboración de muebles para maquinas de coser, este negocio lo mantiene desde hace 25 años en la misma parroquia y en su propia casa, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 17h00. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta donde encuentra la madera que necesita para sus obras.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera en especial la de Laurel que es la que el utiliza en sus obras. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido salir de muchas situaciones difíciles en su negocio y en su vida personal. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande e industrializado.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

We find Maryorie here.  She is 39 years old, married and has 6 children.  Three of them are adults but five still live with her.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Her husband has a workshop where he makes all kinds of wood-based items like furniture, chairs and beds but his specialty is making furniture for sewing machines.  He has had this business for 25 years in the same parish and in his home.  He works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm. The wood is purchased from a wood deposit in Manta where he can find all the wood he needs for his jobs. This loan will be used to buy wood, specifically laurel, which is what he uses for his works.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because it’s been thanks to the loans that she’s been able to get out of difficult business and personal situations.  Her dream is to have a larger, industrialized workshop.

loans.use: To buy laurel wood.

loans.name: Ulpiana

texts.en:
Ulpiana M. is from the village of Bulwa, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 71 years old. Ulpiana is widowed. To make a living, Ulpiana owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas and coconuts in the local community. Ulpiana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Ulpiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ulpiana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to  buy and sell. Ulpiana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ulpiana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family. He has been working in construction for the past five years. He is specialized in smoothing building boards. He works on a freelance basis upon request of his clients. He participates in covering the family expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase scaffolding for his business. He believes that the loan amount will be very useful for his business needs. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding
